00007 //Going sloppy to avoid 'use strict' string cost, but strict practices should
00008 //be followed.
00009 /*jslint sloppy: true, nomen: true, regexp: true */
00010 /*global setTimeout, process, document, navigator, importScripts */
00011 
00012 var requirejs, require, define;
00013 (function (global, undef) {
00014     var prim, topReq, dataMain,
00015         bootstrapConfig = requirejs || require,
00016         hasOwn = Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty,
00017         contexts = {},
00018         queue = [],
00019         currDirRegExp = /^\.\//,
00020         urlRegExp = /^\/|\:|\?|\.js$/,
00021         commentRegExp = /(\/\*([\s\S]*?)\*\/|([^:]|^)\/\/(.*)$)/mg,
00022         cjsRequireRegExp = /[^.]\s*require\s*\(\s*["']([^'"\s]+)["']\s*\)/g,
00023         jsSuffixRegExp = /\.js$/;
00024 
00025     if (typeof requirejs === 'function') {
00026         return;
00027     }
00028 
00029     function hasProp(obj, prop) {
00030         return hasOwn.call(obj, prop);
00031     }
00032 
00033     function getOwn(obj, prop) {
00034         return obj && hasProp(obj, prop) && obj[prop];
00035     }
00036 
00042     function eachProp(obj, func) {
00043         var prop;
00044         for (prop in obj) {
00045             if (hasProp(obj, prop)) {
00046                 if (func(obj[prop], prop)) {
00047                     break;
00048                 }
00049             }
00050         }
00051     }
00052 
00057     function mixin(target, source, force, deepStringMixin) {
00058         if (source) {
00059             eachProp(source, function (value, prop) {
00060                 if (force || !hasProp(target, prop)) {
00061                     if (deepStringMixin && typeof value !== 'string') {
00062                         if (!target[prop]) {
00063                             target[prop] = {};
00064                         }
00065                         mixin(target[prop], value, force, deepStringMixin);
00066                     } else {
00067                         target[prop] = value;
00068                     }
00069                 }
00070             });
00071         }
00072         return target;
00073     }
00074 
00075     //Allow getting a global that expressed in
00076     //dot notation, like 'a.b.c'.
00077     function getGlobal(value) {
00078         if (!value) {
00079             return value;
00080         }
00081         var g = global;
00082         value.split('.').forEach(function (part) {
00083             g = g[part];
00084         });
00085         return g;
00086     }
00087 
00088     //START prim
00102     /*global setImmediate, process, setTimeout */
00103     (function () {
00104         'use strict';
00105         var waitingId,
00106             waiting = [];
00107 
00108         function check(p) {
00109             if (hasProp(p, 'e') || hasProp(p, 'v')) {
00110                 throw new Error('nope');
00111             }
00112             return true;
00113         }
00114 
00115         function callWaiting() {
00116             waitingId = 0;
00117             var w = waiting;
00118             waiting = [];
00119             while (w.length) {
00120                 w.shift()();
00121             }
00122         }
00123 
00124         function asyncTick(fn) {
00125             waiting.push(fn);
00126             if (!waitingId) {
00127                 waitingId = setTimeout(callWaiting, 0);
00128             }
00129         }
00130 
00131         function notify(ary, value) {
00132             prim.nextTick(function () {
00133                 ary.forEach(function (item) {
00134                     item(value);
00135                 });
00136             });
00137         }
00138 
00139         prim = function prim() {
00140             var p,
00141                 ok = [],
00142                 fail = [];
00143 
00144             return (p = {
00145                 callback: function (yes, no) {
00146                     if (no) {
00147                         p.errback(no);
00148                     }
00149 
00150                     if (hasProp(p, 'v')) {
00151                         prim.nextTick(function () {
00152                             yes(p.v);
00153                         });
00154                     } else {
00155                         ok.push(yes);
00156                     }
00157                 },
00158 
00159                 errback: function (no) {
00160                     if (hasProp(p, 'e')) {
00161                         prim.nextTick(function () {
00162                             no(p.e);
00163                         });
00164                     } else {
00165                         fail.push(no);
00166                     }
00167                 },
00168 
00169                 finished: function () {
00170                     return hasProp(p, 'e') || hasProp(p, 'v');
00171                 },
00172 
00173                 rejected: function () {
00174                     return hasProp(p, 'e');
00175                 },
00176 
00177                 resolve: function (v) {
00178                     if (check(p)) {
00179                         p.v = v;
00180                         notify(ok, v);
00181                     }
00182                     return p;
00183                 },
00184                 reject: function (e) {
00185                     if (check(p)) {
00186                         p.e = e;
00187                         notify(fail, e);
00188                     }
00189                     return p;
00190                 },
00191 
00192                 start: function (fn) {
00193                     p.resolve();
00194                     return p.promise.then(fn);
00195                 },
00196 
00197                 promise: {
00198                     then: function (yes, no) {
00199                         var next = prim();
00200 
00201                         p.callback(function (v) {
00202                             try {
00203                                 if (yes && typeof yes === 'function') {
00204                                     v = yes(v);
00205                                 }
00206 
00207                                 if (v && typeof v.then === 'function') {
00208                                     v.then(next.resolve, next.reject);
00209                                 } else {
00210                                     next.resolve(v);
00211                                 }
00212                             } catch (e) {
00213                                 next.reject(e);
00214                             }
00215                         }, function (e) {
00216                             var err;
00217 
00218                             try {
00219                                 if (!no || typeof no !== 'function') {
00220                                     next.reject(e);
00221                                 } else {
00222                                     err = no(e);
00223 
00224                                     if (err && typeof err.then === 'function') {
00225                                         err.then(next.resolve, next.reject);
00226                                     } else {
00227                                         next.resolve(err);
00228                                     }
00229                                 }
00230                             } catch (e2) {
00231                                 next.reject(e2);
00232                             }
00233                         });
00234 
00235                         return next.promise;
00236                     },
00237 
00238                     fail: function (no) {
00239                         return p.promise.then(null, no);
00240                     },
00241 
00242                     end: function () {
00243                         p.errback(function (e) {
00244                             throw e;
00245                         });
00246                     }
00247                 }
00248             });
00249         };
00250 
00251         prim.serial = function (ary) {
00252             var result = prim().resolve().promise;
00253             ary.forEach(function (item) {
00254                 result = result.then(function () {
00255                     return item();
00256                 });
00257             });
00258             return result;
00259         };
00260 
00261         prim.nextTick = typeof setImmediate === 'function' ? setImmediate :
00262             (typeof process !== 'undefined' && process.nextTick ?
00263                 process.nextTick : (typeof setTimeout !== 'undefined' ?
00264                     asyncTick : function (fn) {
00265             fn();
00266         }));
00267     }());
00268     //END prim
00269 
00270     function newContext(contextName) {
00271         var req, main, makeMap, callDep, handlers, loadTimeId, load, context,
00272             defined = {},
00273             waiting = {},
00274             config = {
00275                 //Defaults. Do not set a default for map
00276                 //config to speed up normalize(), which
00277                 //will run faster if there is no default.
00278                 waitSeconds: 7,
00279                 baseUrl: './',
00280                 paths: {},
00281                 pkgs: {},
00282                 shim: {},
00283                 config: {}
00284             },
00285             requireDeferreds = [],
00286             deferreds = {},
00287             calledDefine = {},
00288             calledPlugin = {},
00289             loadCount = 0,
00290             startTime = (new Date()).getTime(),
00291             errCount = 0,
00292             trackedErrors = {},
00293             urlFetched = {};
00294 
00304         function trimDots(ary) {
00305             var i, part;
00306             for (i = 0; ary[i]; i += 1) {
00307                 part = ary[i];
00308                 if (part === '.') {
00309                     ary.splice(i, 1);
00310                     i -= 1;
00311                 } else if (part === '..') {
00312                     if (i === 1 && (ary[2] === '..' || ary[0] === '..')) {
00313                         //End of the line. Keep at least one non-dot
00314                         //path segment at the front so it can be mapped
00315                         //correctly to disk. Otherwise, there is likely
00316                         //no path mapping for a path starting with '..'.
00317                         //This can still fail, but catches the most reasonable
00318                         //uses of ..
00319                         break;
00320                     } else if (i > 0) {
00321                         ary.splice(i - 1, 2);
00322                         i -= 2;
00323                     }
00324                 }
00325             }
00326         }
00327 
00338         function normalize(name, baseName, applyMap) {
00339             var pkgName, pkgConfig, mapValue, nameParts, i, j, nameSegment,
00340                 foundMap, foundI, foundStarMap, starI,
00341                 baseParts = baseName && baseName.split('/'),
00342                 normalizedBaseParts = baseParts,
00343                 map = applyMap && config.map,
00344                 starMap = map && map['*'];
00345 
00346             //Adjust any relative paths.
00347             if (name && name.charAt(0) === '.') {
00348                 //If have a base name, try to normalize against it,
00349                 //otherwise, assume it is a top-level require that will
00350                 //be relative to baseUrl in the end.
00351                 if (baseName) {
00352                     if (getOwn(config.pkgs, baseName)) {
00353                         //If the baseName is a package name, then just treat it as one
00354                         //name to concat the name with.
00355                         normalizedBaseParts = baseParts = [baseName];
00356                     } else {
00357                         //Convert baseName to array, and lop off the last part,
00358                         //so that . matches that 'directory' and not name of the baseName's
00359                         //module. For instance, baseName of 'one/two/three', maps to
00360                         //'one/two/three.js', but we want the directory, 'one/two' for
00361                         //this normalization.
00362                         normalizedBaseParts = baseParts.slice(0, baseParts.length - 1);
00363                     }
00364 
00365                     name = normalizedBaseParts.concat(name.split('/'));
00366                     trimDots(name);
00367 
00368                     //Some use of packages may use a . path to reference the
00369                     //'main' module name, so normalize for that.
00370                     pkgConfig = getOwn(config.pkgs, (pkgName = name[0]));
00371                     name = name.join('/');
00372                     if (pkgConfig && name === pkgName + '/' + pkgConfig.main) {
00373                         name = pkgName;
00374                     }
00375                 } else if (name.indexOf('./') === 0) {
00376                     // No baseName, so this is ID is resolved relative
00377                     // to baseUrl, pull off the leading dot.
00378                     name = name.substring(2);
00379                 }
00380             }
00381 
00382             //Apply map config if available.
00383             if (applyMap && (baseParts || starMap) && map) {
00384                 nameParts = name.split('/');
00385 
00386                 for (i = nameParts.length; i > 0; i -= 1) {
00387                     nameSegment = nameParts.slice(0, i).join('/');
00388 
00389                     if (baseParts) {
00390                         //Find the longest baseName segment match in the config.
00391                         //So, do joins on the biggest to smallest lengths of baseParts.
00392                         for (j = baseParts.length; j > 0; j -= 1) {
00393                             mapValue = getOwn(map, baseParts.slice(0, j).join('/'));
00394 
00395                             //baseName segment has config, find if it has one for
00396                             //this name.
00397                             if (mapValue) {
00398                                 mapValue = getOwn(mapValue, nameSegment);
00399                                 if (mapValue) {
00400                                     //Match, update name to the new value.
00401                                     foundMap = mapValue;
00402                                     foundI = i;
00403                                     break;
00404                                 }
00405                             }
00406                         }
00407                     }
00408 
00409                     if (foundMap) {
00410                         break;
00411                     }
00412 
00413                     //Check for a star map match, but just hold on to it,
00414                     //if there is a shorter segment match later in a matching
00415                     //config, then favor over this star map.
00416                     if (!foundStarMap && starMap && getOwn(starMap, nameSegment)) {
00417                         foundStarMap = getOwn(starMap, nameSegment);
00418                         starI = i;
00419                     }
00420                 }
00421 
00422                 if (!foundMap && foundStarMap) {
00423                     foundMap = foundStarMap;
00424                     foundI = starI;
00425                 }
00426 
00427                 if (foundMap) {
00428                     nameParts.splice(0, foundI, foundMap);
00429                     name = nameParts.join('/');
00430                 }
00431             }
00432 
00433             return name;
00434         }
00435 
00436 
00437         function makeShimExports(value) {
00438             function fn() {
00439                 var ret;
00440                 if (value.init) {
00441                     ret = value.init.apply(global, arguments);
00442                 }
00443                 return ret || (value.exports && getGlobal(value.exports));
00444             }
00445             return fn;
00446         }
00447 
00448         function takeQueue(anonId) {
00449             var i, id, args, shim;
00450             for (i = 0; i < queue.length; i += 1) {
00451                 //Peek to see if anon
00452                 if (typeof queue[i][0] !== 'string') {
00453                     if (anonId) {
00454                         queue[i].unshift(anonId);
00455                         anonId = undef;
00456                     } else {
00457                         //Not our anon module, stop.
00458                         break;
00459                     }
00460                 }
00461                 args = queue.shift();
00462                 id = args[0];
00463                 i -= 1;
00464 
00465                 if (!hasProp(defined, id) && !hasProp(waiting, id)) {
00466                     if (hasProp(deferreds, id)) {
00467                         main.apply(undef, args);
00468                     } else {
00469                         waiting[id] = args;
00470                     }
00471                 }
00472             }
00473 
00474             //if get to the end and still have anonId, then could be
00475             //a shimmed dependency.
00476             if (anonId) {
00477                 shim = getOwn(config.shim, anonId) || {};
00478                 main(anonId, shim.deps || [], shim.exportsFn);
00479             }
00480         }
00481 
00482         function makeRequire(relName, topLevel) {
00483             var req = function (deps, callback, errback, alt) {
00484                 var name, cfg;
00485 
00486                 if (topLevel) {
00487                     takeQueue();
00488                 }
00489 
00490                 if (typeof deps === "string") {
00491                     if (handlers[deps]) {
00492                         return handlers[deps](relName);
00493                     }
00494                     //Just return the module wanted. In this scenario, the
00495                     //deps arg is the module name, and second arg (if passed)
00496                     //is just the relName.
00497                     //Normalize module name, if it contains . or ..
00498                     name = makeMap(deps, relName, true).id;
00499                     if (!hasProp(defined, name)) {
00500                         throw new Error('Not loaded: ' + name);
00501                     }
00502                     return defined[name];
00503                 } else if (deps && !Array.isArray(deps)) {
00504                     //deps is a config object, not an array.
00505                     cfg = deps;
00506                     deps = undef;
00507 
00508                     if (Array.isArray(callback)) {
00509                         //callback is an array, which means it is a dependency list.
00510                         //Adjust args if there are dependencies
00511                         deps = callback;
00512                         callback = errback;
00513                         errback = alt;
00514                     }
00515 
00516                     if (topLevel) {
00517                         //Could be a new context, so call returned require
00518                         return req.config(cfg)(deps, callback, errback);
00519                     }
00520                 }
00521 
00522                 //Support require(['a'])
00523                 callback = callback || function () {};
00524 
00525                 //Simulate async callback;
00526                 prim.nextTick(function () {
00527                     //Grab any modules that were defined after a
00528                     //require call.
00529                     takeQueue();
00530                     main(undef, deps || [], callback, errback, relName);
00531                 });
00532 
00533                 return req;
00534             };
00535 
00536             req.isBrowser = typeof document !== 'undefined' &&
00537                 typeof navigator !== 'undefined';
00538 
00539             req.nameToUrl = function (moduleName, ext) {
00540                 var paths, pkgs, pkg, pkgPath, syms, i, parentModule, url,
00541                     parentPath;
00542 
00543                 //If a colon is in the URL, it indicates a protocol is used and it is just
00544                 //an URL to a file, or if it starts with a slash, contains a query arg (i.e. ?)
00545                 //or ends with .js, then assume the user meant to use an url and not a module id.
00546                 //The slash is important for protocol-less URLs as well as full paths.
00547                 if (urlRegExp.test(moduleName)) {
00548                     //Just a plain path, not module name lookup, so just return it.
00549                     //Add extension if it is included. This is a bit wonky, only non-.js things pass
00550                     //an extension, this method probably needs to be reworked.
00551                     url = moduleName + (ext || '');
00552                 } else {
00553                     //A module that needs to be converted to a path.
00554                     paths = config.paths;
00555                     pkgs = config.pkgs;
00556 
00557                     syms = moduleName.split('/');
00558                     //For each module name segment, see if there is a path
00559                     //registered for it. Start with most specific name
00560                     //and work up from it.
00561                     for (i = syms.length; i > 0; i -= 1) {
00562                         parentModule = syms.slice(0, i).join('/');
00563                         pkg = getOwn(pkgs, parentModule);
00564                         parentPath = getOwn(paths, parentModule);
00565                         if (parentPath) {
00566                             //If an array, it means there are a few choices,
00567                             //Choose the one that is desired
00568                             if (Array.isArray(parentPath)) {
00569                                 parentPath = parentPath[0];
00570                             }
00571                             syms.splice(0, i, parentPath);
00572                             break;
00573                         } else if (pkg) {
00574                             //If module name is just the package name, then looking
00575                             //for the main module.
00576                             if (moduleName === pkg.name) {
00577                                 pkgPath = pkg.location + '/' + pkg.main;
00578                             } else {
00579                                 pkgPath = pkg.location;
00580                             }
00581                             syms.splice(0, i, pkgPath);
00582                             break;
00583                         }
00584                     }
00585 
00586                     //Join the path parts together, then figure out if baseUrl is needed.
00587                     url = syms.join('/');
00588                     url += (ext || (/\?/.test(url) ? '' : '.js'));
00589                     url = (url.charAt(0) === '/' || url.match(/^[\w\+\.\-]+:/) ? '' : config.baseUrl) + url;
00590                 }
00591 
00592                 return config.urlArgs ? url +
00593                                         ((url.indexOf('?') === -1 ? '?' : '&') +
00594                                          config.urlArgs) : url;
00595             };
00596 
00602             req.toUrl = function (moduleNamePlusExt) {
00603                 var index = moduleNamePlusExt.lastIndexOf('.'),
00604                     ext = null;
00605 
00606                 if (index !== -1) {
00607                     ext = moduleNamePlusExt.substring(index, moduleNamePlusExt.length);
00608                     moduleNamePlusExt = moduleNamePlusExt.substring(0, index);
00609                 }
00610 
00611                 return req.nameToUrl(normalize(moduleNamePlusExt, relName), ext);
00612             };
00613 
00614             req.defined = function (id) {
00615                 return hasProp(defined, makeMap(id, relName, true).id);
00616             };
00617 
00618             req.specified = function (id) {
00619                 id = makeMap(id, relName, true).id;
00620                 return hasProp(defined, id) || hasProp(deferreds, id);
00621             };
00622 
00623             return req;
00624         }
00625 
00626         function resolve(name, d, value) {
00627             if (name) {
00628                 defined[name] = value;
00629             }
00630             d.resolve(value);
00631         }
00632 
00633         function makeNormalize(relName) {
00634             return function (name) {
00635                 return normalize(name, relName, true);
00636             };
00637         }
00638 
00639         function defineModule(d) {
00640             var name = d.map.id,
00641                 ret = d.factory.apply(defined[name], d.values);
00642 
00643             if (name) {
00644                 //If setting exports via "module" is in play,
00645                 //favor that over return value and exports.
00646                 //After that, favor a non-undefined return
00647                 //value over exports use.
00648                 if (d.cjsModule && d.cjsModule.exports !== undef &&
00649                         d.cjsModule.exports !== defined[name]) {
00650                     ret = d.cjsModule.exports;
00651                 } else if (ret === undef && d.usingExports) {
00652                     ret = defined[name];
00653                 }
00654                 resolve(name, d, ret);
00655             } else {
00656                 d.resolve();
00657             }
00658         }
00659 
00660         //This method is attached to every module deferred,
00661         //so the "this" in here is the module deferred object.
00662         function depFinished(val, i) {
00663             if (!this.rejected() && !this.depDefined[i]) {
00664                 this.depDefined[i] = true;
00665                 this.depCount += 1;
00666                 this.values[i] = val;
00667                 if (this.depCount === this.depMax) {
00668                     defineModule(this);
00669                 }
00670             }
00671         }
00672 
00673         function makeDefer(name) {
00674             var d = prim();
00675             d.map = name ? makeMap(name, null, true) : {};
00676             d.depCount = 0;
00677             d.depMax = 0;
00678             d.values = [];
00679             d.depDefined = [];
00680             d.depFinished = depFinished;
00681             if (d.map.pr) {
00682                 //Plugin resource ID, implicitly
00683                 //depends on plugin. Track it in deps
00684                 //so cycle breaking can work
00685                 d.deps = [makeMap(d.map.pr)];
00686             }
00687             return d;
00688         }
00689 
00690         function getDefer(name) {
00691             var d;
00692             if (name) {
00693                 d = hasProp(deferreds, name) && deferreds[name];
00694                 if (!d) {
00695                     d = deferreds[name] = makeDefer(name);
00696                 }
00697             } else {
00698                 d = makeDefer();
00699                 requireDeferreds.push(d);
00700             }
00701             return d;
00702         }
00703 
00704         function makeErrback(d, name) {
00705             return function (err) {
00706                 if (!d.rejected()) {
00707                     if (!err.dynaId) {
00708                         err.dynaId = 'id' + (errCount += 1);
00709                         err.requireModules = [name];
00710                     }
00711                     d.reject(err);
00712                 }
00713             };
00714         }
00715 
00716         function waitForDep(depMap, relName, d, i) {
00717             d.depMax += 1;
00718 
00719             //Do the fail at the end to catch errors
00720             //in the then callback execution.
00721             callDep(depMap, relName).then(function (val) {
00722                 d.depFinished(val, i);
00723             }, makeErrback(d, depMap.id)).fail(makeErrback(d, d.map.id));
00724         }
00725 
00726         function makeLoad(id) {
00727             var fromTextCalled;
00728             function load(value) {
00729                 //Protect against older plugins that call load after
00730                 //calling load.fromText
00731                 if (!fromTextCalled) {
00732                     resolve(id, getDefer(id), value);
00733                 }
00734             }
00735 
00736             load.error = function (err) {
00737                 getDefer(id).reject(err);
00738             };
00739 
00740             load.fromText = function (text, textAlt) {
00741                 /*jslint evil: true */
00742                 var d = getDefer(id),
00743                     map = makeMap(makeMap(id).n),
00744                     plainId = map.id;
00745 
00746                 fromTextCalled = true;
00747 
00748                 //Set up the factory just to be a return of the value from
00749                 //plainId.
00750                 d.factory = function (p, val) {
00751                     return val;
00752                 };
00753 
00754                 //As of requirejs 2.1.0, support just passing the text, to reinforce
00755                 //fromText only being called once per resource. Still
00756                 //support old style of passing moduleName but discard
00757                 //that moduleName in favor of the internal ref.
00758                 if (textAlt) {
00759                     text = textAlt;
00760                 }
00761 
00762                 //Transfer any config to this other module.
00763                 if (hasProp(config.config, id)) {
00764                     config.config[plainId] = config.config[id];
00765                 }
00766 
00767                 try {
00768                     req.exec(text);
00769                 } catch (e) {
00770                     throw new Error('fromText eval for ' + plainId +
00771                                     ' failed: ' + e);
00772                 }
00773 
00774                 //Execute any waiting define created by the plainId
00775                 takeQueue(plainId);
00776 
00777                 //Mark this as a dependency for the plugin
00778                 //resource
00779                 d.deps = [map];
00780                 waitForDep(map, null, d, d.deps.length);
00781             };
00782 
00783             return load;
00784         }
00785 
00786         load = typeof importScripts === 'function' ?
00787                 function (map) {
00788                     var url = map.url;
00789                     if (urlFetched[url]) {
00790                         return;
00791                     }
00792                     urlFetched[url] = true;
00793 
00794                     //Ask for the deferred so loading is triggered.
00795                     //Do this before loading, since loading is sync.
00796                     getDefer(map.id);
00797                     importScripts(url);
00798                     takeQueue(map.id);
00799                 } :
00800                 function (map) {
00801                     var script,
00802                         id = map.id,
00803                         url = map.url;
00804 
00805                     if (urlFetched[url]) {
00806                         return;
00807                     }
00808                     urlFetched[url] = true;
00809 
00810                     script = document.createElement('script');
00811                     script.setAttribute('data-requiremodule', id);
00812                     script.type = config.scriptType || 'text/javascript';
00813                     script.charset = 'utf-8';
00814                     script.async = true;
00815 
00816                     loadCount += 1;
00817 
00818                     script.addEventListener('load', function () {
00819                         loadCount -= 1;
00820                         takeQueue(id);
00821                     }, false);
00822                     script.addEventListener('error', function () {
00823                         loadCount -= 1;
00824                         var err,
00825                             pathConfig = getOwn(config.paths, id),
00826                             d = getOwn(deferreds, id);
00827                         if (pathConfig && Array.isArray(pathConfig) && pathConfig.length > 1) {
00828                             script.parentNode.removeChild(script);
00829                             //Pop off the first array value, since it failed, and
00830                             //retry
00831                             pathConfig.shift();
00832                             d.map = makeMap(id);
00833                             load(d.map);
00834                         } else {
00835                             err = new Error('Load failed: ' + id + ': ' + script.url);
00836                             err.requireModules = [id];
00837                             getDefer(id).reject(err);
00838                         }
00839                     }, false);
00840 
00841                     script.src = url;
00842 
00843                     document.head.appendChild(script);
00844                 };
00845 
00846         function callPlugin(plugin, map, relName) {
00847             plugin.load(map.n, makeRequire(relName), makeLoad(map.id), {});
00848         }
00849 
00850         callDep = function (map, relName) {
00851             var args,
00852                 name = map.id,
00853                 shim = config.shim[name];
00854 
00855             if (hasProp(waiting, name)) {
00856                 args = waiting[name];
00857                 delete waiting[name];
00858                 main.apply(undef, args);
00859             } else if (!hasProp(deferreds, name)) {
00860                 if (map.pr) {
00861                     return callDep(makeMap(map.pr)).then(function (plugin) {
00862                         //Redo map now that plugin is known to be loaded
00863                         var newMap = makeMap(name, relName, true),
00864                             newId = newMap.id,
00865                             shim = getOwn(config.shim, newId);
00866 
00867                         //Make sure to only call load once per resource. Many
00868                         //calls could have been queued waiting for plugin to load.
00869                         if (!hasProp(calledPlugin, newId)) {
00870                             calledPlugin[newId] = true;
00871                             if (shim && shim.deps) {
00872                                 req(shim.deps, function () {
00873                                     callPlugin(plugin, newMap, relName);
00874                                 });
00875                             } else {
00876                                 callPlugin(plugin, newMap, relName);
00877                             }
00878                         }
00879                         return getDefer(newId).promise;
00880                     });
00881                 } else if (shim && shim.deps) {
00882                     req(shim.deps, function () {
00883                         load(map);
00884                     });
00885                 } else {
00886                     load(map);
00887                 }
00888             }
00889 
00890             return getDefer(name).promise;
00891         };
00892 
00893         //Turns a plugin!resource to [plugin, resource]
00894         //with the plugin being undefined if the name
00895         //did not have a plugin prefix.
00896         function splitPrefix(name) {
00897             var prefix,
00898                 index = name ? name.indexOf('!') : -1;
00899             if (index > -1) {
00900                 prefix = name.substring(0, index);
00901                 name = name.substring(index + 1, name.length);
00902             }
00903             return [prefix, name];
00904         }
00905 
00911         makeMap = function (name, relName, applyMap) {
00912             if (typeof name !== 'string') {
00913                 return name;
00914             }
00915 
00916             var plugin, url,
00917                 parts = splitPrefix(name),
00918                 prefix = parts[0];
00919 
00920             name = parts[1];
00921 
00922             if (prefix) {
00923                 prefix = normalize(prefix, relName, applyMap);
00924                 plugin = hasProp(defined, prefix) && defined[prefix];
00925             }
00926 
00927             //Normalize according
00928             if (prefix) {
00929                 if (plugin && plugin.normalize) {
00930                     name = plugin.normalize(name, makeNormalize(relName));
00931                 } else {
00932                     name = normalize(name, relName, applyMap);
00933                 }
00934             } else {
00935                 name = normalize(name, relName, applyMap);
00936                 parts = splitPrefix(name);
00937                 prefix = parts[0];
00938                 name = parts[1];
00939 
00940                 url = req.nameToUrl(name);
00941             }
00942 
00943             //Using ridiculous property names for space reasons
00944             return {
00945                 id: prefix ? prefix + '!' + name : name, //fullName
00946                 n: name,
00947                 pr: prefix,
00948                 url: url
00949             };
00950         };
00951 
00952         function makeConfig(name) {
00953             return function () {
00954                 return config.config[name] || {};
00955             };
00956         }
00957 
00958         handlers = {
00959             require: function (name) {
00960                 return makeRequire(name);
00961             },
00962             exports: function (name) {
00963                 var e = defined[name];
00964                 if (typeof e !== 'undefined') {
00965                     return e;
00966                 } else {
00967                     return (defined[name] = {});
00968                 }
00969             },
00970             module: function (name) {
00971                 return {
00972                     id: name,
00973                     uri: '',
00974                     exports: defined[name],
00975                     config: makeConfig(name)
00976                 };
00977             }
00978         };
00979 
00980         function breakCycle(d, traced, processed) {
00981             var id = d.map.id;
00982 
00983             traced[id] = true;
00984             if (!d.finished() && d.deps) {
00985                 d.deps.forEach(function (depMap) {
00986                     var depIndex,
00987                         depId = depMap.id,
00988                         dep = !hasProp(handlers, depId) && getDefer(depId);
00989 
00990                     //Only force things that have not completed
00991                     //being defined, so still in the registry,
00992                     //and only if it has not been matched up
00993                     //in the module already.
00994                     if (dep && !dep.finished() && !processed[depId]) {
00995                         if (hasProp(traced, depId)) {
00996                             d.deps.some(function (depMap, i) {
00997                                 if (depMap.id === depId) {
00998                                     depIndex = i;
00999                                     return true;
01000                                 }
01001                             });
01002                             d.depFinished(defined[depId], depIndex);
01003                         } else {
01004                             breakCycle(dep, traced, processed);
01005                         }
01006                     }
01007                 });
01008             }
01009             processed[id] = true;
01010         }
01011 
01012         function check() {
01013             loadTimeId = 0;
01014 
01015             var err,
01016                 reqDefs = [],
01017                 noLoads = [],
01018                 waitInterval = config.waitSeconds * 1000,
01019                 //It is possible to disable the wait interval by using waitSeconds of 0.
01020                 expired = waitInterval && (startTime + waitInterval) < (new Date()).getTime();
01021 
01022             if (loadCount === 0) {
01023                 reqDefs = requireDeferreds.filter(function (d) {
01024                     //Only want deferreds that have not finished.
01025                     return !d.finished();
01026                 });
01027 
01028                 if (reqDefs.length) {
01029                     //Something is not resolved. Dive into it.
01030                     eachProp(deferreds, function (d) {
01031                         if (!d.finished()) {
01032                             noLoads.push(d);
01033                         }
01034                     });
01035 
01036                     if (noLoads.length) {
01037                         reqDefs.forEach(function (d) {
01038                             breakCycle(d, {}, {});
01039                         });
01040                     }
01041                 }
01042             }
01043 
01044             //If still waiting on loads, and the waiting load is something
01045             //other than a plugin resource, or there are still outstanding
01046             //scripts, then just try back later.
01047             if (expired) {
01048                 //If wait time expired, throw error of unloaded modules.
01049                 noLoads = noLoads.map(function (d) {
01050                     return d.map.id;
01051                 });
01052                 err = new Error('Timeout for modules: ' + noLoads);
01053                 err.requireModules = noLoads;
01054                 req.onError(err);
01055             } else if (loadCount || reqDefs.length) {
01056                 //Something is still waiting to load. Wait for it, but only
01057                 //if a timeout is not already in effect.
01058                 if (!loadTimeId) {
01059                     loadTimeId = prim.nextTick(check);
01060                 }
01061             }
01062         }
01063 
01064         //Used to break out of the promise try/catch chains.
01065         function delayedError(e) {
01066             prim.nextTick(function () {
01067                 if (!e.dynaId || !trackedErrors[e.dynaId]) {
01068                     trackedErrors[e.dynaId] = true;
01069                     req.onError(e);
01070                 }
01071             });
01072         }
01073 
01074         main = function (name, deps, factory, errback, relName) {
01075             //Only allow main calling once per module.
01076             if (name && hasProp(calledDefine, name)) {
01077                 return;
01078             }
01079             calledDefine[name] = true;
01080 
01081             var d = getDefer(name);
01082 
01083             //This module may not have dependencies
01084             if (deps && !Array.isArray(deps)) {
01085                 //deps is not an array, so probably means
01086                 //an object literal or factory function for
01087                 //the value. Adjust args.
01088                 factory = deps;
01089                 deps = [];
01090             }
01091 
01092             d.promise.fail(errback || delayedError);
01093 
01094             //Use name if no relName
01095             relName = relName || name;
01096 
01097             //Call the factory to define the module, if necessary.
01098             if (typeof factory === 'function') {
01099 
01100                 if (!deps.length && factory.length) {
01101                     //Remove comments from the callback string,
01102                     //look for require calls, and pull them into the dependencies,
01103                     //but only if there are function args.
01104                     factory
01105                         .toString()
01106                         .replace(commentRegExp, '')
01107                         .replace(cjsRequireRegExp, function (match, dep) {
01108                             deps.push(dep);
01109                         });
01110 
01111                     //May be a CommonJS thing even without require calls, but still
01112                     //could use exports, and module. Avoid doing exports and module
01113                     //work though if it just needs require.
01114                     //REQUIRES the function to expect the CommonJS variables in the
01115                     //order listed below.
01116                     deps = (factory.length === 1 ?
01117                             ['require'] :
01118                             ['require', 'exports', 'module']).concat(deps);
01119                 }
01120 
01121                 //Save info for use later.
01122                 d.factory = factory;
01123                 d.deps = deps;
01124 
01125                 deps.forEach(function (depName, i) {
01126                     var depMap;
01127                     deps[i] = depMap = makeMap(depName, relName, true);
01128                     depName = depMap.id;
01129 
01130                     //Fast path CommonJS standard dependencies.
01131                     if (depName === "require") {
01132                         d.values[i] = handlers.require(name);
01133                     } else if (depName === "exports") {
01134                         //CommonJS module spec 1.1
01135                         d.values[i] = handlers.exports(name);
01136                         d.usingExports = true;
01137                     } else if (depName === "module") {
01138                         //CommonJS module spec 1.1
01139                         d.values[i] = d.cjsModule = handlers.module(name);
01140                     } else {
01141                         waitForDep(depMap, relName, d, i);
01142                     }
01143                 });
01144 
01145                 //Some modules just depend on the require, exports, modules, so
01146                 //trigger their definition here if so.
01147                 if (d.depCount === d.depMax) {
01148                     defineModule(d);
01149                 }
01150             } else if (name) {
01151                 //May just be an object definition for the module. Only
01152                 //worry about defining if have a module name.
01153                 resolve(name, d, factory);
01154             }
01155 
01156             startTime = (new Date()).getTime();
01157 
01158             if (!name) {
01159                 check();
01160             }
01161         };
01162 
01163         req = makeRequire(null, true);
01164 
01165         /*
01166          * Just drops the config on the floor, but returns req in case
01167          * the config return value is used.
01168          */
01169         req.config = function (cfg) {
01170             if (cfg.context && cfg.context !== contextName) {
01171                 return newContext(cfg.context).config(cfg);
01172             }
01173 
01174             //Make sure the baseUrl ends in a slash.
01175             if (cfg.baseUrl) {
01176                 if (cfg.baseUrl.charAt(cfg.baseUrl.length - 1) !== '/') {
01177                     cfg.baseUrl += '/';
01178                 }
01179             }
01180 
01181             //Save off the paths and packages since they require special processing,
01182             //they are additive.
01183             var primId,
01184                 pkgs = config.pkgs,
01185                 shim = config.shim,
01186                 objs = {
01187                     paths: true,
01188                     config: true,
01189                     map: true
01190                 };
01191 
01192             eachProp(cfg, function (value, prop) {
01193                 if (objs[prop]) {
01194                     if (prop === 'map') {
01195                         if (!config.map) {
01196                             config.map = {};
01197                         }
01198                         mixin(config[prop], value, true, true);
01199                     } else {
01200                         mixin(config[prop], value, true);
01201                     }
01202                 } else {
01203                     config[prop] = value;
01204                 }
01205             });
01206 
01207             //Merge shim
01208             if (cfg.shim) {
01209                 eachProp(cfg.shim, function (value, id) {
01210                     //Normalize the structure
01211                     if (Array.isArray(value)) {
01212                         value = {
01213                             deps: value
01214                         };
01215                     }
01216                     if ((value.exports || value.init) && !value.exportsFn) {
01217                         value.exportsFn = makeShimExports(value);
01218                     }
01219                     shim[id] = value;
01220                 });
01221                 config.shim = shim;
01222             }
01223 
01224             //Adjust packages if necessary.
01225             if (cfg.packages) {
01226                 cfg.packages.forEach(function (pkgObj) {
01227                     var location;
01228 
01229                     pkgObj = typeof pkgObj === 'string' ? { name: pkgObj } : pkgObj;
01230                     location = pkgObj.location;
01231 
01232                     //Create a brand new object on pkgs, since currentPackages can
01233                     //be passed in again, and config.pkgs is the internal transformed
01234                     //state for all package configs.
01235                     pkgs[pkgObj.name] = {
01236                         name: pkgObj.name,
01237                         location: location || pkgObj.name,
01238                         //Remove leading dot in main, so main paths are normalized,
01239                         //and remove any trailing .js, since different package
01240                         //envs have different conventions: some use a module name,
01241                         //some use a file name.
01242                         main: (pkgObj.main || 'main')
01243                               .replace(currDirRegExp, '')
01244                               .replace(jsSuffixRegExp, '')
01245                     };
01246                 });
01247 
01248                 //Done with modifications, assing packages back to context config
01249                 config.pkgs = pkgs;
01250             }
01251 
01252             //If want prim injected, inject it now.
01253             primId = config.definePrim;
01254             if (primId) {
01255                 waiting[primId] = [primId, [], function () { return prim; }];
01256             }
01257 
01258             //If a deps array or a config callback is specified, then call
01259             //require with those args. This is useful when require is defined as a
01260             //config object before require.js is loaded.
01261             if (cfg.deps) {
01262                 req(cfg.deps, cfg.callback);
01263             }
01264 
01265             return req;
01266         };
01267 
01268         req.onError = function (err) {
01269             throw err;
01270         };
01271 
01272         context = {
01273             id: contextName,
01274             defined: defined,
01275             waiting: waiting,
01276             config: config,
01277             deferreds: deferreds
01278         };
01279 
01280         contexts[contextName] = context;
01281 
01282         return req;
01283     }
01284 
01285     requirejs = topReq = newContext('_');
01286 
01287     if (typeof require !== 'function') {
01288         require = topReq;
01289     }
01290 
01297     topReq.exec = function (text) {
01298         /*jslint evil: true */
01299         return eval(text);
01300     };
01301 
01302     topReq.contexts = contexts;
01303 
01304     define = function () {
01305         queue.push([].slice.call(arguments, 0));
01306     };
01307 
01308     define.amd = {
01309         jQuery: true
01310     };
01311 
01312     if (bootstrapConfig) {
01313         topReq.config(bootstrapConfig);
01314     }
01315 
01316     //data-main support.
01317     if (topReq.isBrowser) {
01318         dataMain = document.querySelectorAll('script[data-main]')[0];
01319         dataMain = dataMain && dataMain.getAttribute('data-main');
01320         if (dataMain) {
01321             //Strip off any trailing .js since dataMain is now
01322             //like a module name.
01323             dataMain = dataMain.replace(jsSuffixRegExp, '');
01324             topReq([dataMain]);
01325         }
01326     }
01327 }(this));
01328 
01329 define("alameda", function(){});
01330 
01331 var window = self;
01332 
01333 function consoleHelper() {
01334   var msg = arguments[0] + ':';
01335   for (var i = 1; i < arguments.length; i++) {
01336     msg += ' ' + arguments[i];
01337   }
01338   msg += '\x1b[0m\n';
01339   dump(msg);
01340 }
01341 window.console = {
01342   log: consoleHelper.bind(null, '\x1b[32mWLOG'),
01343   error: consoleHelper.bind(null, '\x1b[31mWERR'),
01344   info: consoleHelper.bind(null, '\x1b[36mWINF'),
01345   warn: consoleHelper.bind(null, '\x1b[33mWWAR')
01346 };
01347 
01348 var document = { cookie: null };
01349 
01350 define("mailapi/worker-bootstrap", function(){});
01351 
01352 // set location of dynamically loaded layers.
01353 require.config({
01354   baseUrl: '..',
01355   paths: {
01356     // mailcomposer is in the mailapi/composer layer.
01357     mailcomposer: 'mailapi/composer',
01358 
01359     // Point activesync protocol modules to their layer
01360     'wbxml': 'mailapi/activesync/protocollayer',
01361     'activesync/codepages': 'mailapi/activesync/protocollayer',
01362     'activesync/protocol': 'mailapi/activesync/protocollayer',
01363 
01364     // activesync/codepages is split across two layers. If
01365     // activesync/protocol loads first (for autoconfig work on account setup),
01366     // then indicate the parts of codepages that are in activesync/configurator
01367     'activesync/codepages/FolderHierarchy':
01368                                       'mailapi/activesync/configurator',
01369     'activesync/codepages/ComposeMail':
01370                                       'mailapi/activesync/configurator',
01371     'activesync/codepages/AirSync':
01372                                       'mailapi/activesync/configurator',
01373     'activesync/codepages/AirSyncBase':
01374                                       'mailapi/activesync/configurator',
01375     'activesync/codepages/ItemEstimate':
01376                                       'mailapi/activesync/configurator',
01377     'activesync/codepages/Email':
01378                                       'mailapi/activesync/configurator',
01379     'activesync/codepages/ItemOperations':
01380                                       'mailapi/activesync/configurator',
01381     'activesync/codepages/Move':
01382                                       'mailapi/activesync/configurator',
01383 
01384     // Point chew methods to the chew layer
01385     'mailapi/htmlchew': 'mailapi/chewlayer',
01386     'mailapi/quotechew': 'mailapi/chewlayer',
01387     'mailapi/mailchew': 'mailapi/chewlayer',
01388     'mailapi/imap/imapchew': 'mailapi/chewlayer',
01389 
01390     // Imap body fetching / parsing / sync
01391     'mailapi/imap/protocol/sync': 'mailapi/imap/protocollayer',
01392     'mailapi/imap/protocol/textparser': 'mailapi/imap/protocollayer',
01393     'mailapi/imap/protocol/snippetparser': 'mailapi/imap/protocollayer',
01394     'mailapi/imap/protocol/bodyfetcher': 'mailapi/imap/protocollayer',
01395 
01396     // 'tls' is actually in both the SMTP probe and IMAP probe, but the SMTP
01397     // probe is much smaller, so if someone requests it outright, just use that.
01398     'tls': 'mailapi/smtp/probe',
01399 
01400     // The imap probe layer also contains the imap module
01401     'imap': 'mailapi/imap/probe',
01402 
01403     // The smtp probe layer also contains the simpleclient
01404     'simplesmtp/lib/client': 'mailapi/smtp/probe'
01405   },
01406   scriptType: 'application/javascript;version=1.8',
01407   definePrim: 'prim'
01408 });
01409 
01410 // q shim for rdcommon/log, just enough for it to
01411 // work. Just uses defer, promise, resolve and reject.
01412 define('q', ['prim'], function (prim) {
01413   return {
01414     defer: prim
01415   };
01416 });
01417 
01418 
01419 define("config", function(){});
01420 
01432 define('buffer',['require','exports','module'],function(require, exports, module) {
01433 
01434 function coerce(length) {
01435   // Coerce length to a number (possibly NaN), round up
01436   // in case it's fractional (e.g. 123.456) then do a
01437   // double negate to coerce a NaN to 0. Easy, right?
01438   length = ~~Math.ceil(+length);
01439   return length < 0 ? 0 : length;
01440 }
01441 
01442 var ENCODER_OPTIONS = { fatal: false };
01443 
01454 function safeBase64DecodeToArray(s) {
01455   var bitsSoFar = 0, validBits = 0, iOut = 0,
01456       arr = new Uint8Array(Math.ceil(s.length * 3 / 4));
01457   for (var i = 0; i < s.length; i++) {
01458     var c = s.charCodeAt(i), bits;
01459     if (c >= 65 && c <= 90) // [A-Z]
01460       bits = c - 65;
01461     else if (c >= 97 && c <= 122) // [a-z]
01462       bits = c - 97 + 26;
01463     else if (c >= 48 && c <= 57) // [0-9]
01464       bits = c - 48 + 52;
01465     else if (c === 43) // +
01466       bits = 62;
01467     else if (c === 47) // /
01468       bits = 63;
01469     else if (c === 61) { // =
01470       validBits = 0;
01471       continue;
01472     }
01473     // ignore all other characters!
01474     else
01475       continue;
01476     bitsSoFar = (bitsSoFar << 6) | bits;
01477     validBits += 6;
01478     if (validBits >= 8) {
01479       validBits -= 8;
01480       arr[iOut++] = bitsSoFar >> validBits;
01481       if (validBits === 2)
01482         bitsSoFar &= 0x3;
01483       else if (validBits === 4)
01484         bitsSoFar &= 0xf;
01485     }
01486   }
01487 
01488   if (iOut < arr.length)
01489     return arr.subarray(0, iOut);
01490   return arr;
01491 }
01492 
01498 function encode(string, encoding) {
01499   var buf, i;
01500   switch (encoding) {
01501     case 'base64':
01502       buf = safeBase64DecodeToArray(string);
01503       return buf;
01504     case 'binary':
01505       buf = new Uint8Array(string.length);
01506       for (i = 0; i < string.length; i++) {
01507         buf[i] = string.charCodeAt(i);
01508       }
01509       return buf;
01510     case 'hex':
01511       buf = new Uint8Array(string.length * 2);
01512       for (i = 0; i < string.length; i++) {
01513         var c = string.charCodeAt(i), nib;
01514         nib = c >> 4;
01515         buf[i*2] = (nib < 10) ? (nib + 48) : (nib - 10 + 97);
01516         nib = c & 0xf;
01517         buf[i*2 + 1] = (nib < 10) ? (nib + 48) : (nib - 10 + 97);
01518       }
01519       return buf;
01520     // need to normalize the name (for now at least)
01521     case 'utf8':
01522       encoding = 'utf-8';
01523     default:
01524       if (!encoding)
01525         encoding = 'utf-8';
01526       return TextEncoder(encoding, ENCODER_OPTIONS).encode(string);
01527   }
01528 }
01529 
01535 function decode(view, encoding) {
01536   var sbits, i;
01537   switch (encoding) {
01538     case 'base64':
01539       // base64 wants a string, so go through binary first...
01540     case 'binary':
01541       sbits = new Array(view.length);
01542       for (i = 0; i < view.length; i++) {
01543         sbits[i] = String.fromCharCode(view[i]);
01544       }
01545       // (btoa is binary JS string -> base64 ASCII string)
01546       if (encoding === 'base64')
01547         return window.btoa(sbits.join(''));
01548       return sbits.join('');
01549     case 'hex':
01550       sbits = new Array(view.length / 2);
01551       for (i = 0; i < view.length; i += 2) {
01552         var nib = view[i], c;
01553         if (nib <= 57)
01554           c = 16 * (nib - 48);
01555         else if (nib < 97)
01556           c = 16 * (nib - 64 + 10);
01557         else
01558           c = 16 * (nib - 97 + 10);
01559         nib = view[i+1];
01560         if (nib <= 57)
01561           c += (nib - 48);
01562         else if (nib < 97)
01563           c += (nib - 64 + 10);
01564         else
01565           c += (nib - 97 + 10);
01566         sbits.push(String.fromCharCode(c));
01567       }
01568       return sbits.join('');
01569     // need to normalize the name (for now at least)
01570     case 'utf8':
01571       encoding = 'utf-8';
01572     default:
01573       if (!encoding)
01574         encoding = 'utf-8';
01575       return TextDecoder(encoding, ENCODER_OPTIONS).decode(view);
01576   }
01577 }
01578 
01583 function Buffer(subject, encoding, offset) {
01584   // The actual buffer that will become 'this'.
01585   var buf;
01586   var type;
01587 
01588   // Are we slicing?
01589   if (typeof offset === 'number') {
01590     // create a sub-view
01591     buf = subject.subarray(offset, coerce(encoding) + offset);
01592   } else {
01593     // Find the length
01594     switch (type = typeof subject) {
01595       case 'number':
01596         buf = new Uint8Array(coerce(subject));
01597         break;
01598 
01599       case 'string':
01600         buf = encode(subject, encoding);
01601         break;
01602 
01603       case 'object': // Assume object is an array
01604         // only use it verbatim if it's a buffer and we see it as such (aka
01605         // it's from our compartment)
01606         if (buf instanceof Uint8Array)
01607           buf = subject;
01608         else
01609           buf = new Uint8Array(subject);
01610         break;
01611 
01612       default:
01613         throw new Error('First argument needs to be a number, ' +
01614                         'array or string.');
01615     }
01616   }
01617 
01618   // Return the mixed-in Uint8Array to be our 'this'!
01619   return buf;
01620 }
01621 exports.Buffer = Buffer;
01622 
01623 Buffer.byteLength = function Buffer_byteLength(string, encoding) {
01624   var buf = encode(string, encoding);
01625   return buf.length;
01626 };
01627 
01628 Buffer.isBuffer = function Buffer_isBuffer(obj) {
01629   return ((obj instanceof Uint8Array) &&
01630           obj.copy === BufferPrototype.copy);
01631 };
01632 
01633 // POSSIBLY SUBTLE AND DANGEROUS THING: We are actually clobbering stuff onto
01634 // the Uint8Array prototype.  We do this because we're not allowed to mix our
01635 // contributions onto the instance types, leaving us only able to mess with
01636 // the prototype.  This obviously may affect other consumers of Uint8Array
01637 // operating in the same global-space.
01638 var BufferPrototype = Uint8Array.prototype;
01639 
01640 BufferPrototype.copy = function(target, target_start, start, end) {
01641   var source = this;
01642   start || (start = 0);
01643   end || (end = this.length);
01644   target_start || (target_start = 0);
01645 
01646   if (end < start) throw new Error('sourceEnd < sourceStart');
01647 
01648   // Copy 0 bytes; we're done
01649   if (end === start) return;
01650   if (target.length == 0 || source.length == 0) return;
01651 
01652   if (target_start < 0 || target_start >= target.length) {
01653     throw new Error('targetStart out of bounds');
01654   }
01655 
01656   if (start < 0 || start >= source.length) {
01657     throw new Error('sourceStart out of bounds');
01658   }
01659 
01660   if (end < 0 || end > source.length) {
01661     throw new Error('sourceEnd out of bounds');
01662   }
01663 
01664   // Are we oob?
01665   if (end > this.length) {
01666     end = this.length;
01667   }
01668 
01669   if (target.length - target_start < end - start) {
01670     end = target.length - target_start + start;
01671   }
01672 
01673   for (var i = start; i < end; i++) {
01674     target[i + target_start] = this[i];
01675   }
01676 };
01677 
01678 BufferPrototype.slice = function(start, end) {
01679   if (end === undefined) end = this.length;
01680 
01681   if (end > this.length) {
01682     throw new Error('oob');
01683   }
01684   if (start > end) {
01685     throw new Error('oob');
01686   }
01687   return Buffer(this, end - start, +start);
01688 };
01689 
01695 BufferPrototype.toString = function(encoding, start, end) {
01696   encoding = String(encoding || 'utf-8').toLowerCase();
01697   start = +start || 0;
01698   if (typeof end == 'undefined') end = this.length;
01699 
01700   // Fastpath empty strings
01701   if (+end == start) {
01702     return '';
01703   }
01704   if (start === 0 && end === this.length)
01705     return decode(this, encoding);
01706   else
01707     return decode(this.subarray(start, end), encoding);
01708   // In case things get slow again, comment the above block and uncomment:
01709 /*
01710 var rval, before = Date.now();
01711   if (start === 0 && end === this.length)
01712     rval = decode(this, encoding);
01713   else
01714     rval = decode(this.subarray(start, end), encoding);
01715   var delta = Date.now() - before;
01716   if (delta > 2)
01717     console.error('SLOWDECODE', delta, end - start, encoding);
01718   return rval;
01719 */
01720 };
01721 
01722 BufferPrototype.write  = function(string, offset, length, encoding) {
01723   // Support both (string, offset, length, encoding)
01724   // and the legacy (string, encoding, offset, length)
01725   if (isFinite(offset)) {
01726     if (!isFinite(length)) {
01727       encoding = length;
01728       length = undefined;
01729     }
01730   } else {  // legacy
01731     var swap = encoding;
01732     encoding = offset;
01733     offset = length;
01734     length = swap;
01735   }
01736 
01737   offset = +offset || 0;
01738   var remaining = this.length - offset;
01739   if (!length) {
01740     length = remaining;
01741   } else {
01742     length = +length;
01743     if (length > remaining) {
01744       length = remaining;
01745     }
01746   }
01747   encoding = String(encoding || 'utf-8').toLowerCase();
01748 
01749   var encoded = encode(string, encoding);
01750   for (var i = 0; i < encoded.length; i++)
01751     this[i + offset] = encoded[i];
01752 
01753   return encoded.length;
01754 };
01755 
01756 });
01757 
01762 (function () {
01763 
01764 // Like setTimeout, but only takes a function argument.  There's
01765 // no time argument (always zero) and no arguments (you have to
01766 // use a closure).
01767 function setZeroTimeout(fn) {
01768   setTimeout(fn);
01769 }
01770 
01771 // Add the one thing we want added to the window object.
01772 window.setZeroTimeout = setZeroTimeout;
01773 
01774 window.process = {
01775   immediate: false,
01776   nextTick: function(cb) {
01777     if (this.immediate)
01778       cb();
01779     else
01780       window.setZeroTimeout(cb);
01781   }
01782 };
01783 
01784 }());
01785 
01786 define('mailapi/shim-sham',
01787   [
01788     'buffer',
01789   ],
01790   function(
01791     $buffer
01792   ) {
01793 
01794 window.Buffer = $buffer.Buffer;
01795 
01796 
01797 }); // end define
01798 ;
01799 define('event-queue',['require'],function (require) {
01800   // hackish hookup to MAGIC_ERROR_TRAPPER for unit testing; this also has the
01801   //  nice side-effect of cutting down on RequireJS errors at startup when
01802   //  Q is loading.
01803   return {
01804     enqueue: function(task) {
01805       setTimeout(function() {
01806         try {
01807           task();
01808         }
01809         catch(ex) {
01810           console.error("exception in enqueued task: " + ex);
01811           if (MAGIC_ERROR_TRAPPER)
01812             MAGIC_ERROR_TRAPPER.yoAnError(ex);
01813           // and re-throw it in case the platform can pick it up.
01814           throw ex;
01815         }
01816       }, 0);
01817     },
01818   };
01819 });
01820 
01821 define('microtime',['require'],function (require) {
01822   // workers won't have this, of course...
01823   if (window && window.performance && window.performance.now) {
01824     return {
01825       now: function () {
01826         return window.performance.now() * 1000;
01827       }
01828     };
01829   }
01830 
01831   return {
01832     now: function () {
01833       return Date.now() * 1000;
01834     }
01835   };
01836 });

01886 define('rdcommon/extransform',
01887   [
01888     'require',
01889     'exports'
01890   ],
01891   function(
01892     require,
01893     exports
01894   ) {
01895 
01896 var baseUrl;
01897 // XXX previous requirejs web magic...
01898 if (false) {
01899   baseUrl = require.s.contexts._.config.baseUrl;
01900   if (baseUrl.length > 3 && baseUrl.substring(0, 3) === "../") {
01901     var targUrl = document.location.origin + document.location.pathname;
01902     // strip down to the parent directory (lose file or just trailing "/")
01903     targUrl = targUrl.substring(0, targUrl.lastIndexOf("/"));
01904     // eat the relative bits of the baseUrl
01905     while (baseUrl.length >= 3 && baseUrl.substring(0, 3) === "../") {
01906       targUrl = targUrl.substring(0, targUrl.lastIndexOf("/"));
01907       baseUrl = baseUrl.substring(3);
01908     }
01909     baseUrl = targUrl + baseUrl + "/";
01910     console.log("baseUrl", baseUrl);
01911   }
01912 }
01913 else {
01914   // XXX ALMOND hack; don't even try and find node path where there is none
01915   /*
01916   require(['path'], function($path) {
01917     baseUrl = $path.resolve('../..');
01918   });
01919   */
01920 }
01921 
01922 
01923 
01924 function uneval(x) {
01925   return JSON.stringify(x);
01926 }
01927 
01928 function simplifyFilename(filename) {
01929   if (!filename)
01930     return filename;
01931   // simple hack to eliminate jetpack ridiculousness where we have
01932   //  "LONGPATH -> LONGPATH -> LONGPATH -> actualThing.js"
01933   if (filename.length > 96) {
01934     var lastSlash = filename.lastIndexOf('/');
01935     if (lastSlash !== -1)
01936       return filename.substring(lastSlash+1);
01937   }
01938   // can we reduce it?
01939   if (baseUrl && filename.substring(0, baseUrl.length) === baseUrl) {
01940     // we could take this a step further and do path analysis.
01941     return filename.substring(baseUrl.length);
01942   }
01943   return filename;
01944 }
01945 
01946 // Thunk the stack format in v8
01947 Error.prepareStackTrace = function(e, frames) {
01948   var o = [];
01949   for (var i = 0; i < frames.length; i++) {
01950     var frame = frames[i];
01951     o.push({
01952       filename: simplifyFilename(frame.getFileName()),
01953       lineNo: frame.getLineNumber(),
01954       funcName: frame.getFunctionName(),
01955     });
01956   }
01957   return o;
01958 };
01959 // raise the limit in case of super-nested require()s
01960 //Error.stackTraceLimit = 64;
01961 
01962 // XXX not sure if this even works since Error is not supposed to be
01963 //  configurable... provide a captureStackTrace method
01964 // nb: and obviously, in independent sandboxes, this does jack...
01965 if (!Error.captureStackTrace) {
01966   Error.captureStackTrace = function(who, errType) {
01967     try {
01968       throw new Error();
01969     }
01970     catch(ex) {
01971       var sframes = ex.stack.split("\n"), frames = who.stack = [], match;
01972       for (var i = 0; i < sframes.length; i++) {
01973         if ((match = SM_STACK_FORMAT.exec(sframes[i]))) {
01974           frames.push({
01975                         filename: simplifyFilename(match[2]),
01976                         lineNo: match[3],
01977                         funcName: match[1],
01978                       });
01979         }
01980       }
01981     }
01982   };
01983 }
01984 
01985 var SM_STACK_FORMAT = /^(.*)@(.+):(\d+)$/;
01986 
01987 // this is biased towards v8/chromium for now
01991 exports.transformException = function transformException(e) {
01992   // it's conceivable someone
01993   if (!(e instanceof Error) &&
01994       // under jetpack, we are losing hard, probably because of the sandbox
01995       //  issue where everybody gets their own fundamentals, so check for stack.
01996       (!e || typeof(e) !== "object" || !("stack" in e))) {
01997     return {
01998       n: "Object",
01999       m: "" + e,
02000       f: [],
02001     };
02002   }
02003 
02004   var stack = e.stack;
02005   // evidence of v8 thunk?
02006   if (Array.isArray(stack)) {
02007     return {
02008       n: e.name,
02009       m: e.message,
02010       f: stack,
02011     };
02012   }
02013 
02014   // handle the spidermonkey case, XXX maybe
02015   var o = {
02016     n: e.name,
02017     m: e.message,
02018     f: [],
02019   };
02020   if (stack) {
02021     var sframes = stack.split("\n"), frames = o.f, match;
02022     for (var i = 0; i < sframes.length; i++) {
02023       if ((match = SM_STACK_FORMAT.exec(sframes[i]))) {
02024         frames.push({
02025           filename: simplifyFilename(match[2]),
02026           lineNo: match[3],
02027           funcName: match[1],
02028         });
02029       }
02030     }
02031   }
02032   // otherwise this is probably an XPConnect exception...
02033   else if (e.filename) {
02034     o.f.push({
02035       filename: e.filename,
02036       lineNo: e.lineNumber,
02037       funcName: '',
02038     });
02039   }
02040   return o;
02041 };
02042 
02043 }); // end define
02044 ;

02273 define('rdcommon/log',
02274   [
02275     'q',
02276     'microtime',
02277     './extransform',
02278     'exports'
02279   ],
02280   function(
02281     $Q,
02282     $microtime,
02283     $extransform,
02284     exports
02285   ) {
02286 
02301 var gSeq = 0;
02302 
02303 exports.getCurrentSeq = function() {
02304   return gSeq;
02305 };
02306 
02310 var gUniqueActorName = 1;
02314 var gUniqueThingName = -1;
02315 
02316 var ThingProto = exports.ThingProto = {
02317   get digitalName() {
02318     return this.__diginame;
02319   },
02320   set digitalName(val) {
02321     this.__diginame = val;
02322   },
02323   toString: function() {
02324     return '[Thing:' + this.__type + ']';
02325   },
02326   toJSON: function() {
02327     var o = {
02328       type: this.__type,
02329       name: this.__name,
02330       dname: this.__diginame,
02331       uniqueName: this._uniqueName,
02332     };
02333     if (this.__hardcodedFamily)
02334       o.family = this.__hardcodedFamily;
02335     return o;
02336   },
02337 };
02338 
02348 exports.__makeThing = function makeThing(type, humanName, digitalName, proto) {
02349   var thing;
02350   if (proto === undefined)
02351     proto = ThingProto;
02352   thing = Object.create(proto);
02353 
02354   thing.__type = type;
02355   thing.__name = humanName;
02356   thing.__diginame = digitalName;
02357   thing.__hardcodedFamily = null;
02358   thing._uniqueName = gUniqueThingName--;
02359   return thing;
02360 };
02361 
02362 function NOP() {
02363 }
02364 
02369 var DummyLogProtoBase = {
02370   _kids: undefined,
02371   logLevel: 'dummy',
02372   toString: function() {
02373     return '[DummyLog]';
02374   },
02375   toJSON: function() {
02376     // will this actually break JSON.stringify or just cause it to not use us?
02377     throw new Error("I WAS NOT PLANNING ON BEING SERIALIZED");
02378   },
02379   __die: NOP,
02380   __updateIdent: NOP,
02381 };
02382 
02389 var LogProtoBase = {
02397   _named: null,
02398   logLevel: 'safe',
02399   toJSON: function() {
02400     var jo = {
02401       loggerIdent: this.__defName,
02402       semanticIdent: this._ident,
02403       uniqueName: this._uniqueName,
02404       born: this._born,
02405       died: this._died,
02406       events: this._eventMap,
02407       entries: this._entries,
02408       kids: this._kids
02409     };
02410     if (this.__latchedVars.length) {
02411       var latchedVars = this.__latchedVars, olv = {};
02412       for (var i = 0; i < latchedVars.length; i++) {
02413         olv[latchedVars[i]] = this[':' + latchedVars[i]];
02414       }
02415       jo.latched = olv;
02416     }
02417     if (this._named)
02418       jo.named = this._named;
02419     return jo;
02420   },
02421   __die: function() {
02422     this._died = $microtime.now();
02423     if (this.__FAB._onDeath)
02424       this.__FAB._onDeath(this);
02425   },
02426   __updateIdent: function(ident) {
02427     // NOTE: you need to update useSemanticIdent if you change this.
02428     // normalize all object references to unique name references.
02429     if (Array.isArray(ident)) {
02430       var normIdent = [];
02431       for (var i = 0; i < ident.length; i++) {
02432         var identBit = ident[i];
02433         if (typeof(identBit) !== "object" || identBit == null)
02434           normIdent.push(identBit);
02435         else
02436           normIdent.push(identBit._uniqueName);
02437       }
02438       ident = normIdent;
02439     }
02440     this._ident = ident;
02441   },
02442 };
02443 
02454 var TestLogProtoBase = Object.create(LogProtoBase);
02455 TestLogProtoBase.logLevel = 'dangerous';
02456 TestLogProtoBase.__unexpectedEntry = function(iEntry, unexpEntry) {
02457   var entry = ['!unexpected', unexpEntry];
02458   this._entries[iEntry] = entry;
02459 };
02460 
02461 TestLogProtoBase.__mismatchEntry = function(iEntry, expected, actual) {
02462   var entry = ['!mismatch', expected, actual];
02463   this._entries[iEntry] = entry;
02464 };
02465 
02466 TestLogProtoBase.__failedExpectation = function(exp) {
02467   var entry = ['!failedexp', exp, $microtime.now(), gSeq++];
02468   this._entries.push(entry);
02469 };
02470 
02471 TestLogProtoBase.__die = function() {
02472   this._died = $microtime.now();
02473   var testActor = this._actor;
02474   if (testActor) {
02475     if (testActor._expectDeath) {
02476       testActor._expectDeath = false;
02477       testActor.__loggerFired();
02478     }
02479     if (testActor._lifecycleListener)
02480       testActor._lifecycleListener.call(null, 'dead', this.__instance, this);
02481   }
02482 };
02483 
02484 var DIED_EVENTNAME = '(died)', DIED_EXP = [DIED_EVENTNAME];
02485 
02486 var TestActorProtoBase = {
02487   toString: function() {
02488     return '[Actor ' + this.__defName + ': ' + this.__name + ']';
02489   },
02490   toJSON: function() {
02491     return {
02492       actorIdent: this.__defName,
02493       semanticIdent: this.__name,
02494       uniqueName: this._uniqueName,
02495       parentUniqueName: this._parentUniqueName,
02496       loggerUniqueName: this._logger ? this._logger._uniqueName : null,
02497     };
02498   },
02499 
02504   __attachToLogger: function(logger) {
02505     logger._actor = this;
02506     this._logger = logger;
02507     if (this._lifecycleListener)
02508       this._lifecycleListener.call(null, 'attach', logger.__instance, logger);
02509   },
02510 
02520   attachLifecycleListener: function(func) {
02521     this._lifecycleListener = func;
02522   },
02523 
02530   asyncEventsAreComingDoNotResolve: function() {
02531     if (!this._activeForTestStep)
02532       throw new Error("Attempt to set expectations on an actor (" +
02533                       this.__defName + ": " + this.__name + ") that is not " +
02534                       "participating in this test step!");
02535     if (this._resolved)
02536       throw new Error("Attempt to add expectations when already resolved!");
02537 
02538     // (sorta evil-hack)
02539     // We can reuse the _expectDeath flag as a means to ensure that we don't
