05285         this.startUID = header.id;
05286       }
05287       if (this.endTS === null ||
05288           STRICTLY_AFTER(header.date, this.endTS)) {
05289         this.endTS = header.date;
05290         this.endUID = header.id;
05291       }
05292       else if (header.date === this.endTS &&
05293                header.id > this.endUID) {
05294         this.endUID = header.id;
05295       }
05296     }
05297 
05298     this._updateSliceFlags();
05299     if (!this._accumulating)
05300       this._bridgeHandle.sendSplice(insertAt, 0, headers,
05301                                     true, moreComing);
05302   },
05303 
05310   onHeaderAdded: function(header, syncDriven, messageIsNew) {
05311     if (!this._bridgeHandle)
05312       return;
05313 
05314     var idx = bsearchForInsert(this.headers, header, cmpHeaderYoungToOld);
05315     var hlen = this.headers.length;
05316     // Don't append the header if it would expand us beyond our requested amount
05317     // and there is no subsequent step, like accumulate flushing, that would get
05318     // rid of the excess.  Note that this does not guarantee that we won't
05319     // end up with more headers than originally planned; if we get told about
05320     // headers earlier than the last slot, we will insert them and grow without
05321     // forcing a removal of something else to offset.
05322     if (hlen >= this.desiredHeaders && idx === hlen &&
05323         !this._accumulating)
05324       return;
05325     // If we are inserting (not at the end) and not accumulating (in which case
05326     // we can chop off the excess before we tell about it), then be sure to grow
05327     // the number of desired headers to be consistent with the number of headers
05328     // we have.
05329     if (hlen >= this.desiredHeaders && !this._accumulating)
05330       this.desiredHeaders++;
05331 
05332     if (this.startTS === null ||
05333         BEFORE(header.date, this.startTS)) {
05334       this.startTS = header.date;
05335       this.startUID = header.id;
05336     }
05337     else if (header.date === this.startTS &&
05338              header.id < this.startUID) {
05339       this.startUID = header.id;
05340     }
05341     if (this.endTS === null ||
05342         STRICTLY_AFTER(header.date, this.endTS)) {
05343       this.endTS = header.date;
05344       this.endUID = header.id;
05345     }
05346     else if (header.date === this.endTS &&
05347              header.id > this.endUID) {
05348       this.endUID = header.id;
05349     }
05350 
05351     this._LOG.headerAdded(idx, header);
05352     if (!this._accumulating)
05353       this._bridgeHandle.sendSplice(idx, 0, [header],
05354                                     Boolean(this.waitingOnData),
05355                                     Boolean(this.waitingOnData));
05356     this.headers.splice(idx, 0, header);
05357   },
05358 
05363   onHeaderModified: function(header) {
05364     if (!this._bridgeHandle)
05365       return;
05366 
05367     // this can only affect flags which will not affect ordering
05368     var idx = bsearchMaybeExists(this.headers, header, cmpHeaderYoungToOld);
05369     if (idx !== null) {
05370       // There is no identity invariant to ensure this is already true.
05371       this.headers[idx] = header;
05372       this._LOG.headerModified(idx, header);
05373       // If we are accumulating, the update will be observed.
05374       if (!this._accumulating)
05375         this._bridgeHandle.sendUpdate([idx, header]);
05376     }
05377   },
05378 
05382   onHeaderRemoved: function(header) {
05383     if (!this._bridgeHandle)
05384       return;
05385 
05386     var idx = bsearchMaybeExists(this.headers, header, cmpHeaderYoungToOld);
05387     if (idx !== null) {
05388       this._LOG.headerRemoved(idx, header);
05389       if (!this._accumulating)
05390         this._bridgeHandle.sendSplice(idx, 1, [],
05391                                       Boolean(this.waitingOnData),
05392                                       Boolean(this.waitingOnData));
05393       this.headers.splice(idx, 1);
05394 
05395       // update time-ranges if required...
05396       if (header.date === this.endTS && header.id === this.endUID) {
05397         if (!this.headers.length) {
05398           this.endTS = null;
05399           this.endUID = null;
05400         }
05401         else {
05402           this.endTS = this.headers[0].date;
05403           this.endUID = this.headers[0].id;
05404         }
05405       }
05406       if (header.date === this.startTS && header.id === this.startUID) {
05407         if (!this.headers.length) {
05408           this.startTS = null;
05409           this.startUID = null;
05410         }
05411         else {
05412           var lastHeader = this.headers[this.headers.length - 1];
05413           this.startTS = lastHeader.date;
05414           this.startUID = lastHeader.id;
05415         }
05416       }
05417     }
05418   },
05419 
05420   die: function() {
05421     this._bridgeHandle = null;
05422     this.desiredHeaders = 0;
05423     this._storage.dyingSlice(this);
05424     this._LOG.__die();
05425   },
05426 
05427   get isDead() {
05428     return this._bridgeHandle === null;
05429   },
05430 };
05431 
05755 function FolderStorage(account, folderId, persistedFolderInfo, dbConn,
05756                        FolderSyncer, _parentLog) {
05758   this._account = account;
05759   this._imapDb = dbConn;
05760 
05761   this.folderId = folderId;
05762   this.folderMeta = persistedFolderInfo.$meta;
05763   this._folderImpl = persistedFolderInfo.$impl;
05764 
05765   this._LOG = LOGFAB.FolderStorage(this, _parentLog, folderId);
05766 
05774   this._accuracyRanges = persistedFolderInfo.accuracy;
05782   this._headerBlockInfos = persistedFolderInfo.headerBlocks;
05790   this._bodyBlockInfos = persistedFolderInfo.bodyBlocks;
05791 
05802   this._serverIdHeaderBlockMapping =
05803     persistedFolderInfo.serverIdHeaderBlockMapping;
05804 
05810   this._headerBlocks = {};
05819   this._loadedHeaderBlockInfos = [];
05825   this._bodyBlocks = {};
05834   this._loadedBodyBlockInfos = [];
05835 
05836   this._bound_makeHeaderBlock = this._makeHeaderBlock.bind(this);
05837   this._bound_insertHeaderInBlock = this._insertHeaderInBlock.bind(this);
05838   this._bound_splitHeaderBlock = this._splitHeaderBlock.bind(this);
05839   this._bound_deleteHeaderFromBlock = this._deleteHeaderFromBlock.bind(this);
05840 
05841   this._bound_makeBodyBlock = this._makeBodyBlock.bind(this);
05842   this._bound_insertBodyInBlock = this._insertBodyInBlock.bind(this);
05843   this._bound_splitBodyBlock = this._splitBodyBlock.bind(this);
05844   this._bound_deleteBodyFromBlock = this._deleteBodyFromBlock.bind(this);
05845 
05849   this._dirty = false;
05851   this._dirtyHeaderBlocks = {};
05853   this._dirtyBodyBlocks = {};
05854 
05858   this._pendingLoads = [];
05865   this._pendingLoadListeners = {};
05866 
05873   this._deferredCalls = [];
05874 
05889   this._mutexQueue = [];
05890 
05894   this._slices = [];
05900   this._curSyncSlice = null;
05901 
05902   this._messagePurgeScheduled = false;
05903 
05904   this.folderSyncer = FolderSyncer && new FolderSyncer(account, this,
05905                                                        this._LOG);
05906 }
05907 exports.FolderStorage = FolderStorage;
05908 FolderStorage.prototype = {
05909   get hasActiveSlices() {
05910     return this._slices.length > 0;
05911   },
05912 
05916   resetAndRefreshActiveSlices: function() {
05917     if (!this._slices.length)
05918       return;
05919     // This will splice out slices as we go, so work from the back to avoid
05920     // processing any slice more than once.  (Shuffling of processed slices
05921     // will occur, but we don't care.)
05922     for (var i = this._slices.length - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
05923       var slice = this._slices[i];
05924       slice.reset();
05925       slice.desiredHeaders = $sync.INITIAL_FILL_SIZE;
05926       this._resetAndResyncSlice(slice, true, null);
05927     }
05928   },
05929 
05938   generatePersistenceInfo: function() {
05939     if (!this._dirty)
05940       return null;
05941     var pinfo = {
05942       id: this.folderId,
05943       headerBlocks: this._dirtyHeaderBlocks,
05944       bodyBlocks: this._dirtyBodyBlocks,
05945     };
05946     this._dirtyHeaderBlocks = {};
05947     this._dirtyBodyBlocks = {};
05948     this._dirty = false;
05949     this.flushExcessCachedBlocks('persist');
05950     return pinfo;
05951   },
05952 
05953   _invokeNextMutexedCall: function() {
05954     var callInfo = this._mutexQueue[0], self = this, done = false;
05955     this._mutexedCallInProgress = true;
05956     this._LOG.mutexedCall_begin(callInfo.name);
05957 
05958     try {
05959       callInfo.func(function mutexedOpDone() {
05960         if (done) {
05961           self._LOG.tooManyCallbacks(callInfo.name);
05962           return;
05963         }
05964         self._LOG.mutexedCall_end(callInfo.name);
05965         done = true;
05966         if (self._mutexQueue[0] !== callInfo) {
05967           self._LOG.mutexInvariantFail(callInfo.name, self._mutexQueue[0].name);
05968           return;
05969         }
05970         self._mutexQueue.shift();
05971         self.flushExcessCachedBlocks('mutex');
05972         // Although everything should be async, avoid stack explosions by
05973         // deferring the execution to a future turn of the event loop.
05974         if (self._mutexQueue.length)
05975           window.setZeroTimeout(self._invokeNextMutexedCall.bind(self));
05976         else if (self._slices.length === 0)
05977           self.folderSyncer.allConsumersDead();
05978       });
05979     }
05980     catch (ex) {
05981       this._LOG.mutexedOpErr(ex);
05982     }
05983   },
05984 
06019   runMutexed: function(name, func) {
06020     var doRun = this._mutexQueue.length === 0;
06021     this._mutexQueue.push({ name: name, func: func });
06022 
06023     if (doRun)
06024       this._invokeNextMutexedCall();
06025   },
06026 
06027   _issueNewHeaderId: function() {
06028     return this._folderImpl.nextId++;
06029   },
06030 
06036   _makeHeaderBlock: function ifs__makeHeaderBlock(
06037       startTS, startUID, endTS, endUID, estSize, ids, headers) {
06038     var blockId = $a64.encodeInt(this._folderImpl.nextHeaderBlock++),
06039         blockInfo = {
06040           blockId: blockId,
06041           startTS: startTS,
06042           startUID: startUID,
06043           endTS: endTS,
06044           endUID: endUID,
06045           count: ids ? ids.length : 0,
06046           estSize: estSize || 0,
06047         },
06048         block = {
06049           ids: ids || [],
06050           headers: headers || [],
06051         };
06052     this._dirty = true;
06053     this._headerBlocks[blockId] = block;
06054     this._dirtyHeaderBlocks[blockId] = block;
06055 
06056     // Update the server id mapping if we are maintaining one.
06057     if (this._serverIdHeaderBlockMapping && headers) {
06058       var srvMapping = this._serverIdHeaderBlockMapping;
06059       for (var i = 0; i < headers.length; i++) {
06060         var header = headers[i];
06061         if (header.srvid)
06062           srvMapping[header.srvid] = blockId;
06063       }
06064     }
06065 
06066     return blockInfo;
06067   },
06068 
06069   _insertHeaderInBlock: function ifs__insertHeaderInBlock(header, uid, info,
06070                                                           block) {
06071     var idx = bsearchForInsert(block.headers, header, cmpHeaderYoungToOld);
06072     block.ids.splice(idx, 0, header.id);
06073     block.headers.splice(idx, 0, header);
06074     this._dirty = true;
06075     this._dirtyHeaderBlocks[info.blockId] = block;
06076     // Insertion does not need to update start/end TS/UID because the calling
06077     // logic is able to handle it.
06078   },
06079 
06080   _deleteHeaderFromBlock: function ifs__deleteHeaderFromBlock(uid, info, block) {
06081     var idx = block.ids.indexOf(uid), header;
06082     // - remove, update counts
06083     block.ids.splice(idx, 1);
06084     block.headers.splice(idx, 1);
06085     info.estSize -= $sync.HEADER_EST_SIZE_IN_BYTES;
06086     info.count--;
06087 
06088     this._dirty = true;
06089     this._dirtyHeaderBlocks[info.blockId] = block;
06090 
06091     // - update endTS/endUID if necessary
06092     if (idx === 0 && info.count) {
06093       header = block.headers[0];
06094       info.endTS = header.date;
06095       info.endUID = header.id;
06096     }
06097     // - update startTS/startUID if necessary
06098     if (idx === info.count && idx > 0) {
06099       header = block.headers[idx - 1];
06100       info.startTS = header.date;
06101       info.startUID = header.id;
06102     }
06103   },
06104 
06112   _splitHeaderBlock: function ifs__splitHeaderBlock(splinfo, splock,
06113                                                     newerTargetBytes) {
06114     // We currently assume a fixed size, so this is easy.
06115     var numHeaders = Math.ceil(newerTargetBytes /
06116                                $sync.HEADER_EST_SIZE_IN_BYTES);
06117     if (numHeaders > splock.headers.length)
06118       throw new Error("No need to split!");
06119 
06120     var olderNumHeaders = splock.headers.length - numHeaders,
06121         olderEndHeader = splock.headers[numHeaders],
06122         // (This will update the server id mappings for the headers too)
06123         olderInfo = this._makeHeaderBlock(
06124                       // Take the start info from the block, because it may have
06125                       // been extended beyond the header (for an insertion if
06126                       // we change back to inserting after splitting.)
06127                       splinfo.startTS, splinfo.startUID,
06128                       olderEndHeader.date, olderEndHeader.id,
06129                       olderNumHeaders * $sync.HEADER_EST_SIZE_IN_BYTES,
06130                       splock.ids.splice(numHeaders, olderNumHeaders),
06131                       splock.headers.splice(numHeaders, olderNumHeaders));
06132 
06133     var newerStartHeader = splock.headers[numHeaders - 1];
06134     splinfo.count = numHeaders;
06135     splinfo.estSize = numHeaders * $sync.HEADER_EST_SIZE_IN_BYTES;
06136     splinfo.startTS = newerStartHeader.date;
06137     splinfo.startUID = newerStartHeader.id;
06138     // this._dirty is already touched by makeHeaderBlock when it dirties the
06139     // block it creates.
06140     this._dirtyHeaderBlocks[splinfo.blockId] = splock;
06141 
06142     return olderInfo;
06143   },
06144 
06150   _makeBodyBlock: function ifs__makeBodyBlock(
06151       startTS, startUID, endTS, endUID, size, ids, bodies) {
06152     var blockId = $a64.encodeInt(this._folderImpl.nextBodyBlock++),
06153         blockInfo = {
06154           blockId: blockId,
06155           startTS: startTS,
06156           startUID: startUID,
06157           endTS: endTS,
06158           endUID: endUID,
06159           count: ids ? ids.length : 0,
06160           estSize: size || 0,
06161         },
06162         block = {
06163           ids: ids || [],
06164           bodies: bodies || {},
06165         };
06166     this._dirty = true;
06167     this._bodyBlocks[blockId] = block;
06168     this._dirtyBodyBlocks[blockId] = block;
06169 
06170     if (this._folderImpl.nextBodyBlock %
06171           $sync.BLOCK_PURGE_EVERY_N_NEW_BODY_BLOCKS === 0 &&
06172         !this._messagePurgeScheduled) {
06173       this._messagePurgeScheduled = true;
06174       this._account.scheduleMessagePurge(this.folderId);
06175     }
06176 
06177     return blockInfo;
06178   },
06179 
06180   _insertBodyInBlock: function ifs__insertBodyInBlock(body, id, info, block) {
06181     function cmpBodyByID(aID, bID) {
06182       var aDate = (aID === id) ? body.date : block.bodies[aID].date,
06183           bDate = (bID === id) ? body.date : block.bodies[bID].date,
06184           d = bDate - aDate;
06185       if (d)
06186         return d;
06187       d = bID - aID;
06188       return d;
06189     }
06190 
06191     var idx = bsearchForInsert(block.ids, id, cmpBodyByID);
06192     block.ids.splice(idx, 0, id);
06193     block.bodies[id] = body;
06194     this._dirty = true;
06195     this._dirtyBodyBlocks[info.blockId] = block;
06196     // Insertion does not need to update start/end TS/UID because the calling
06197     // logic is able to handle it.
06198   },
06199 
06200   _deleteBodyFromBlock: function ifs__deleteBodyFromBlock(id, info, block) {
06201     // - delete
06202     var idx = block.ids.indexOf(id);
06203     var body = block.bodies[id];
06204     if (idx === -1 || !body) {
06205       this._LOG.bodyBlockMissing(id, idx, !!body);
06206       return;
06207     }
06208     block.ids.splice(idx, 1);
06209     delete block.bodies[id];
06210     info.estSize -= body.size;
06211     info.count--;
06212 
06213     this._dirty = true;
06214     this._dirtyBodyBlocks[info.blockId] = block;
06215 
06216     // - update endTS/endUID if necessary
06217     if (idx === 0 && info.count) {
06218       info.endUID = id = block.ids[0];
06219       info.endTS = block.bodies[id].date;
06220     }
06221     // - update startTS/startUID if necessary
06222     if (idx === info.count && idx > 0) {
06223       info.startUID = id = block.ids[idx - 1];
06224       info.startTS = block.bodies[id].date;
06225     }
06226   },
06227 
06235   _splitBodyBlock: function ifs__splitBodyBlock(splinfo, splock,
06236                                                 newerTargetBytes) {
06237     // Save off the start timestamp/uid; these may have been extended beyond the
06238     // delimiting bodies because of the insertion triggering the split.  (At
06239     // least if we start inserting after splitting again in the future.)
06240     var savedStartTS = splinfo.startTS, savedStartUID = splinfo.startUID;
06241 
06242     var newerBytes = 0, ids = splock.ids, newDict = {}, oldDict = {},
06243         inNew = true, numHeaders = null, i, id, body,
06244         idxLast = ids.length - 1;
06245     // loop for new traversal; picking a split-point so that there is at least
06246     // one item in each block.
06247     for (i = 0; i < idxLast; i++) {
06248       id = ids[i],
06249       body = splock.bodies[id];
06250       newerBytes += body.size;
06251       newDict[id] = body;
06252       if (newerBytes >= newerTargetBytes) {
06253         i++;
06254         break;
06255       }
06256     }
06257     // mark the breakpoint; i is pointing at the first old-block message
06258     splinfo.count = numHeaders = i;
06259     // and these values are from the last processed new-block message
06260     splinfo.startTS = body.date;
06261     splinfo.startUID = id;
06262     // loop for old traversal
06263     for (; i < ids.length; i++) {
06264       id = ids[i];
06265       oldDict[id] = splock.bodies[id];
06266     }
06267 
06268     var oldEndUID = ids[numHeaders];
06269     var olderInfo = this._makeBodyBlock(
06270       savedStartTS, savedStartUID,
06271       oldDict[oldEndUID].date, oldEndUID,
06272       splinfo.estSize - newerBytes,
06273       // (the older block gets the uids the new/existing block does not want,
06274       //  leaving `uids` containing only the d
06275       ids.splice(numHeaders, ids.length - numHeaders),
06276       oldDict);
06277     splinfo.estSize = newerBytes;
06278     splock.bodies = newDict;
06279     // _makeBodyBlock dirties the block it creates and touches _dirty
06280     this._dirtyBodyBlocks[splinfo.blockId] = splock;
06281 
06282     return olderInfo;
06283   },
06284 
06297   flushExcessCachedBlocks: function(debugLabel) {
06298     var slices = this._slices;
06299     function blockIntersectsAnySlice(blockInfo) {
06300       for (var i = 0; i < slices.length; i++) {
06301         var slice = slices[i];
06302         if (tupleRangeIntersectsTupleRange(slice, blockInfo)) {
06303           // Here is some useful debug you can uncomment!
06304           /*
06305           console.log('  slice intersect. slice:',
06306                       slice.startTS, slice.startUID,
06307                       slice.endTS, slice.endUID, '  block:',
06308                       blockInfo.startTS, blockInfo.startUID,
06309                       blockInfo.endTS, blockInfo.endUID);
06310            */
06311           return true;
06312         }
06313       }
06314       return false;
06315     }
06316     function maybeDiscard(blockType, blockInfoList, loadedBlockInfos,
06317                           blockMap, dirtyMap) {
06318       // console.warn('!! flushing', blockType, 'blocks because:', debugLabel);
06319       for (var i = 0; i < loadedBlockInfos.length; i++) {
06320         var blockInfo = loadedBlockInfos[i];
06321         // do not discard dirty blocks
06322         if (dirtyMap.hasOwnProperty(blockInfo.blockId)) {
06323           // console.log('  dirty block:', blockInfo.blockId);
06324           continue;
06325         }
06326         // do not discard blocks that overlap mail slices
06327         if (blockIntersectsAnySlice(blockInfo))
06328           continue;
06329         // console.log('discarding', blockType, 'block', blockInfo.blockId);
06330         delete blockMap[blockInfo.blockId];
06331         loadedBlockInfos.splice(i--, 1);
06332       }
06333     }
06334 
06335     maybeDiscard(
06336       'header', this._headerBlockInfos, this._loadedHeaderBlockInfos,
06337       this._headerBlocks, this._dirtyHeaderBlocks);
06338     maybeDiscard(
06339       'body', this._bodyBlockInfos, this._loadedBodyBlockInfos,
06340       this._bodyBlocks, this._dirtyBodyBlocks);
06341   },
06342 
06402   purgeExcessMessages: function(callback) {
06403     this._messagePurgeScheduled = false;
06404     var cutTS = Math.max(
06405       this._purge_findLastAccessCutPoint(),
06406       this._purge_findHardBlockCutPoint(this._headerBlockInfos),
06407       this._purge_findHardBlockCutPoint(this._bodyBlockInfos));
06408 
06409     if (cutTS === 0) {
06410       callback(0, cutTS);
06411       return;
06412     }
06413 
06414     // Quantize to the subsequent UTC midnight, then apply the timezone
06415     // adjustment that is what our IMAP database lookup does to account for
06416     // skew.  (See `ImapFolderConn.syncDateRange`)
06417     cutTS = quantizeDate(cutTS + DAY_MILLIS) - this._account.tzOffset;
06418 
06419     // Update the accuracy ranges by nuking accuracy ranges that are no longer
06420     // relevant and updating any overlapped range.
06421     var aranges = this._accuracyRanges;
06422     var splitInfo = this._findFirstObjIndexForDateRange(aranges, cutTS, cutTS);
06423     // we only need to update a range if there was in fact some overlap.
06424     if (splitInfo[1]) {
06425       splitInfo[1].startTS = cutTS;
06426       // then be sure not to splice ourselves...
06427       aranges.splice(splitInfo[0] + 1, aranges.length - splitInfo[0]);
06428     }
06429     else {
06430       // do splice things at/after
06431       aranges.splice(splitInfo[0], aranges.length - splitInfo[0]);
06432     }
06433 
06434     var headerBlockInfos = this._headerBlockInfos,
06435         headerBlocks = this._headerBlocks,
06436         deletionCount = 0,
06437         // These variables let us detect if the deletion happened fully
06438         // synchronously and thereby avoid blowing up the stack.
06439         callActive = false, deleteTriggered = false;
06440     var deleteNextHeader = function() {
06441       // if things are happening synchronously, bail out
06442       if (callActive) {
06443         deleteTriggered = true;
06444         return;
06445       }
06446 
06447       while (true) {
06448         // - bail if we ran out of blocks somehow
06449         if (!headerBlockInfos.length) {
06450           callback(deletionCount, cutTS);
06451           return;
06452         }
06453         // - load the last header block if not currently loaded
06454         var blockInfo = headerBlockInfos[headerBlockInfos.length - 1];
06455         if (!this._headerBlocks.hasOwnProperty(blockInfo.blockId)) {
06456           this._loadBlock('header', blockInfo, deleteNextHeader);
06457           return;
06458         }
06459         // - get the last header, check it
06460         var headerBlock = this._headerBlocks[blockInfo.blockId],
06461             lastHeader = headerBlock.headers[headerBlock.headers.length - 1];
06462         if (SINCE(lastHeader.date, cutTS)) {
06463           // all done! header is more recent than the cut date
06464           callback(deletionCount, cutTS);
06465           return;
06466         }
06467         deleteTriggered = false;
06468         callActive = true;
06469         deletionCount++;
06470         this.deleteMessageHeaderAndBodyUsingHeader(lastHeader,
06471                                                    deleteNextHeader);
06472         callActive = false;
06473         if (!deleteTriggered)
06474           return;
06475       }
06476     }.bind(this);
06477     deleteNextHeader();
06478   },
06479 
06480   _purge_findLastAccessCutPoint: function() {
06481     var aranges = this._accuracyRanges,
06482         cutoffDate = $date.NOW() - $sync.BLOCK_PURGE_ONLY_AFTER_UNSYNCED_MS;
06483     // When the loop terminates, this is the block we should use to cut, so
06484     // start with an invalid value.
06485     var iCutRange;
06486     for (iCutRange = aranges.length; iCutRange >= 1; iCutRange--) {
06487       var arange = aranges[iCutRange - 1];
06488       // We can destroy things that aren't fully synchronized.
06489       // NB: this case was intended for search-on-server which is not yet
06490       // implemented.
06491       if (!arange.fullSync)
06492         continue;
06493       if (arange.fullSync.updated > cutoffDate)
06494         break;
06495     }
06496     if (iCutRange === aranges.length)
06497       return 0;
06498 
06499     var cutTS = aranges[iCutRange].endTS,
06500         syncRangeMS = $sync.SYNC_RANGE_ENUMS_TO_MS[
06501                         this._account.accountDef.syncRange] ||
06502                       $sync.SYNC_RANGE_ENUMS_TO_MS['auto'],
06503         // Determine the sync horizon, but then subtract an extra day off so
06504         // that the quantization does not take a bite out of the sync range
06505         syncHorizonTS = $date.NOW() - syncRangeMS - DAY_MILLIS;
06506 
06507     // If the proposed cut is more recent than our sync horizon, use the sync
06508     // horizon.
06509     if (STRICTLY_AFTER(cutTS, syncHorizonTS))
06510       return syncHorizonTS;
06511     return cutTS;
06512   },
06513 
06514   _purge_findHardBlockCutPoint: function(blockInfoList) {
06515     if (blockInfoList.length <= $sync.BLOCK_PURGE_HARD_MAX_BLOCK_LIMIT)
06516       return 0;
06517     return blockInfoList[$sync.BLOCK_PURGE_HARD_MAX_BLOCK_LIMIT].startTS;
06518   },
06519 
06533   _findRangeObjIndexForDate: function ifs__findRangeObjIndexForDate(
06534       list, date) {
06535     var i;
06536     // linear scan for now; binary search later
06537     for (i = 0; i < list.length; i++) {
06538       var info = list[i];
06539       // - Stop if we will never find a match if we keep going.
06540       // If our date is after the end of this range, then it will never fall
06541       // inside any subsequent ranges, because they are all chronologically
06542       // earlier than this range.
06543       if (SINCE(date, info.endTS))
06544         return [i, null];
06545       // therefore BEFORE(date, info.endTS)
06546 
06547       if (SINCE(date, info.startTS))
06548         return [i, info];
06549       // (Older than the startTS, keep going.)
06550     }
06551 
06552     return [i, null];
06553   },
06554 
06568   _findRangeObjIndexForDateAndID: function ifs__findRangeObjIndexForDateAndID(
06569       list, date, uid) {
06570     var i;
06571     // linear scan for now; binary search later
06572     for (i = 0; i < list.length; i++) {
06573       var info = list[i];
06574       // - Stop if we will never find a match if we keep going.
06575       // If our date is after the end of this range, then it will never fall
06576       // inside any subsequent ranges, because they are all chronologically
06577       // earlier than this range.
06578       // If our date is the same and our UID is higher, then likewise we
06579       // shouldn't go further because IDs decrease too.
06580       if (STRICTLY_AFTER(date, info.endTS) ||
06581           (date === info.endTS && uid > info.endUID))
06582         return [i, null];
06583       // therefore BEFORE(date, info.endTS) ||
06584       //           (date === info.endTS && uid <= info.endUID)
06585       if (STRICTLY_AFTER(date, info.startTS) ||
06586           (date === info.startTS && uid >= info.startUID))
06587         return [i, info];
06588       // (Older than the startTS, keep going.)
06589     }
06590 
06591     return [i, null];
06592   },
06593 
06594 
06600   _findFirstObjIndexForDateRange: function ifs__findFirstObjIndexForDateRange(
06601       list, startTS, endTS) {
06602     var i;
06603     // linear scan for now; binary search later
06604     for (i = 0; i < list.length; i++) {
06605       var info = list[i];
06606       // - Stop if we will never find a match if we keep going.
06607       // If our comparison range starts AFTER the end of this range, then it
06608       // does not overlap this range and will never overlap any subsequent
06609       // ranges because they are all chronologically earlier than this range.
06610       //
06611       // nb: We are saying that there is no overlap if one range starts where
06612       // the other one ends.  This is consistent with the inclusive/exclusive
06613       // definition of since/before and our ranges.
06614       if (STRICTLY_AFTER(startTS, info.endTS))
06615         return [i, null];
06616       // therefore ON_OR_BEFORE(startTS, info.endTS)
06617 
06618       // nb: SINCE(endTS, info.startTS) is not right here because the equals
06619       // case does not result in overlap because endTS is exclusive.
06620       if (endTS === null || STRICTLY_AFTER(endTS, info.startTS))
06621         return [i, info];
06622       // (no overlap yet)
06623     }
06624 
06625     return [i, null];
06626   },
06627 
06632   _findLastObjIndexForDateRange: function ifs__findLastObjIndexForDateRange(
06633       list, startTS, endTS) {
06634     var i;
06635     // linear scan for now; binary search later
06636     for (i = list.length - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
06637       var info = list[i];
06638       // - Stop if we will never find a match if we keep going.
06639       // If our comparison range ends ON OR BEFORE the end of this range, then
06640       // it does not overlap this range and will never overlap any subsequent
06641       // ranges because they are all chronologically later than this range.
06642       //
06643       // nb: We are saying that there is no overlap if one range starts where
06644       // the other one ends.  This is consistent with the inclusive/exclusive
06645       // definition of since/before and our ranges.
06646       if (ON_OR_BEFORE(endTS, info.startTS))
06647         return [i + 1, null];
06648       // therefore STRICTLY_AFTER(endTS, info.startTS)
06649 
06650       // we match in this entry if the start stamp is before the range's end
06651       if (BEFORE(startTS, info.endTS))
06652         return [i, info];
06653 
06654       // (no overlap yet)
06655     }
06656 
06657     return [0, null];
06658   },
06659 
06660 
06666   _findFirstObjForDateRange: function ifs__findFirstObjForDateRange(
06667       list, startTS, endTS) {
06668     var i;
06669     var dateComparator = endTS === null ? SINCE : IN_BS_DATE_RANGE;
06670     for (i = 0; i < list.length; i++) {
06671       var date = list[i].date;
06672       if (dateComparator(date, startTS, endTS))
06673         return [i, list[i]];
06674     }
06675     return [i, null];
06676   },
06677 
06748   _insertIntoBlockUsingDateAndUID: function ifs__pickInsertionBlocks(
06749       type, date, uid, srvid, estSizeCost, thing, blockPickedCallback) {
06750     var blockInfoList, loadedBlockInfoList, blockMap, makeBlock, insertInBlock,
06751         splitBlock, serverIdBlockMapping;
06752     if (type === 'header') {
06753       blockInfoList = this._headerBlockInfos;
06754       loadedBlockInfoList = this._loadedHeaderBlockInfos;
06755       blockMap = this._headerBlocks;
06756       serverIdBlockMapping = this._serverIdHeaderBlockMapping;
06757       makeBlock = this._bound_makeHeaderBlock;
06758       insertInBlock = this._bound_insertHeaderInBlock;
06759       splitBlock = this._bound_splitHeaderBlock;
06760     }
06761     else {
06762       blockInfoList = this._bodyBlockInfos;
06763       loadedBlockInfoList = this._loadedBodyBlockInfos;
06764       blockMap = this._bodyBlocks;
06765       serverIdBlockMapping = null; // only headers have the mapping
06766       makeBlock = this._bound_makeBodyBlock;
06767       insertInBlock = this._bound_insertBodyInBlock;
06768       splitBlock = this._bound_splitBodyBlock;
06769     }
06770 
06771     // -- find the current containing block / insertion point
06772     var infoTuple = this._findRangeObjIndexForDateAndID(blockInfoList,
06773                                                         date, uid),
06774         iInfo = infoTuple[0], info = infoTuple[1];
06775 
06776     // -- not in a block, find or create one
06777     if (!info) {
06778       // - Create a block if no blocks exist at all.
06779       if (blockInfoList.length === 0) {
06780         info = makeBlock(date, uid, date, uid);
06781         blockInfoList.splice(iInfo, 0, info);
06782         loadedBlockInfoList.push(info);
06783       }
06784       // - Is there a trailing/older dude and we fit?
06785       else if (iInfo < blockInfoList.length &&
06786                blockInfoList[iInfo].estSize + estSizeCost < MAX_BLOCK_SIZE) {
06787         info = blockInfoList[iInfo];
06788 
06789         // We are chronologically/UID-ically more recent, so check the end range
06790         // for expansion needs.
06791         if (STRICTLY_AFTER(date, info.endTS)) {
06792           info.endTS = date;
06793           info.endUID = uid;
06794         }
06795         else if (date === info.endTS &&
06796                  uid > info.endUID) {
06797           info.endUID = uid;
06798         }
06799       }
06800       // - Is there a preceding/younger dude and we fit?
06801       else if (iInfo > 0 &&
06802                blockInfoList[iInfo - 1].estSize + estSizeCost < MAX_BLOCK_SIZE){
06803         info = blockInfoList[--iInfo];
06804 
06805         // We are chronologically less recent, so check the start range for
06806         // expansion needs.
06807         if (BEFORE(date, info.startTS)) {
06808           info.startTS = date;
06809           info.startUID = uid;
06810         }
06811         else if (date === info.startTS &&
06812                  uid < info.startUID) {
06813           info.startUID = uid;
06814         }
06815       }
06816       // Any adjacent blocks at this point are overflowing, so it's now a
06817       // question of who to split.  We pick the one further from the center that
06818       // exists.
06819       // - Preceding (if possible and) suitable OR the only choice
06820       else if ((iInfo > 0 && iInfo < blockInfoList.length / 2) ||
06821                (iInfo === blockInfoList.length)) {
06822         info = blockInfoList[--iInfo];
06823         // We are chronologically less recent, so check the start range for
06824         // expansion needs.
06825         if (BEFORE(date, info.startTS)) {
06826           info.startTS = date;
06827           info.startUID = uid;
06828         }
06829         else if (date === info.startTS &&
06830                  uid < info.startUID) {
06831           info.startUID = uid;
06832         }
06833       }
06834       // - It must be the trailing dude
06835       else {
06836         info = blockInfoList[iInfo];
06837         // We are chronologically/UID-ically more recent, so check the end range
06838         // for expansion needs.
06839         if (STRICTLY_AFTER(date, info.endTS)) {
06840           info.endTS = date;
06841           info.endUID = uid;
06842         }
06843         else if (date === info.endTS &&
06844                  uid > info.endUID) {
06845           info.endUID = uid;
06846         }
06847       }
06848     }
06849     // (info now definitely exists and is definitely in blockInfoList)
06850 
06851     function processBlock(block) { // 'this' gets explicitly bound
06852       // -- perform the insertion
06853       // We could do this after the split, but this makes things simpler if
06854       // we want to factor in the newly inserted thing's size in the
06855       // distribution of bytes.
06856       info.estSize += estSizeCost;
06857       info.count++;
06858       insertInBlock(thing, uid, info, block);
06859 
06860       // -- split if necessary
06861       if (info.count > 1 && info.estSize >= MAX_BLOCK_SIZE) {
06862         // - figure the desired resulting sizes
06863         var firstBlockTarget;
06864         // big part to the center at the edges (favoring front edge)
06865         if (iInfo === 0)
06866           firstBlockTarget = BLOCK_SPLIT_SMALL_PART;
06867         else if (iInfo === blockInfoList.length - 1)
06868           firstBlockTarget = BLOCK_SPLIT_LARGE_PART;
06869         // otherwise equal split
06870         else
06871           firstBlockTarget = BLOCK_SPLIT_EQUAL_PART;
06872 
06873 
06874         // - split
06875         var olderInfo;
06876         olderInfo = splitBlock(info, block, firstBlockTarget);
06877         blockInfoList.splice(iInfo + 1, 0, olderInfo);
06878         loadedBlockInfoList.push(olderInfo);
06879 
06880         // - figure which of the blocks our insertion went in
06881         if (BEFORE(date, olderInfo.endTS) ||
06882             ((date === olderInfo.endTS) && (uid <= olderInfo.endUID))) {
06883           iInfo++;
06884           info = olderInfo;
06885           block = blockMap[info.blockId];
06886         }
06887       }
06888       // otherwise, no split necessary, just use it
06889       if (serverIdBlockMapping && srvid)
06890         serverIdBlockMapping[srvid] = info.blockId;
06891 
06892       if (blockPickedCallback) {
06893         blockPickedCallback(info, block);
06894       }
06895     }
06896 
06897     if (blockMap.hasOwnProperty(info.blockId))
06898       processBlock.call(this, blockMap[info.blockId]);
06899     else
06900       this._loadBlock(type, info, processBlock.bind(this));
06901   },
06902 
06903   runAfterDeferredCalls: function(callback) {
06904     if (this._deferredCalls.length)
06905       this._deferredCalls.push(callback);
06906     else
06907       callback();
06908   },
06909 
06914   _runDeferredCalls: function ifs__runDeferredCalls() {
06915     while (this._deferredCalls.length && this._pendingLoads.length === 0) {
06916       var toCall = this._deferredCalls.shift();
06917       try {
06918         toCall();
06919       }
06920       catch (ex) {
06921         this._LOG.callbackErr(ex);
06922       }
06923     }
06924   },
06925 
06926   _findBlockInfoFromBlockId: function(type, blockId) {
06927     var blockInfoList;
06928     if (type === 'header')
06929       blockInfoList = this._headerBlockInfos;
06930     else
06931       blockInfoList = this._bodyBlockInfos;
06932 
06933     for (var i = 0; i < blockInfoList.length; i++) {
06934       var blockInfo = blockInfoList[i];
06935       if (blockInfo.blockId === blockId)
06936         return blockInfo;
06937     }
06938     return null;
06939   },
06940 
06945   _loadBlock: function ifs__loadBlock(type, blockInfo, callback) {
06946     var blockId = blockInfo.blockId;
06947     var aggrId = type + blockId;
06948     if (this._pendingLoads.indexOf(aggrId) !== -1) {
06949       this._pendingLoadListeners[aggrId].push(callback);
06950       return;
06951     }
06952 
06953     var index = this._pendingLoads.length;
06954     this._pendingLoads.push(aggrId);
06955     this._pendingLoadListeners[aggrId] = [callback];
06956 
06957     var self = this;
06958     function onLoaded(block) {
06959       if (!block)
06960         self._LOG.badBlockLoad(type, blockId);
06961       self._LOG.loadBlock_end(type, blockId, block);
06962       if (type === 'header') {
06963         self._headerBlocks[blockId] = block;
06964         self._loadedHeaderBlockInfos.push(blockInfo);
06965       }
06966       else {
06967         self._bodyBlocks[blockId] = block;
06968         self._loadedBodyBlockInfos.push(blockInfo);
06969       }
06970       self._pendingLoads.splice(self._pendingLoads.indexOf(aggrId), 1);
06971       var listeners = self._pendingLoadListeners[aggrId];
06972       delete self._pendingLoadListeners[aggrId];
06973       for (var i = 0; i < listeners.length; i++) {
06974         try {
06975           listeners[i](block);
06976         }
06977         catch (ex) {
06978           self._LOG.callbackErr(ex);
06979         }
06980       }
06981 
06982       if (self._pendingLoads.length === 0)
06983         self._runDeferredCalls();
06984     }
06985 
06986     this._LOG.loadBlock_begin(type, blockId);
06987     if (type === 'header')
06988       this._imapDb.loadHeaderBlock(this.folderId, blockId, onLoaded);
06989     else
06990       this._imapDb.loadBodyBlock(this.folderId, blockId, onLoaded);
06991   },
06992 
06993   _deleteFromBlock: function ifs__deleteFromBlock(type, date, id, callback) {
06994     var blockInfoList, loadedBlockInfoList, blockMap, deleteFromBlock;
06995     this._LOG.deleteFromBlock(type, date, id);
06996     if (type === 'header') {
06997       blockInfoList = this._headerBlockInfos;
06998       loadedBlockInfoList = this._loadedHeaderBlockInfos;
06999       blockMap = this._headerBlocks;
07000       deleteFromBlock = this._bound_deleteHeaderFromBlock;
07001     }
07002     else {
07003       blockInfoList = this._bodyBlockInfos;
07004       loadedBlockInfoList = this._loadedBodyBlockInfos;
07005       blockMap = this._bodyBlocks;
07006       deleteFromBlock = this._bound_deleteBodyFromBlock;
07007     }
07008 
07009     var infoTuple = this._findRangeObjIndexForDateAndID(blockInfoList,
07010                                                         date, id),
07011         iInfo = infoTuple[0], info = infoTuple[1];
07012     // If someone is asking for us to delete something, there should definitely
07013     // be a block that includes it!
07014     if (!info) {
07015       this._LOG.badDeletionRequest(type, date, id);
07016       return;
07017     }
07018 
07019     function processBlock(block) {
07020       // The delete function is in charge of updating the start/end TS/ID info
07021       // because it knows about the internal block structure to do so.
07022       deleteFromBlock(id, info, block);
07023 
07024       // - Nuke the block if it's empty
07025       if (info.count === 0) {
07026         blockInfoList.splice(iInfo, 1);
07027         delete blockMap[info.blockId];
07028         loadedBlockInfoList.splice(loadedBlockInfoList.indexOf(info), 1);
07029 
07030         this._dirty = true;
07031         if (type === 'header')
07032           this._dirtyHeaderBlocks[info.blockId] = null;
07033         else
07034           this._dirtyBodyBlocks[info.blockId] = null;
07035       }
07036       if (callback)
07037         callback();
07038     }
07039     if (blockMap.hasOwnProperty(info.blockId))
07040       processBlock.call(this, blockMap[info.blockId]);
07041     else
07042       this._loadBlock(type, info, processBlock.bind(this));
07043   },
07044 
07081   sliceOpenMostRecent: function fs_sliceOpenMostRecent(slice, forceRefresh) {
07082     // Set the status immediately so that the UI will convey that the request is
07083     // being processed, even though it might take a little bit to acquire the
07084     // mutex.
07085     slice.setStatus('synchronizing', false, true, false,
07086                     SYNC_START_MINIMUM_PROGRESS);
07087     this.runMutexed(
07088       'sync',
07089       this._sliceOpenMostRecent.bind(this, slice, forceRefresh));
07090   },
07091   _sliceOpenMostRecent: function fs__sliceOpenMostRecent(slice, forceRefresh,
07092                                                          releaseMutex) {
07093     // We only put the slice in the list of slices now that we have the mutex
07094     // in order to avoid having the slice have data fed into it if there were
07095     // other synchronizations already in progress.
07096     this._slices.push(slice);
07097 
07098     var doneCallback = function doneSyncCallback(err, reportSyncStatusAs,
07099                                                  moreExpected) {
07100       if (!reportSyncStatusAs) {
07101         if (err)
07102           reportSyncStatusAs = 'syncfailed';
07103         else
07104           reportSyncStatusAs = 'synced';
07105       }
07106       if (moreExpected === undefined)
07107         moreExpected = false;
07108 
07109       slice.waitingOnData = false;
07110       slice.setStatus(reportSyncStatusAs, true, moreExpected, true);
07111       this._curSyncSlice = null;
07112 
07113       releaseMutex();
07114     }.bind(this);
07115 
07116     // -- grab from database if we have ever synchronized this folder
07117     // OR if it's synthetic
07118     if (this._accuracyRanges.length || this.folderMeta.type === 'localdrafts') {
07119       // We can only trigger a refresh if we are online.  Our caller may want to
07120       // force the refresh, ignoring recency data.  (This logic was too ugly as
07121       // a straight-up boolean/ternarny combo.)
07122       var triggerRefresh;
07123       if (this._account.universe.online && this.folderSyncer.syncable &&
07124           this.folderMeta.type !== 'localdrafts') {
07125         if (forceRefresh)
07126           triggerRefresh = 'force';
07127         else
07128           triggerRefresh = true;
07129       }
07130       else {
07131         triggerRefresh = false;
07132       }
07133 
07134       slice.waitingOnData = 'db';
07135       this.getMessagesInImapDateRange(
07136         0, null, $sync.INITIAL_FILL_SIZE, $sync.INITIAL_FILL_SIZE,
07137         // trigger a refresh if we are online
07138         this.onFetchDBHeaders.bind(
07139           this, slice, triggerRefresh,
07140           doneCallback, releaseMutex)
07141       );
07142       return;
07143     }
07144     // (we have never synchronized this folder)
07145 
07146     // -- no work to do if we are offline or synthetic folder
07147     if (!this._account.universe.online ||
07148         this.folderMeta.type === 'localdrafts') {
07149       doneCallback();
07150       return;
07151     }
07152     // If the folder can't be synchronized right now, just report the sync as
07153     // blocked. We'll update it soon enough.
07154     if (!this.folderSyncer.syncable) {
07155       console.log('Synchronization is currently blocked; waiting...');
07156       doneCallback(null, 'syncblocked', true);
07157       return;
07158     }
07159 
07160     // -- Bad existing data, issue a sync
07161     var progressCallback = slice.setSyncProgress.bind(slice);
07162     var syncCallback = function syncCallback(syncMode, accumulateMode,
07163                                              ignoreHeaders) {
07164       slice.waitingOnData = syncMode;
07165       if (accumulateMode && slice.headers.length === 0) {
07166         slice._accumulating = true;
07167       }
07168       if (ignoreHeaders) {
07169         slice.ignoreHeaders = true;
07170       }
07171       this._curSyncSlice = slice;
07172     }.bind(this);
07173 
07174     // The slice flags are not yet valid; we are primarily interested in having
07175     // atTop be true when splice notifications for generated as headers are
07176     // added.
07177     slice._updateSliceFlags();
07178     this.folderSyncer.initialSync(
07179       slice, $sync.INITIAL_SYNC_DAYS,
07180       syncCallback, doneCallback, progressCallback);
07181   },
07182 
07224   growSlice: function ifs_growSlice(slice, dirMagnitude, userRequestsGrowth) {
07225     // If the user requested synchronization, provide UI feedback immediately,
07226     // otherwise, let the method set this state if/when we actually decide to
07227     // talk to the server.
07228     if (userRequestsGrowth)
07229       slice.setStatus('synchronizing', false, true, false,
07230                       SYNC_START_MINIMUM_PROGRESS);
07231     this.runMutexed(
07232       'grow',
07233       this._growSlice.bind(this, slice, dirMagnitude, userRequestsGrowth));
07234   },
07235   _growSlice: function ifs__growSlice(slice, dirMagnitude, userRequestsGrowth,
07236                                       releaseMutex) {
07237     var dir, desiredCount;
07238 
07239     var batchHeaders = [];
07240     // --- process messages
07241     var gotMessages = function gotMessages(headers, moreExpected) {
07242       if (headers.length === 0) {
07243         // no array manipulation required
07244       }
07245       if (dir === PASTWARDS) {
07246         batchHeaders = batchHeaders.concat(headers);
07247       }
07248       else { // dir === FUTUREWARDS
07249         batchHeaders = headers.concat(batchHeaders);
07250       }
07251 
07252       if (moreExpected)
07253         return;
07254 
07255       // -- callbacks which may or may not get used
07256       var doneCallback = function doneGrowCallback(err) {
07257         // In a refresh, we may have asked for more than we know about in case
07258         // of a refresh at the edge where the database didn't have all the
07259         // headers we wanted, so latch it now.
07260         slice.desiredHeaders = slice.headers.length;
07261         slice.waitingOnData = false;
07262         slice.setStatus(err ? 'syncfailed' : 'synced', true, false, true);
07263         this._curSyncSlice = null;
07264 
07265         releaseMutex();
07266       }.bind(this);
07267 
07268       var progressCallback = slice.setSyncProgress.bind(slice);
07269 
07270       // -- Handle already-known headers
07271       if (batchHeaders.length) {
07272         var refreshInterval;
07273 
07274         // - compute refresh interval, if needed
07275             // offline? don't need a refresh!
07276         if (!this._account.universe.online ||
07277             // disabled account? don't need a refresh!
07278             !this._account.enabled ||
07279             // can't incrementally refresh? don't need a refresh!
07280             !this.folderSyncer.canGrowSync) {
07281           refreshInterval = null;
07282         }
07283         else {
07284           // - Figure out refresh range.
07285           // We want to make sure that our refresh covers any gaps between the
07286           // last message in our slice and the first message that we retrieved.
07287 
07288           // NB: endTS is exclusive, so we need to pad it out by a day relative
07289           // to a known message if we want to make sure it gets covered by the
07290           // sync range.
07291 
07292           // NB: We quantize to whole dates, but compensate for server timezones
07293           // so that our refresh actually lines up with the messages we are
07294           // interested in.  (We want the date in the server's timezone, so we
07295           // add the timezone to be relative to that timezone.)  We do adjust
07296           // startTS for the timezone offset in here rather than in the
07297           // quantization blow below because we do not timezone adjust the oldest
07298           // full sync date because it's already in the right 'units'.
07299 
07300           var highestLegalEndTS;
07301           // If we hit the highestLegalEndTS, flag that we should mark endTS as
07302           // open-ended if we decide we do need to refresh.
07303           var openEndTS = false;
07304 
07305           var startTS, endTS;
07306           if (dir === PASTWARDS) {
07307             var oldestHeader = batchHeaders[batchHeaders.length - 1];
07308             // If we were always going to sync the entire day, we could
07309             // subtract an entire day off of slice.startTS, but we are planning
07310             // to start grabbing less than whole days, so we want to leave it
07311             // up to checkAccuracyCoverageNeedingRefresh to get rid of any
07312             // redundant coverage of what we are currently looking at.
07313             //
07314             // We do want to cap the date so that we don't re-refresh today and
07315             // any other intervening days spuriously.  When we sync we only use
07316             // an endTS of tz-adjusted NOW(), so our rounding up can be too
07317             // aggressive otherwise and prevent range shrinking.  We call
07318             // quantizeDateUp afterwards so that if any part of the day is still
07319             // covered we will have our refresh cover it.
07320             //
07321             // NB: We use OPEN_REFRESH_THRESH_MS here because since we are
07322             // growing past-wards, we don't really care about refreshing things
07323             // in our future.  This is not the case for FUTUREWARDS.
07324             highestLegalEndTS = NOW() - $sync.OPEN_REFRESH_THRESH_MS +
07325                                   this._account.tzOffset;
07326             endTS = slice.startTS + $date.DAY_MILLIS + this._account.tzOffset;
07327 
07328             if (this.headerIsOldestKnown(oldestHeader.date, oldestHeader.id))
07329               startTS = this.getOldestFullSyncDate();
07330             else
07331               startTS = oldestHeader.date + this._account.tzOffset;
07332           }
07333           else { // dir === FUTUREWARDS
07334             // Unlike PASTWARDS, we do want to be more aggressively up-to-date
07335             // about the future, so only subtract off the grow range coverage.
07336             // (If we didn't subtract anything off, quick scrolling back and
07337             // forth could cause us to refresh more frequently than
07338             // GROW_REFRESH_THRESH_MS, which is not what we want.)
07339             highestLegalEndTS = NOW() - $sync.GROW_REFRESH_THRESH_MS +
07340                                   this._account.tzOffset;
07341 
07342             var youngestHeader = batchHeaders[0];
07343             // see the PASTWARDS case for why we don't add a day to this
07344             startTS = slice.endTS + this._account.tzOffset;
07345             endTS = youngestHeader.date + $date.DAY_MILLIS +
07346                       this._account.tzOffset;
07347           }
07348           // We do not want this clamped/saturated case quantized, but we do
07349           // want all the (other) future-dated endTS cases quantized.
07350           if (STRICTLY_AFTER(endTS, highestLegalEndTS)) {
07351             endTS = highestLegalEndTS;
07352             openEndTS = true;
07353           }
07354           else {
07355             endTS = quantizeDate(endTS);
07356           }
07357 
07358           // Now, it's not super-likely, but it is possible that because of
07359           // clock skew or what not that our startTS could end up after our
07360           // endTS, which we do not want.  Now, we could just clamp this,
07361           // but since we know the result would be a zero-coverage range,
07362           // we can just set the refreshInterval to null and be done.
07363           if (SINCE(startTS, endTS))
07364             refreshInterval = null;
07365           else
07366             refreshInterval = this.checkAccuracyCoverageNeedingRefresh(
07367               quantizeDate(startTS),
07368               endTS, // quantized above except when it would go into the future.
07369               $sync.GROW_REFRESH_THRESH_MS);
07370         }
07371 
07372         // We could also send the headers in as they come across the wire,
07373         // but we expect to be dealing in bite-sized requests, so that could
07374         // be overkill.
07375         slice.batchAppendHeaders(
07376           batchHeaders, dir === PASTWARDS ? -1 : 0,
07377           // !!refreshInterval is more efficient, but this way we can reuse
07378           // doneCallback() below in the else case simply.
07379           true);
07380         // If the database had fewer headers than are requested, it's possible
07381         // the refresh may give us extras, so allow those to be reported.
07382         slice.desiredHeaders = Math.max(slice.headers.length, desiredCount);
07383 
07384         if (refreshInterval &&
07385             // If the values are the same, by definition we have nothing to do,
07386             // but more importantly, the rounding might not improve the
07387             // situation, which could result in pathological sync failure on
07388             // gmail where it returns all the messages it knows about.
07389             refreshInterval.startTS !== refreshInterval.endTS) {
07390 
07391           // If growth was not requested, make sure we convey server traffic is
07392           // happening.
07393           if (!userRequestsGrowth)
07394             slice.setStatus('synchronizing', false, true, false,
07395                             SYNC_START_MINIMUM_PROGRESS);
07396 
07397           this.folderSyncer.refreshSync(
07398             slice, dir,
07399             quantizeDate(refreshInterval.startTS),
07400             // If we didn't shrink the endTS and we flagged to be open-ended, then
07401             // use null.  But if we did shrink the range, then there's no need to
07402             // go open-ended.
07403             (openEndTS && refreshInterval.endTS === highestLegalEndTS) ? null
07404               : quantizeDateUp(refreshInterval.endTS),
07405             /* origStartTS */ null,
07406             doneCallback, progressCallback);
07407         }
07408         else {
07409           doneCallback();
07410         }
07411 
07412         return;
07413       }
07414 
07415       // -- grow!
07416       // - do not grow if offline / no support / no user request
07417       if (!this._account.universe.online ||
07418           !this.folderSyncer.canGrowSync ||
07419           !userRequestsGrowth) {
07420         if (this.folderSyncer.syncable)
07421           slice.sendEmptyCompletion();
07422         releaseMutex();
07423         return;
07424       }
07425 
07426       if (!userRequestsGrowth)
07427         slice.setStatus('synchronizing', false, true, false,
07428                         SYNC_START_MINIMUM_PROGRESS);
07429       this._curSyncSlice = slice;
07430       slice.waitingOnData = 'grow';
07431       // We only add the desired count now that we are sure we are growing; if
07432       // we did it earlier we might boost the desiredHeaders count and then
07433       // not sync, resulting in the next time we do grow fetching more than we
07434       // want.
07435       slice.desiredHeaders += desiredCount;
07436 
07437       // TODO: when we support partial day sync, these growth steps will need
07438       // to be adjusted by 1-day if day covering the edge message has not been
07439       // fully synchronized.
07440       this.folderSyncer.growSync(
07441         slice, dir,
07442         dir === PASTWARDS ? quantizeDate(slice.startTS)
07443                           : quantizeDate(slice.endTS + $date.DAY_MILLIS),
07444         $sync.INITIAL_SYNC_GROWTH_DAYS,
07445         doneCallback, progressCallback);
07446     }.bind(this);
07447 
07448     // --- request messages
07449     if (dirMagnitude < 0) {
07450       dir = FUTUREWARDS;
07451       desiredCount = -dirMagnitude;
07452 
07453       this.getMessagesAfterMessage(
07454         slice.endTS, slice.endUID, desiredCount, gotMessages);
07455     }
07456     else {
07457       dir = PASTWARDS;
07458       desiredCount = dirMagnitude;
07459 
07460       this.getMessagesBeforeMessage(
07461         slice.startTS, slice.startUID, desiredCount, gotMessages);
07462     }
07463   },
07464 
07470   sliceShrunk: function fs_sliceShrunk(slice) {
07471     if (this._mutexQueue.length === 0)
07472       this.flushExcessCachedBlocks('shrunk');
07473   },
07474 
07488   refreshSlice: function fs_refreshSlice(slice) {
07489     // Set the status immediately so that the UI will convey that the request is
07490     // being processed, even though it might take a little bit to acquire the
07491     // mutex.
07492     slice.setStatus('synchronizing', false, true, false, 0.0);
07493     this.runMutexed(
07494       'refresh',
07495       this._refreshSlice.bind(this, slice, false));
07496   },
07497   _refreshSlice: function fs__refreshSlice(slice, checkOpenRecency,
07498                                            releaseMutex) {
07499     slice.waitingOnData = 'refresh';
07500 
07501     var startTS = slice.startTS, endTS = slice.endTS,
07502         // In the event we grow the startTS to the dawn of time, then we want
07503         // to also provide the original startTS so that the bisection does not
07504         // need to scan through years of empty space.
07505         origStartTS = null,
07506         // If we are refreshing through 'now', we will count the new messages we
07507         // hear about and update this.newEmailCount once the sync completes.  If
07508         // we are performing any othe sync, the value will not be updated.
07509         newEmailCount = null;
07510 
07511     // - Grow endTS
07512     // If the endTS lines up with the most recent known message for the folder,
07513     // then remove the timestamp constraint so it goes all the way to now.
07514     // OR if we just have no known messages
07515     if (this.headerIsYoungestKnown(endTS, slice.endUID)) {
07516       var prevTS = endTS;
07517       newEmailCount = 0;
07518 
07525       slice._onAddingHeader = function(header, currentSlice) {
07526         if (SINCE(header.date, prevTS) &&
07527             (!header.flags || header.flags.indexOf('\\Seen') === -1)) {
07528           newEmailCount += 1;
07529           if (slice.onNewHeader)
07530             slice.onNewHeader(header);
07531         }
07532       }.bind(this);
07533 
07534       endTS = null;
07535     }
07536     else {
07537       // We want the range to include the day; since it's an exclusive range
07538       // quantized to midnight, we need to adjust forward a day and then
07539       // quantize.  We also need to compensate for the timezone; we want this
07540       // time in terms of server time, so we add the timezone offset.
07541       endTS = quantizeDate(endTS + DAY_MILLIS + this._account.tzOffset);
07542     }
07543 
07544     // - Grow startTS
07545     // Grow the start-stamp to include the oldest continuous accuracy range
07546     // coverage date.  Keep original date around for bisect per above.
07547     if (this.headerIsOldestKnown(startTS, slice.startUID)) {
07548       origStartTS = quantizeDate(startTS + this._account.tzOffset);
07549       startTS = this.getOldestFullSyncDate();
07550     }
07551     // If we didn't grow based on the accuracy range, then apply the time-zone
07552     // adjustment so that our day coverage covers the actual INTERNALDATE day
07553     // of the start message.
07554     else {
07555       startTS += this._account.tzOffset;
07556     }
07557 
07558     // quantize the start date
07559     if (startTS)
07560       startTS = quantizeDate(startTS);
07561 
07562     var doneCallback = function refreshDoneCallback(err, bisectInfo,
07563                                                     numMessages) {
07564       slice._onAddingHeader = null;
07565 
07566       var reportSyncStatusAs = 'synced';
07567       switch (err) {
07568         case 'aborted':
07569         case 'unknown':
07570           reportSyncStatusAs = 'syncfailed';
07571           break;
07572       }
07573 
07574       releaseMutex();
07575       slice.waitingOnData = false;
07576       slice.setStatus(reportSyncStatusAs, true, false, false, null,
07577                       newEmailCount);
07578       return undefined;
07579     }.bind(this);
07580 
07581 
07582     // In the initial open case, we support a constant that allows us to
07583     // fast-path out without bothering the server.
07584     if (checkOpenRecency) {
07585       // We use now less the refresh threshold as the accuracy range end-post;
07586       // since markSyncRange uses NOW() when 'null' is provided (which it will
07587       // be for a sync through now), this all works out consistently.
07588       if (this.checkAccuracyCoverageNeedingRefresh(
07589              startTS,
07590              endTS ||
07591                NOW() - $sync.OPEN_REFRESH_THRESH_MS + this._account.tzOffset,
07592              $sync.OPEN_REFRESH_THRESH_MS) === null) {
07593         doneCallback();
07594         return;
07595       }
07596     }
07597 
07598     // The choice of PASTWARDS/FUTUREWARDS impacts the direction our chunks
07599     // happen if we have to bisect (if that happens) and (eventually) the
07600     // direction new bodies are fetched.
07601     //
07602     // There are arguments for both choices:
07603     //
07604     // Initial slice open refresh:
07605     // - PASTWARDS: Show the user the newest messages, but at the cost of a
07606     //   gap between the known messages and these new messages we are
07607     //   synchronizing in.  The gap is potentially confusing and ordering could
07608     //   also be confusing to the user.
07609     // - FUTUREWARDS: Avoid that gap, having the scrolling make sense.
07610     //   There is a pathological case here where we are ridiculously out-of-date
07611     //   and it would take the user a loooong time to sync all the way back up
07612     //   to now and it would be better to just restart with an initial deepening
07613     //   sync and/or throw things away.  Arguably, these are cases that should
07614     //   be explicitly handled outside of us.
07615     //
07616     // Manual refresh:
07617     // - PASTWARDS: Newest first.
07618     // - FUTUREWARDS: Have the messages show up in the order they were received.
07619     //
07620     // We currently choose FUTUREWARDS to avoid the gap and have messages show
07621     // up chronologically.
07622     this.folderSyncer.refreshSync(
07623       slice, FUTUREWARDS, startTS, endTS, origStartTS,
07624       doneCallback, slice.setSyncProgress.bind(slice));
07625   },
07626 
07627   _resetAndResyncSlice: function(slice, forceRefresh, releaseMutex) {
07628     this._slices.splice(this._slices.indexOf(slice), 1);
07629     if (releaseMutex)
07630       this._sliceOpenMostRecent(slice, forceRefresh, releaseMutex);
07631     else
07632       this.sliceOpenMostRecent(slice, forceRefresh);
07633   },
07634 
07635   dyingSlice: function ifs_dyingSlice(slice) {
07636     var idx = this._slices.indexOf(slice);
07637     this._slices.splice(idx, 1);
07638 
07639     if (this._slices.length === 0 && this._mutexQueue.length === 0)
07640       this.folderSyncer.allConsumersDead();
07641   },
07642 
07646   onFetchDBHeaders: function(slice, triggerRefresh, doneCallback, releaseMutex,
07647                              headers, moreMessagesComing) {
07648     var triggerNow = false;
07649     if (!moreMessagesComing && triggerRefresh) {
07650       moreMessagesComing = true;
07651       triggerNow = true;
07652     }
07653 
07654     if (headers.length) {
07655       // Claim there are more headers coming since we will trigger setStatus
07656       // right below and we want that to be the only edge transition.
07657       slice.batchAppendHeaders(headers, -1, true);
07658     }
07659 
07660     if (!moreMessagesComing) {
07661       slice.desiredHeaders = slice.headers.length;
07662       doneCallback();
07663     }
07664     else if (triggerNow) {
07665       slice.desiredHeaders = slice.headers.length;
07666       // refreshSlice expects this to be null for two reasons:
07667       // 1) Invariant about only having one sync-like thing happening at a time.
07668       // 2) We want to generate header deltas rather than initial filling,
07669       //    and this is keyed off of whether the slice is the current sync
07670       //    slice.
07671       this._curSyncSlice = null;
07672       // We want to have the refresh check its refresh recency range unless we
07673       // have been explicitly told to force a refresh.
07674       var checkOpenRecency = triggerRefresh !== 'force';
07675       this._refreshSlice(slice, checkOpenRecency, releaseMutex);
07676     }
07677   },
07678 
07679   sliceQuicksearch: function ifs_sliceQuicksearch(slice, searchParams) {
07680   },
07681 
07682   getYoungestMessageTimestamp: function() {
07683     if (!this._headerBlockInfos.length)
07684       return 0;
07685     return this._headerBlockInfos[0].endTS;
07686   },
07687 
07694   headerIsYoungestKnown: function(date, uid) {
07695     // NB: unlike oldest known, this should not actually be impacted by messages
07696     // found by search.
07697     if (!this._headerBlockInfos.length)
07698       return (date === null && uid === null);
07699     var blockInfo = this._headerBlockInfos[0];
07700 
07701     return (date === blockInfo.endTS &&
07702             uid === blockInfo.endUID);
07703   },
07704 
07705   getOldestMessageTimestamp: function() {
07706     if (!this._headerBlockInfos.length)
07707       return 0;
07708     return this._headerBlockInfos[this._headerBlockInfos.length - 1].startTS;
07709   },
07710 
07717   headerIsOldestKnown: function(date, uid) {
07718     // TODO: when we implement search, this logic will need to be more clever
07719     // to check our full-sync range since we may indeed have cached messages
07720     // from way in the past.
07721     if (!this._headerBlockInfos.length)
07722       return (date === null && uid === null);
07723 
07724     var blockInfo = this._headerBlockInfos[this._headerBlockInfos.length - 1];
07725     return (date === blockInfo.startTS &&
07726             uid === blockInfo.startUID);
07727   },
07728 
07732   getNewestFullSyncDate: function() {
07733     // If we have any accuracy range, it should be what we want.
07734     if (this._accuracyRanges.length)
07735       return this._accuracyRanges[0].endTS;
07736     // If we have no accuracy ranges, then 0 at least safely indicates we are
07737     // not up-to-date.
07738     return 0;
07739   },
07740 
07745   getOldestFullSyncDate: function() {
07746     // Start at the oldest index and run towards the newest until we find a
07747     // fully synced range or run out of ranges.
07748     //
07749     // We used to start at the newest and move towards the oldest since this
07750     // checked our fully-synced-from-now invariant, but that invariant has now
07751     // gone by the wayside and is not required for correctness for the purposes
07752     // of us/our callers.
07753     var idxAR = this._accuracyRanges.length - 1;
07754     // Run futurewards in time until we find one without a fullSync or run out
07755     while (idxAR >= 0 &&
07756            !this._accuracyRanges[idxAR].fullSync) {
07757       idxAR--;
07758     }
07759     // Sanity-check, use.
07760     var syncTS;
07761     if (idxAR >= 0)
07762       syncTS = this._accuracyRanges[idxAR].startTS;
07763     else
07764       syncTS = NOW();
07765     return syncTS;
07766   },
07767 
07773   syncedToToday: function() {
07774     if (!this.folderSyncer.canGrowSync)
07775       return true;
07776 
07777     var newestSyncTS = this.getNewestFullSyncDate();
07778     return SINCE(newestSyncTS, quantizeDate(NOW() + this._account.tzOffset));
07779   },
07780 
07791   syncedToDawnOfTime: function() {
07792     if (!this.folderSyncer.canGrowSync)
07793       return true;
07794 
07795     var oldestSyncTS = this.getOldestFullSyncDate();
07796     // We add a day to the oldest sync date to allow for some timezone-related
07797     // slop.  This is done defensively.  Unit tests ensure that our refresh of
07798     // synced-to-the-dawn-of-time does not result in date drift that would cause
07799     // the date to slowly move in and escape the slop.
07800     return ON_OR_BEFORE(oldestSyncTS, $sync.OLDEST_SYNC_DATE + $date.DAY_MILLIS);
07801   },
07802 
07806   getKnownMessageCount: function() {
07807     var count = 0;
07808     for (var i = 0; i < this._headerBlockInfos.length; i++) {
07809       var blockInfo = this._headerBlockInfos[i];
07810       count += blockInfo.count;
07811     }
07812     return count;
07813   },
07814 
07846   getMessagesInImapDateRange: function ifs_getMessagesInDateRange(
07847       startTS, endTS, minDesired, maxDesired, messageCallback) {
07848     var toFill = (minDesired != null) ? minDesired : $sync.TOO_MANY_MESSAGES,
07849         maxFill = (maxDesired != null) ? maxDesired : $sync.TOO_MANY_MESSAGES,
07850         self = this,
07851         // header block info iteration
07852         iHeadBlockInfo = null, headBlockInfo;
07853 
07854     // find the first header block with the data we want
07855     var headerPair = this._findFirstObjIndexForDateRange(
07856                        this._headerBlockInfos, startTS, endTS);
07857     iHeadBlockInfo = headerPair[0];
07858     headBlockInfo = headerPair[1];
07859     if (!headBlockInfo) {
07860       // no blocks equals no messages.
07861       messageCallback([], false);
07862       return;
07863     }
07864 
07865     function fetchMore() {
07866       while (true) {
07867         // - load the header block if required
07868         if (!self._headerBlocks.hasOwnProperty(headBlockInfo.blockId)) {
07869           self._loadBlock('header', headBlockInfo, fetchMore);
07870           return;
07871         }
07872         var headerBlock = self._headerBlocks[headBlockInfo.blockId];
07873         // - use up as many headers in the block as possible
07874         // (previously used destructuring, but we want uglifyjs to work)
07875         var headerTuple = self._findFirstObjForDateRange(
07876                             headerBlock.headers,
07877                             startTS, endTS),
07878             iFirstHeader = headerTuple[0], header = headerTuple[1];
07879         // aw man, no usable messages?!
07880         if (!header) {
07881           messageCallback([], false);
07882           return;
07883         }
07884         // (at least one usable message)
07885 
07886         var iHeader = iFirstHeader;
07887         for (; iHeader < headerBlock.headers.length && maxFill;
07888              iHeader++, maxFill--) {
07889           header = headerBlock.headers[iHeader];
07890           // (we are done if we have found a header earlier than what we want)
07891           if (BEFORE(header.date, startTS))
07892             break;
07893         }
07894         // (iHeader is pointing at the index of message we don't want)
07895         // There is no further processing to do if we bailed early.
07896         if (maxFill && iHeader < headerBlock.headers.length)
07897           toFill = 0;
07898         else
07899           toFill -= iHeader - iFirstHeader;
07900 
07901         if (!toFill) {
07902         }
07903         // - There may be viable messages in the next block, check.
07904         else if (++iHeadBlockInfo >= self._headerBlockInfos.length) {
07905           // Nope, there are no more messages, nothing left to do.
07906           toFill = 0;
07907         }
07908         else {
07909           headBlockInfo = self._headerBlockInfos[iHeadBlockInfo];
07910           // We may not want to go back any farther
07911           if (STRICTLY_AFTER(startTS, headBlockInfo.endTS))
07912             toFill = 0;
07913         }
07914         // generate the notifications fo what we did create
07915         messageCallback(headerBlock.headers.slice(iFirstHeader, iHeader),
07916                         Boolean(toFill));
07917         if (!toFill)
07918           return;
07919         // (there must be some overlap, keep going)
07920       }
07921     }
07922 
07923     fetchMore();
07924   },
07925 
07938   getAllMessagesInImapDateRange: function ifs_getAllMessagesInDateRange(
07939       startTS, endTS, allCallback) {
07940     var allHeaders = null;
07941     function someMessages(headers, moreHeadersExpected) {
07942       if (allHeaders)
07943         allHeaders = allHeaders.concat(headers);
07944       else
07945         allHeaders = headers;
07946       if (!moreHeadersExpected)
07947         allCallback(allHeaders);
07948     }
07949     this.getMessagesInImapDateRange(startTS, endTS, null, null, someMessages);
07950   },
07951 
07959   getMessagesBeforeMessage: function(date, id, limit, messageCallback) {
07960     var toFill = (limit != null) ? limit : $sync.TOO_MANY_MESSAGES, self = this;
07961 
07962     var headerPair, iHeadBlockInfo, headBlockInfo;
07963     if (date) {
07964       headerPair = this._findRangeObjIndexForDateAndID(
07965                      this._headerBlockInfos, date, id);
07966       iHeadBlockInfo = headerPair[0];
07967       headBlockInfo = headerPair[1];
07968     }
07969     else {
07970       iHeadBlockInfo = 0;
07971       headBlockInfo = this._headerBlockInfos[0];
07972     }
07973 
07974     if (!headBlockInfo) {
07975       // The iteration request is somehow not current; log an error and return
07976       // an empty result set.
07977       this._LOG.badIterationStart(date, id);
07978       messageCallback([], false);
07979       return;
07980     }
07981 
07982     var iHeader = null;
07983     function fetchMore() {
07984       while (true) {
07985         // - load the header block if required
07986         if (!self._headerBlocks.hasOwnProperty(headBlockInfo.blockId)) {
07987           self._loadBlock('header', headBlockInfo, fetchMore);
07988           return;
07989         }
07990         var headerBlock = self._headerBlocks[headBlockInfo.blockId];
07991 
07992         // Null means find it by id...
07993         if (iHeader === null) {
07994           if (id !== null)
07995             iHeader = headerBlock.ids.indexOf(id);
07996           else
07997             iHeader = 0;
07998           if (iHeader === -1) {
07999             self._LOG.badIterationStart(date, id);
08000             toFill = 0;
08001           }
08002           iHeader++;
08003         }
08004         // otherwise we know we are starting at the front of the block.
08005         else {
08006           iHeader = 0;
08007         }
08008 
08009         var useHeaders = Math.min(
08010               headerBlock.headers.length - iHeader,
08011               toFill);
08012         if (iHeader >= headerBlock.headers.length)
08013           useHeaders = 0;
08014         toFill -= useHeaders;
08015 
08016         // If there's nothing more to...
08017         if (!toFill) {
08018         }
08019         // - There may be viable messages in the next block, check.
08020         else if (++iHeadBlockInfo >= self._headerBlockInfos.length) {
08021           // Nope, there are no more messages, nothing left to do.
08022           toFill = 0;
08023         }
08024         else {
08025           headBlockInfo = self._headerBlockInfos[iHeadBlockInfo];
08026         }
08027         // generate the notifications for what we did create
08028         messageCallback(headerBlock.headers.slice(iHeader,
08029                                                   iHeader + useHeaders),
08030                         Boolean(toFill));
08031         if (!toFill)
08032           return;
08033         // (there must be some overlap, keep going)
08034       }
08035     }
08036 
08037     fetchMore();
08038   },
08039 
08044   getMessagesAfterMessage: function(date, id, limit, messageCallback) {
