08045     var toFill = (limit != null) ? limit : $sync.TOO_MANY_MESSAGES, self = this;
08046 
08047     var headerPair = this._findRangeObjIndexForDateAndID(
08048                        this._headerBlockInfos, date, id);
08049     var iHeadBlockInfo = headerPair[0];
08050     var headBlockInfo = headerPair[1];
08051 
08052     if (!headBlockInfo) {
08053       // The iteration request is somehow not current; log an error and return
08054       // an empty result set.
08055       this._LOG.badIterationStart(date, id);
08056       messageCallback([], false);
08057       return;
08058     }
08059 
08060     var iHeader = null;
08061     function fetchMore() {
08062       while (true) {
08063         // - load the header block if required
08064         if (!self._headerBlocks.hasOwnProperty(headBlockInfo.blockId)) {
08065           self._loadBlock('header', headBlockInfo, fetchMore);
08066           return;
08067         }
08068         var headerBlock = self._headerBlocks[headBlockInfo.blockId];
08069 
08070         // Null means find it by id...
08071         if (iHeader === null) {
08072           iHeader = headerBlock.ids.indexOf(id);
08073           if (iHeader === -1) {
08074             self._LOG.badIterationStart(date, id);
08075             toFill = 0;
08076           }
08077           iHeader--;
08078         }
08079         // otherwise we know we are starting at the end of the block (and
08080         // moving towards the front)
08081         else {
08082           iHeader = headerBlock.headers.length - 1;
08083         }
08084 
08085         var useHeaders = Math.min(iHeader + 1, toFill);
08086         if (iHeader < 0)
08087           useHeaders = 0;
08088         toFill -= useHeaders;
08089 
08090         // If there's nothing more to...
08091         if (!toFill) {
08092         }
08093         // - There may be viable messages in the previous block, check.
08094         else if (--iHeadBlockInfo < 0) {
08095           // Nope, there are no more messages, nothing left to do.
08096           toFill = 0;
08097         }
08098         else {
08099           headBlockInfo = self._headerBlockInfos[iHeadBlockInfo];
08100         }
08101         // generate the notifications for what we did create
08102         var messages = headerBlock.headers.slice(iHeader - useHeaders + 1,
08103                                                  iHeader + 1);
08104         messageCallback(messages, Boolean(toFill));
08105         if (!toFill)
08106           return;
08107         // (there must be some overlap, keep going)
08108       }
08109     }
08110 
08111     fetchMore();
08112   },
08113 
08114 
08139   markSyncRange: function(startTS, endTS, modseq, updated) {
08140     // If our range was marked open-ended, it's really accurate through now.
08141     // But we don't want true UTC now, we want the now of the server in terms of
08142     // IMAP's crazy SINCE/BEFORE quantized date-range.  If it's already tomorrow
08143     // as far as the server is concerned date-wise, then we need to reflect that
08144     // here.
08145     //
08146     // To really spell it out, let's say that it's currently daylight savings
08147     // time, we live on the east coast (utc-4), and our server is in Europe
08148     // (utc+2).
08149     //
08150     // Let's say it's 7pm, which is 11pm at utc-0 and 1am at utc+2.  NOW() is
08151     // going to net us the 11pm value; we need to add the timezone offset of
08152     // +2 to get to 1am, which is then what we want to use for markSyncRange.
08153     //
08154     if (!endTS)
08155       endTS = NOW() + this._account.tzOffset;
08156     if (startTS > endTS)
08157       throw new Error('Your timestamps are switched!');
08158 
08159     var aranges = this._accuracyRanges;
08160     function makeRange(start, end, modseq, updated) {
08161       return {
08162         startTS: start, endTS: end,
08163         // let an existing fullSync be passed in instead...
08164         fullSync: (typeof(modseq) === 'string') ?
08165           { highestModseq: modseq, updated: updated } :
08166           { highestModseq: modseq.fullSync.highestModseq,
08167             updated: modseq.fullSync.updated },
08168       };
08169     }
08170 
08171     var newInfo = this._findFirstObjIndexForDateRange(aranges, startTS, endTS),
08172         oldInfo = this._findLastObjIndexForDateRange(aranges, startTS, endTS),
08173         newSplits, oldSplits;
08174     // We need to split the new block if we overlap a block and our end range
08175     // is not 'outside' the range.
08176     newSplits = newInfo[1] && STRICTLY_AFTER(newInfo[1].endTS, endTS);
08177     // We need to split the old block if we overlap a block and our start range
08178     // is not 'outside' the range.
08179     oldSplits = oldInfo[1] && BEFORE(oldInfo[1].startTS, startTS);
08180 
08181     var insertions = [],
08182         delCount = oldInfo[0] - newInfo[0];
08183     if (oldInfo[1])
08184       delCount++;
08185 
08186     if (newSplits) {
08187       // should this just be an effective merge with our insertion?
08188       if (newInfo[1].fullSync &&
08189           newInfo[1].fullSync.highestModseq === modseq &&
08190           newInfo[1].fullSync.updated === updated)
08191         endTS = newInfo[1].endTS;
08192       else
08193         insertions.push(makeRange(endTS, newInfo[1].endTS, newInfo[1]));
08194     }
08195     insertions.push(makeRange(startTS, endTS, modseq, updated));
08196     if (oldSplits) {
08197       // should this just be an effective merge with what we just inserted?
08198       if (oldInfo[1].fullSync &&
08199           oldInfo[1].fullSync.highestModseq === modseq &&
08200           oldInfo[1].fullSync.updated === updated)
08201         insertions[insertions.length-1].startTS = oldInfo[1].startTS;
08202       else
08203         insertions.push(makeRange(oldInfo[1].startTS, startTS, oldInfo[1]));
08204     }
08205 
08206     // - merges
08207     // Consider a merge if there is an adjacent accuracy range in the given dir.
08208     var newNeighbor = newInfo[0] > 0 ? aranges[newInfo[0] - 1] : null,
08209         oldAdjust = oldInfo[1] ? 1 : 0,
08210         oldNeighbor = oldInfo[0] < (aranges.length - oldAdjust) ?
08211                         aranges[oldInfo[0] + oldAdjust] : null;
08212     // We merge if our starts and ends line up...
08213     if (newNeighbor &&
08214        insertions[0].endTS === newNeighbor.startTS &&
08215         newNeighbor.fullSync &&
08216         newNeighbor.fullSync.highestModseq === modseq &&
08217         newNeighbor.fullSync.updated === updated) {
08218       insertions[0].endTS = newNeighbor.endTS;
08219       newInfo[0]--;
08220       delCount++;
08221     }
08222     if (oldNeighbor &&
08223         insertions[insertions.length-1].startTS === oldNeighbor.endTS &&
08224         oldNeighbor.fullSync &&
08225         oldNeighbor.fullSync.highestModseq === modseq &&
08226         oldNeighbor.fullSync.updated === updated) {
08227       insertions[insertions.length-1].startTS = oldNeighbor.startTS;
08228       delCount++;
08229     }
08230 
08231     aranges.splice.apply(aranges, [newInfo[0], delCount].concat(insertions));
08232 
08233     /*lastSyncedAt depends on current timestamp of the client device
08234      should not be added timezone offset*/
08235     this.folderMeta.lastSyncedAt = NOW();
08236     if (this._account.universe)
08237       this._account.universe.__notifyModifiedFolder(this._account,
08238                                                     this.folderMeta);
08239   },
08240 
08250   markSyncedToDawnOfTime: function() {
08251     this._LOG.syncedToDawnOfTime();
08252 
08253     // We can just expand the first accuracy range structure to stretch to the
08254     // dawn of time and nuke the rest.
08255     var aranges = this._accuracyRanges;
08256     // (If aranges is the empty list, there are deep invariant problems and
08257     // the exception is desired.)
08258     aranges[aranges.length - 1].startTS = $sync.OLDEST_SYNC_DATE;
08259   },
08260 
08268   clearSyncedToDawnOfTime: function(newOldestTS) {
08269     var aranges = this._accuracyRanges;
08270     if (!aranges.length)
08271       return;
08272     var lastRange = aranges[aranges.length - 1];
08273     // Only update the startTS if it leaves a valid accuracy range
08274     if (STRICTLY_AFTER(lastRange.endTS, newOldestTS)) {
08275       lastRange.startTS = newOldestTS;
08276     }
08277     // Otherwise, pop the range to get rid of the info.  This is a defensive
08278     // programming thing; we do not expect this case to happen, so we log.
08279     else {
08280       this._LOG.accuracyRangeSuspect(lastRange);
08281       aranges.pop();
08282     }
08283   },
08284 
08322   checkAccuracyCoverageNeedingRefresh: function(startTS, endTS, threshMS) {
08323     var aranges = this._accuracyRanges, arange,
08324         newInfo = this._findFirstObjIndexForDateRange(aranges, startTS, endTS),
08325         oldInfo = this._findLastObjIndexForDateRange(aranges, startTS, endTS),
08326         recencyCutoff = NOW() - threshMS;
08327     var result = { startTS: startTS, endTS: endTS };
08328     if (newInfo[1]) {
08329       // - iterate from the 'end', trying to push things as far as we can go.
08330       var i;
08331       for (i = newInfo[0]; i <= oldInfo[0]; i++) {
08332         arange = aranges[i];
08333         // skip out if this range would cause a gap (will not happen in base
08334         // case.)
08335         if (BEFORE(arange.endTS, result.endTS))
08336           break;
08337         // skip out if this range was not fully updated or the data is too old
08338         if (!arange.fullSync ||
08339             BEFORE(arange.fullSync.updated, recencyCutoff))
08340           break;
08341         // if the range covers all of us or further than we need, we are done.
08342         if (ON_OR_BEFORE(arange.startTS, result.startTS))
08343           return null;
08344         // the range only partially covers us; shrink our range and keep going
08345         result.endTS = arange.startTS;
08346       }
08347       // - iterate from the 'start', trying to push things as far as we can go.
08348       // (if we are here, we must not completely cover the range.)
08349       for (i = oldInfo[0]; i >= 0; i--) {
08350         arange = aranges[i];
08351         // skip out if this range would cause a gap
08352         if (STRICTLY_AFTER(arange.startTS, result.startTS))
08353           break;
08354         // skip out if this range was not fully updated or the data is too old
08355         if (!arange.fullSync ||
08356             BEFORE(arange.fullSync.updated, recencyCutoff))
08357           break;
08358         // the range only partially covers us; shrink our range and keep going
08359         result.startTS = arange.endTS;
08360       }
08361     }
08362     return result;
08363   },
08364 
08379   getMessage: function(suid, date, options, callback) {
08380     if (typeof(options) === 'function') {
08381       callback = options;
08382       options = undefined;
08383     }
08384 
08385     var header;
08386     var body;
08387     var pending = 2;
08388 
08389     function next() {
08390       if (!--pending) {
08391         if (!body || !header) {
08392           return callback(null);
08393         }
08394 
08395         callback({ header: header, body: body });
08396       }
08397     }
08398 
08399     this.getMessageHeader(suid, date, function(_header) {
08400       header = _header;
08401       next();
08402     });
08403 
08404     var gotBody = function gotBody(_body) {
08405       body = _body;
08406       next();
08407     };
08408 
08409     if (options && options.withBodyReps) {
08410       this.getMessageBodyWithReps(suid, date, gotBody);
08411     } else {
08412       this.getMessageBody(suid, date, gotBody);
08413     }
08414   },
08415 
08420   getMessageHeader: function ifs_getMessageHeader(suid, date, callback) {
08421     var id = parseInt(suid.substring(suid.lastIndexOf('/') + 1)),
08422         posInfo = this._findRangeObjIndexForDateAndID(this._headerBlockInfos,
08423                                                       date, id);
08424     if (posInfo[1] === null) {
08425       this._LOG.headerNotFound();
08426       try {
08427         callback(null);
08428       }
08429       catch (ex) {
08430         this._LOG.callbackErr(ex);
08431       }
08432       return;
08433     }
08434     var headerBlockInfo = posInfo[1], self = this;
08435     if (!(this._headerBlocks.hasOwnProperty(headerBlockInfo.blockId))) {
08436       this._loadBlock('header', headerBlockInfo, function(headerBlock) {
08437           var idx = headerBlock.ids.indexOf(id);
08438           var headerInfo = headerBlock.headers[idx] || null;
08439           if (!headerInfo)
08440             self._LOG.headerNotFound();
08441           try {
08442             callback(headerInfo);
08443           }
08444           catch (ex) {
08445             self._LOG.callbackErr(ex);
08446           }
08447         });
08448       return;
08449     }
08450     var block = this._headerBlocks[headerBlockInfo.blockId],
08451         idx = block.ids.indexOf(id),
08452         headerInfo = block.headers[idx] || null;
08453     if (!headerInfo)
08454       this._LOG.headerNotFound();
08455     try {
08456       callback(headerInfo);
08457     }
08458     catch (ex) {
08459       this._LOG.callbackErr(ex);
08460     }
08461   },
08462 
08466   getMessageHeaders: function ifs_getMessageHeaders(namers, callback) {
08467     var pending = namers.length;
08468 
08469     var headers = [];
08470     var gotHeader = function gotHeader(header) {
08471       if (header) {
08472         headers.push(header);
08473       }
08474 
08475       if (!--pending) {
08476         callback(headers);
08477       }
08478     };
08479     for (var i = 0; i < namers.length; i++) {
08480       var namer = namers[i];
08481       this.getMessageHeader(namer.suid, namer.date, gotHeader);
08482     }
08483   },
08484 
08488   addMessageHeader: function ifs_addMessageHeader(header, callback) {
08489     if (this._pendingLoads.length) {
08490       this._deferredCalls.push(this.addMessageHeader.bind(
08491                                  this, header, callback));
08492       return;
08493     }
08494     this._LOG.addMessageHeader(header.date, header.id, header.srvid);
08495 
08496     if (this._curSyncSlice && !this._curSyncSlice.ignoreHeaders)
08497       this._curSyncSlice.onHeaderAdded(header, true, true);
08498     // - Generate notifications for (other) interested slices
08499     if (this._slices.length > (this._curSyncSlice ? 1 : 0)) {
08500       var date = header.date, uid = header.id;
08501       for (var iSlice = 0; iSlice < this._slices.length; iSlice++) {
08502         var slice = this._slices[iSlice];
08503         if (slice === this._curSyncSlice)
08504           continue;
08505 
08506         // Note: the following control flow is to decide when to bail; if we
08507         // make it through the conditionals, the header gets reported to the
08508         // slice.
08509 
08510         // (if the slice is empty, it cares about any header, so keep going)
08511         if (slice.startTS !== null) {
08512           // We never automatically grow a slice into the past if we are full,
08513           // but we do allow it if not full.
08514           if (BEFORE(date, slice.startTS)) {
08515             if (slice.headers.length >= slice.desiredHeaders)
08516               continue;
08517           }
08518           // We do grow a slice into the present if it's already up-to-date.
08519           // We do count messages from the same second as our
08520           else if (SINCE(date, slice.endTS)) {
08521             // !(covers most recently known message)
08522             if(!(this._headerBlockInfos.length &&
08523                  slice.endTS === this._headerBlockInfos[0].endTS &&
08524                  slice.endUID === this._headerBlockInfos[0].endUID))
08525               continue;
08526           }
08527           else if ((date === slice.startTS &&
08528                     uid < slice.startUID) ||
08529                    (date === slice.endTS &&
08530                     uid > slice.endUID)) {
08531             continue;
08532           }
08533         }
08534         else {
08535           // Make sure to increase the number of desired headers so the
08536           // truncating heuristic won't rule the header out.
08537           slice.desiredHeaders++;
08538         }
08539 
08540         if (slice._onAddingHeader)
08541           slice._onAddingHeader(header);
08542 
08543         slice.onHeaderAdded(header, false, true);
08544       }
08545     }
08546 
08547 
08548     this._insertIntoBlockUsingDateAndUID(
08549       'header', header.date, header.id, header.srvid,
08550       $sync.HEADER_EST_SIZE_IN_BYTES, header, callback);
08551   },
08552 
08565   updateMessageHeader: function ifs_updateMessageHeader(date, id, partOfSync,
08566                                                         headerOrMutationFunc,
08567                                                         callback) {
08568     // (While this method can complete synchronously, we want to maintain its
08569     // perceived ordering relative to those that cannot be.)
08570     if (this._pendingLoads.length) {
08571       this._deferredCalls.push(this.updateMessageHeader.bind(
08572                                  this, date, id, partOfSync,
08573                                  headerOrMutationFunc, callback));
08574       return;
08575     }
08576 
08577     // We need to deal with the potential for the block having been discarded
08578     // from memory thanks to the potential asynchrony due to pending loads or
08579     // on the part of the caller.
08580     var infoTuple = this._findRangeObjIndexForDateAndID(
08581                       this._headerBlockInfos, date, id),
08582         iInfo = infoTuple[0], info = infoTuple[1], self = this;
08583     function doUpdateHeader(block) {
08584       var idx = block.ids.indexOf(id), header;
08585       if (idx === -1) {
08586         // Call the mutation func with null to let it know we couldn't find the
08587         // header.
08588         if (headerOrMutationFunc instanceof Function)
08589           headerOrMutationFunc(null);
08590         else
08591           throw new Error('Failed to find ID ' + id + '!');
08592       }
08593       else if (headerOrMutationFunc instanceof Function) {
08594         // If it returns false it means that the header did not change and so
08595         // there is no need to mark anything dirty and we can leave without
08596         // notifying anyone.
08597         if (!headerOrMutationFunc((header = block.headers[idx])))
08598           header = null;
08599       }
08600       else {
08601         header = block.headers[idx] = headerOrMutationFunc;
08602       }
08603       // only dirty us and generate notifications if there is a header
08604       if (header) {
08605         self._dirty = true;
08606         self._dirtyHeaderBlocks[info.blockId] = block;
08607 
08608         self._LOG.updateMessageHeader(header.date, header.id, header.srvid);
08609 
08610         if (self._slices.length > (self._curSyncSlice ? 1 : 0)) {
08611           for (var iSlice = 0; iSlice < self._slices.length; iSlice++) {
08612             var slice = self._slices[iSlice];
08613             if (partOfSync && slice === self._curSyncSlice)
08614               continue;
08615             if (BEFORE(date, slice.startTS) ||
08616                 STRICTLY_AFTER(date, slice.endTS))
08617               continue;
08618             if ((date === slice.startTS &&
08619                  id < slice.startUID) ||
08620                 (date === slice.endTS &&
08621                  id > slice.endUID))
08622               continue;
08623             slice.onHeaderModified(header);
08624           }
08625         }
08626       }
08627       if (callback)
08628         callback();
08629     }
08630     if (!info) {
08631       if (headerOrMutationFunc instanceof Function)
08632         headerOrMutationFunc(null);
08633       else
08634         throw new Error('Failed to find block containing header with date: ' +
08635                         date + ' id: ' + id);
08636     }
08637     else if (!this._headerBlocks.hasOwnProperty(info.blockId))
08638       this._loadBlock('header', info, doUpdateHeader);
08639     else
08640       doUpdateHeader(this._headerBlocks[info.blockId]);
08641   },
08642 
08646   updateMessageHeaderByServerId: function(srvid, partOfSync,
08647                                           headerOrMutationFunc) {
08648     if (this._pendingLoads.length) {
08649       this._deferredCalls.push(this.updateMessageHeaderByServerId.bind(
08650         this, srvid, partOfSync, headerOrMutationFunc));
08651       return;
08652     }
08653 
08654     var blockId = this._serverIdHeaderBlockMapping[srvid];
08655     if (srvid === undefined) {
08656       this._LOG.serverIdMappingMissing(srvid);
08657       return;
08658     }
08659 
08660     var findInBlock = function findInBlock(headerBlock) {
08661       var headers = headerBlock.headers;
08662       for (var i = 0; i < headers.length; i++) {
08663         var header = headers[i];
08664         if (header.srvid === srvid) {
08665           // future work: this method will duplicate some work to re-locate
08666           // the header; we could try and avoid doing that.
08667           this.updateMessageHeader(
08668             header.date, header.id, partOfSync, headerOrMutationFunc);
08669           return;
08670         }
08671       }
08672     }.bind(this);
08673 
08674     if (this._headerBlocks.hasOwnProperty(blockId)) {
08675       findInBlock(this._headerBlocks[blockId]);
08676     }
08677     else {
08678       var blockInfo = this._findBlockInfoFromBlockId('header', blockId);
08679       this._loadBlock('header', blockInfo, findInBlock);
08680     }
08681   },
08682 
08686   unchangedMessageHeader: function ifs_unchangedMessageHeader(header) {
08687     if (this._pendingLoads.length) {
08688       this._deferredCalls.push(this.unchangedMessageHeader.bind(this, header));
08689       return;
08690     }
08691     // (no block update required)
08692     if (this._curSyncSlice && !this._curSyncSlice.ignoreHeaders)
08693       this._curSyncSlice.onHeaderAdded(header, true, false);
08694   },
08695 
08696   hasMessageWithServerId: function(srvid) {
08697     if (!this._serverIdHeaderBlockMapping)
08698       throw new Error('Server ID mapping not supported for this storage!');
08699 
08700     var blockId = this._serverIdHeaderBlockMapping[srvid];
08701     if (srvid === undefined) {
08702       this._LOG.serverIdMappingMissing(srvid);
08703       return false;
08704     }
08705 
08706     return !!blockId;
08707   },
08708 
08709   deleteMessageHeaderAndBody: function(suid, date, callback) {
08710     this.getMessageHeader(suid, date, function(header) {
08711       if (header)
08712         this.deleteMessageHeaderAndBodyUsingHeader(header, callback);
08713       else
08714         callback();
08715     }.bind(this));
08716   },
08717 
08718   deleteMessageHeaderAndBodyUsingHeader: function(header, callback) {
08719     if (this._pendingLoads.length) {
08720       this._deferredCalls.push(this.deleteMessageHeaderAndBodyUsingHeader.bind(
08721                                this, header, callback));
08722       return;
08723     }
08724 
08725     if (this._curSyncSlice && !this._curSyncSlice.ignoreHeaders)
08726       this._curSyncSlice.onHeaderRemoved(header);
08727     if (this._slices.length > (this._curSyncSlice ? 1 : 0)) {
08728       for (var iSlice = 0; iSlice < this._slices.length; iSlice++) {
08729         var slice = this._slices[iSlice];
08730         if (slice === this._curSyncSlice)
08731           continue;
08732         if (BEFORE(header.date, slice.startTS) ||
08733             STRICTLY_AFTER(header.date, slice.endTS))
08734           continue;
08735         if ((header.date === slice.startTS &&
08736              header.id < slice.startUID) ||
08737             (header.date === slice.endTS &&
08738              header.id > slice.endUID))
08739           continue;
08740         slice.onHeaderRemoved(header);
08741       }
08742     }
08743 
08744     if (this._serverIdHeaderBlockMapping && header.srvid)
08745       delete this._serverIdHeaderBlockMapping[header.srvid];
08746 
08747     var callbacks = allbackMaker(['header', 'body'], callback);
08748     this._deleteFromBlock('header', header.date, header.id, callbacks.header);
08749     this._deleteFromBlock('body', header.date, header.id, callbacks.body);
08750   },
08751 
08758   deleteMessageByServerId: function(srvid) {
08759     if (!this._serverIdHeaderBlockMapping)
08760       throw new Error('Server ID mapping not supported for this storage!');
08761 
08762     if (this._pendingLoads.length) {
08763       this._deferredCalls.push(this.deleteMessageByServerId.bind(this, srvid));
08764       return;
08765     }
08766 
08767     var blockId = this._serverIdHeaderBlockMapping[srvid];
08768     if (srvid === undefined) {
08769       this._LOG.serverIdMappingMissing(srvid);
08770       return;
08771     }
08772 
08773     var findInBlock = function findInBlock(headerBlock) {
08774       var headers = headerBlock.headers;
08775       for (var i = 0; i < headers.length; i++) {
08776         var header = headers[i];
08777         if (header.srvid === srvid) {
08778           this.deleteMessageHeaderAndBodyUsingHeader(header);
08779           return;
08780         }
08781       }
08782     }.bind(this);
08783 
08784     if (this._headerBlocks.hasOwnProperty(blockId)) {
08785       findInBlock(this._headerBlocks[blockId]);
08786     }
08787     else {
08788       var blockInfo = this._findBlockInfoFromBlockId('header', blockId);
08789       this._loadBlock('header', blockInfo, findInBlock);
08790     }
08791   },
08792 
08797   addMessageBody: function ifs_addMessageBody(header, bodyInfo, callback) {
08798     if (this._pendingLoads.length) {
08799       this._deferredCalls.push(this.addMessageBody.bind(
08800                                  this, header, bodyInfo, callback));
08801       return;
08802     }
08803     this._LOG.addMessageBody(header.date, header.id, header.srvid);
08804 
08805     // crappy size estimates where we assume the world is ASCII and so a UTF-8
08806     // encoding will take exactly 1 byte per character.
08807     var sizeEst = OBJ_OVERHEAD_EST + NUM_ATTR_OVERHEAD_EST +
08808                     4 * NULL_ATTR_OVERHEAD_EST;
08809     function sizifyAddrs(addrs) {
08810       sizeEst += LIST_ATTR_OVERHEAD_EST;
08811       if (!addrs)
08812         return;
08813       for (var i = 0; i < addrs.length; i++) {
08814         var addrPair = addrs[i];
08815         sizeEst += OBJ_OVERHEAD_EST + 2 * STR_ATTR_OVERHEAD_EST +
08816                      (addrPair.name ? addrPair.name.length : 0) +
08817                      (addrPair.address ? addrPair.address.length : 0);
08818       }
08819     }
08820     function sizifyAttachments(atts) {
08821       sizeEst += LIST_ATTR_OVERHEAD_EST;
08822       if (!atts)
08823         return;
08824       for (var i = 0; i < atts.length; i++) {
08825         var att = atts[i];
08826         sizeEst += OBJ_OVERHEAD_EST + 2 * STR_ATTR_OVERHEAD_EST +
08827                      att.name.length + att.type.length +
08828                      NUM_ATTR_OVERHEAD_EST;
08829       }
08830     }
08831     function sizifyStr(str) {
08832       sizeEst += STR_ATTR_OVERHEAD_EST + str.length;
08833     }
08834     function sizifyStringList(strings) {
08835       sizeEst += LIST_OVERHEAD_EST;
08836       if (!strings)
08837         return;
08838       for (var i = 0; i < strings.length; i++) {
08839         sizeEst += STR_ATTR_OVERHEAD_EST + strings[i].length;
08840       }
08841     }
08842     function sizifyBodyRep(rep) {
08843       sizeEst += LIST_OVERHEAD_EST +
08844                    NUM_OVERHEAD_EST * (rep.length / 2) +
08845                    STR_OVERHEAD_EST * (rep.length / 2);
08846       for (var i = 1; i < rep.length; i += 2) {
08847         if (rep[i])
08848           sizeEst += rep[i].length;
08849       }
08850     };
08851     function sizifyBodyReps(reps) {
08852       if (!reps)
08853         return;
08854 
08855 
08856       sizeEst += STR_OVERHEAD_EST * (reps.length / 2);
08857       for (var i = 0; i < reps.length; i++) {
08858         var rep = reps[i];
08859         if (rep.type === 'html') {
08860           sizeEst += STR_OVERHEAD_EST + rep.amountDownloaded;
08861         } else {
08862           rep.content && sizifyBodyRep(rep.content);
08863         }
08864       }
08865     };
08866 
08867     if (bodyInfo.to)
08868       sizifyAddrs(bodyInfo.to);
08869     if (bodyInfo.cc)
08870       sizifyAddrs(bodyInfo.cc);
08871     if (bodyInfo.bcc)
08872       sizifyAddrs(bodyInfo.bcc);
08873     if (bodyInfo.replyTo)
08874       sizifyStr(bodyInfo.replyTo);
08875 
08876 
08877     sizifyAttachments(bodyInfo.attachments);
08878     sizifyAttachments(bodyInfo.relatedParts);
08879     sizifyStringList(bodyInfo.references);
08880     sizifyBodyReps(bodyInfo.bodyReps);
08881 
08882     bodyInfo.size = sizeEst;
08883 
08884     this._insertIntoBlockUsingDateAndUID(
08885       'body', header.date, header.id, header.srvid, bodyInfo.size, bodyInfo,
08886       callback);
08887   },
08888 
08896   messageBodyRepsDownloaded: function(bodyInfo) {
08897     // no reps its as close to downloaded as its going to get.
08898     if (!bodyInfo.bodyReps || !bodyInfo.bodyReps.length)
08899       return true;
08900 
08901     return bodyInfo.bodyReps.every(function(rep) {
08902       return rep.isDownloaded;
08903     });
08904   },
08905 
08910   getMessageBodyWithReps: function(suid, date, callback) {
08911     var self = this;
08912     // try to get the body without any magic
08913     this.getMessageBody(suid, date, function(bodyInfo) {
08914       if (!bodyInfo) {
08915         return callback(bodyInfo);
08916       }
08917 
08918       if (self.messageBodyRepsDownloaded(bodyInfo)) {
08919         return callback(bodyInfo);
08920       }
08921 
08922       // queue a job and return bodyInfo after it completes..
08923       self._account.universe.downloadMessageBodyReps(suid, date,
08924                                                      function(err, bodyInfo) {
08925 
08926         // the err (if any) will be logged by the job.
08927         callback(bodyInfo);
08928       });
08929     });
08930   },
08931 
08932   getMessageBody: function ifs_getMessageBody(suid, date, callback) {
08933     var id = parseInt(suid.substring(suid.lastIndexOf('/') + 1)),
08934         posInfo = this._findRangeObjIndexForDateAndID(this._bodyBlockInfos,
08935                                                       date, id);
08936     if (posInfo[1] === null) {
08937       this._LOG.bodyNotFound();
08938       try {
08939         callback(null);
08940       }
08941       catch (ex) {
08942         this._LOG.callbackErr(ex);
08943       }
08944       return;
08945     }
08946     var bodyBlockInfo = posInfo[1], self = this;
08947     if (!(this._bodyBlocks.hasOwnProperty(bodyBlockInfo.blockId))) {
08948       this._loadBlock('body', bodyBlockInfo, function(bodyBlock) {
08949           var bodyInfo = bodyBlock.bodies[id] || null;
08950           if (!bodyInfo)
08951             self._LOG.bodyNotFound();
08952           try {
08953             callback(bodyInfo);
08954           }
08955           catch (ex) {
08956             self._LOG.callbackErr(ex);
08957           }
08958         });
08959       return;
08960     }
08961     var block = this._bodyBlocks[bodyBlockInfo.blockId],
08962         bodyInfo = block.bodies[id] || null;
08963     if (!bodyInfo)
08964       this._LOG.bodyNotFound();
08965     try {
08966       callback(bodyInfo);
08967     }
08968     catch (ex) {
08969       this._LOG.callbackErr(ex);
08970     }
08971   },
08972 
08999   updateMessageBody: function(header, bodyInfo, eventDetails, callback) {
09000     if (typeof(eventDetails) === 'function') {
09001       callback = eventDetails;
09002       eventDetails = null;
09003     }
09004 
09005     // (While this method can complete synchronously, we want to maintain its
09006     // perceived ordering relative to those that cannot be.)
09007     if (this._pendingLoads.length) {
09008       this._deferredCalls.push(this.updateMessageBody.bind(
09009                                  this, header, bodyInfo,
09010                                  eventDetails, callback));
09011       return;
09012     }
09013 
09014     var suid = header.suid;
09015     var id = parseInt(suid.substring(suid.lastIndexOf('/') + 1));
09016     var self = this;
09017 
09018     function bodyUpdated() {
09019       if (eventDetails && self._account.universe) {
09020         self._account.universe.__notifyModifiedBody(
09021           suid, eventDetails, bodyInfo
09022         );
09023       }
09024 
09025       if (callback) {
09026         callback();
09027       }
09028     }
09029 
09030     this._deleteFromBlock('body', header.date, id, function() {
09031       self.addMessageBody(header, bodyInfo, bodyUpdated);
09032     });
09033   },
09034 
09035   shutdown: function() {
09036     // reverse iterate since they will remove themselves as we kill them
09037     for (var i = this._slices.length - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
09038       this._slices[i].die();
09039     }
09040     this.folderSyncer.shutdown();
09041     this._LOG.__die();
09042   },
09043 
09050   youAreDeadCleanupAfterYourself: function() {
09051     // XXX close connections, etc.
09052   },
09053 };
09054 
09055 var LOGFAB = exports.LOGFAB = $log.register($module, {
09056   MailSlice: {
09057     type: $log.QUERY,
09058     events: {
09059       headersAppended: {},
09060       headerAdded: { index: false },
09061       headerModified: { index: false },
09062       headerRemoved: { index: false },
09063     },
09064     TEST_ONLY_events: {
09065       headersAppended: { headers: false },
09066       headerAdded: { header: false },
09067       headerModified: { header: false },
09068       headerRemoved: { header: false },
09069     },
09070   },
09071   FolderStorage: {
09072     type: $log.DATABASE,
09073     events: {
09074       addMessageHeader: { date: false, id: false, srvid: false },
09075       addMessageBody: { date: false, id: false, srvid: false },
09076 
09077       updateMessageHeader: { date: false, id: false, srvid: false },
09078       updateMessageBody: { date: false, id: false },
09079 
09080       // For now, logging date and uid is useful because the general logging
09081       // level will show us if we are trying to redundantly delete things.
09082       // Also, date and uid are opaque identifiers with very little entropy
09083       // on their own.  (The danger is in correlation with known messages,
09084       // but that is likely to be useful in the debugging situations where logs
09085       // will be sufaced.)
09086       deleteFromBlock: { type: false, date: false, id: false },
09087 
09088       // This was an error but the test results viewer UI is not quite smart
09089       // enough to understand the difference between expected errors and
09090       // unexpected errors, so this is getting downgraded for now.
09091       headerNotFound: {},
09092       bodyNotFound: {},
09093 
09094       syncedToDawnOfTime: {},
09095     },
09096     TEST_ONLY_events: {
09097     },
09098     asyncJobs: {
09099       loadBlock: { type: false, blockId: false },
09100       mutexedCall: { name: true },
09101     },
09102     TEST_ONLY_asyncJobs: {
09103       loadBlock: { block: false },
09104     },
09105     errors: {
09106       callbackErr: { ex: $log.EXCEPTION },
09107 
09108       badBlockLoad: { type: false, blockId: false },
09109 
09110       // Exposing date/uid at a general level is deemed okay because they are
09111       // opaque identifiers and the most likely failure models involve the
09112       // values being ridiculous (and therefore not legal).
09113       badIterationStart: { date: false, id: false },
09114       badDeletionRequest: { type: false, date: false, id: false },
09115       bodyBlockMissing: { id: false, idx: false, dict: false },
09116       serverIdMappingMissing: { srvid: false },
09117 
09118       accuracyRangeSuspect: { arange: false },
09119 
09120       mutexedOpErr: { err: $log.EXCEPTION },
09121 
09122       tooManyCallbacks: { name: false },
09123       mutexInvariantFail: { fireName: false, curName: false },
09124     }
09125   },
09126 }); // end LOGFAB
09127 
09128 }); // end define
09129 ;
09210 define('mailapi/searchfilter',
09211   [
09212     'rdcommon/log',
09213     './syncbase',
09214     './date',
09215     'module',
09216     'exports'
09217   ],
09218   function(
09219     $log,
09220     $syncbase,
09221     $date,
09222     $module,
09223     exports
09224   ) {
09225 
09232 function matchRegexpOrString(phrase, input, fromIndex) {
09233   if (!input) {
09234     return null;
09235   }
09236 
09237   if (phrase instanceof RegExp) {
09238     return phrase.exec(fromIndex ? input.slice(fromIndex) : input);
09239   }
09240 
09241   var idx = input.indexOf(phrase, fromIndex);
09242   if (idx == -1) {
09243     return null;
09244   }
09245 
09246   var ret = [ phrase ];
09247   ret.index = idx - fromIndex;
09248   return ret;
09249 }
09250 
09258 function AuthorFilter(phrase) {
09259   this.phrase = phrase;
09260 }
09261 exports.AuthorFilter = AuthorFilter;
09262 AuthorFilter.prototype = {
09263   needsBody: false,
09264 
09265   testMessage: function(header, body, match) {
09266     var author = header.author, phrase = this.phrase, ret;
09267     if ((ret = matchRegexpOrString(phrase, author.name, 0))) {
09268       match.author = {
09269         text: author.name,
09270         offset: 0,
09271         matchRuns: [{ start: ret.index, length: ret[0].length }],
09272         path: null,
09273       };
09274       return true;
09275     }
09276     if ((ret = matchRegexpOrString(phrase, author.address, 0))) {
09277       match.author = {
09278         text: author.address,
09279         offset: 0,
09280         matchRuns: [{ start: ret.index, length: ret[0].length }],
09281         path: null,
09282       };
09283       return true;
09284     }
09285     match.author = null;
09286     return false;
09287   },
09288 };
09289 
09301 function RecipientFilter(phrase, stopAfterNMatches,
09302                          checkTo, checkCc, checkBcc) {
09303   this.phrase = phrase;
09304   this.stopAfter = stopAfterNMatches;
09305   this.checkTo = checkTo;
09306   this.checkCc = checkCc;
09307   this.checkBcc = checkBcc;
09308 }
09309 exports.RecipientFilter = RecipientFilter;
09310 RecipientFilter.prototype = {
09311   needsBody: true,
09312 
09313   testMessage: function(header, body, match) {
09314     var phrase = this.phrase, stopAfter = this.stopAfter;
09315     var matches = [];
09316     function checkRecipList(list) {
09317       var ret;
09318       for (var i = 0; i < list.length; i++) {
09319         var recip = list[i];
09320         if ((ret = matchRegexpOrString(phrase, recip.name, 0))) {
09321           matches.push({
09322             text: recip.name,
09323             offset: 0,
09324             matchRuns: [{ start: ret.index, length: ret[0].length }],
09325             path: null,
09326           });
09327           if (matches.length < stopAfter)
09328             continue;
09329           return;
09330         }
09331         if ((ret = matchRegexpOrString(phrase, recip.address, 0))) {
09332           matches.push({
09333             text: recip.address,
09334             offset: 0,
09335             matchRuns: [{ start: ret.index, length: ret[0].length }],
09336             path: null,
09337           });
09338           if (matches.length >= stopAfter)
09339             return;
09340         }
09341       }
09342     }
09343 
09344     if (this.checkTo && header.to)
09345       checkRecipList(header.to);
09346     if (this.checkCc && header.cc && matches.length < stopAfter)
09347       checkRecipList(header.cc);
09348     if (this.checkBcc && header.bcc && matches.length < stopAfter)
09349       checkRecipList(header.bcc);
09350 
09351     if (matches.length) {
09352       match.recipients = matches;
09353       return true;
09354     }
09355     else {
09356       match.recipients = null;
09357       return false;
09358     }
09359   },
09360 
09361 };
09362 
09378 function snippetMatchHelper(str, start, length, contextBefore, contextAfter,
09379                             path) {
09380   if (contextBefore > start)
09381     contextBefore = start;
09382   var offset = str.indexOf(' ', start - contextBefore);
09383   if (offset === -1)
09384     offset = 0;
09385   if (offset >= start)
09386     offset = start - contextBefore;
09387   var endIdx = str.lastIndexOf(' ', start + length + contextAfter);
09388   if (endIdx <= start + length)
09389     endIdx = start + length + contextAfter;
09390   var snippet = str.substring(offset, endIdx);
09391 
09392   return {
09393     text: snippet,
09394     offset: offset,
09395     matchRuns: [{ start: start - offset, length: length }],
09396     path: path
09397   };
09398 }
09399 
09409 function SubjectFilter(phrase, stopAfterNMatches, contextBefore, contextAfter) {
09410   this.phrase = phrase;
09411   this.stopAfter = stopAfterNMatches;
09412   this.contextBefore = contextBefore;
09413   this.contextAfter = contextAfter;
09414 }
09415 exports.SubjectFilter = SubjectFilter;
09416 SubjectFilter.prototype = {
09417   needsBody: false,
09418   testMessage: function(header, body, match) {
09419     var subject = header.subject;
09420     // Empty subjects can't match *anything*; no empty regexes allowed, etc.
09421     if (!subject)
09422       return false;
09423     var phrase = this.phrase,
09424         slen = subject.length,
09425         stopAfter = this.stopAfter,
09426         contextBefore = this.contextBefore, contextAfter = this.contextAfter,
09427         matches = [],
09428         idx = 0;
09429 
09430     while (idx < slen && matches.length < stopAfter) {
09431       var ret = matchRegexpOrString(phrase, subject, idx);
09432       if (!ret)
09433         break;
09434 
09435       matches.push(snippetMatchHelper(subject, idx + ret.index, ret[0].length,
09436                                       contextBefore, contextAfter, null));
09437       idx += ret.index + ret[0].length;
09438     }
09439 
09440     if (matches.length) {
09441       match.subject = matches;
09442       return true;
09443     }
09444     else {
09445       match.subject = null;
09446       return false;
09447     }
09448   },
09449 };
09450 
09451 // stable value from quotechew.js; full export regime not currently required.
09452 var CT_AUTHORED_CONTENT = 0x1;
09453 // HTML DOM constants
09454 var ELEMENT_NODE = 1, TEXT_NODE = 3;
09455 
09465 function BodyFilter(phrase, matchQuotes, stopAfterNMatches,
09466                     contextBefore, contextAfter) {
09467   this.phrase = phrase;
09468   this.stopAfter = stopAfterNMatches;
09469   this.contextBefore = contextBefore;
09470   this.contextAfter = contextAfter;
09471   this.matchQuotes = matchQuotes;
09472 }
09473 exports.BodyFilter = BodyFilter;
09474 BodyFilter.prototype = {
09475   needsBody: true,
09476   testMessage: function(header, body, match) {
09477     var phrase = this.phrase,
09478         stopAfter = this.stopAfter,
09479         contextBefore = this.contextBefore, contextAfter = this.contextAfter,
09480         matches = [],
09481         matchQuotes = this.matchQuotes,
09482         idx;
09483 
09484     for (var iBodyRep = 0; iBodyRep < body.bodyReps.length; iBodyRep++) {
09485       var bodyType = body.bodyReps[iBodyRep].type,
09486           bodyRep = body.bodyReps[iBodyRep].content;
09487 
09488       if (bodyType === 'plain') {
09489         for (var iRep = 0; iRep < bodyRep.length && matches.length < stopAfter;
09490              iRep += 2) {
09491           var etype = bodyRep[iRep]&0xf, block = bodyRep[iRep + 1],
09492               repPath = null;
09493 
09494           // Ignore blocks that are not message-author authored unless we are
09495           // told to match quotes.
09496           if (!matchQuotes && etype !== CT_AUTHORED_CONTENT)
09497             continue;
09498 
09499           for (idx = 0; idx < block.length && matches.length < stopAfter;) {
09500             var ret = matchRegexpOrString(phrase, block, idx);
09501             if (!ret)
09502               break;
09503             if (repPath === null)
09504               repPath = [iBodyRep, iRep];
09505             matches.push(snippetMatchHelper(block, ret.index, ret[0].length,
09506                                             contextBefore, contextAfter,
09507                                             repPath));
09508             idx += ret.index + ret[0].length;
09509           }
09510         }
09511       }
09512       else if (bodyType === 'html') {
09513         // NB: this code is derived from htmlchew.js' generateSnippet
09514         // functionality.
09515 
09516         // - convert the HMTL into a DOM tree
09517         // We don't want our indexOf to run afoul of presentation logic.
09518         var htmlPath = [iBodyRep, 0];
09519         var htmlDoc = document.implementation.createHTMLDocument(''),
09520             rootNode = htmlDoc.createElement('div');
09521         rootNode.innerHTML = bodyRep;
09522 
09523         var node = rootNode.firstChild, done = false;
09524         while (!done) {
09525           if (node.nodeType === ELEMENT_NODE) {
09526             switch (node.tagName.toLowerCase()) {
09527               // - Things that can't contain useful text.
09528               // The style does not belong in the snippet!
09529               case 'style':
09530                 break;
09531 
09532               case 'blockquote':
09533                 // fall-through if matchQuotes
09534                 if (!matchQuotes)
09535                   break;
09536               default:
09537                 if (node.firstChild) {
09538                   node = node.firstChild;
09539                   htmlPath.push(0);
09540                   continue;
09541                 }
09542                 break;
09543             }
09544           }
09545           else if (node.nodeType === TEXT_NODE) {
09546             // XXX the snippet generator normalizes whitespace here to avoid
09547             // being overwhelmed by ridiculous whitespace.  This is not quite
09548             // as much a problem for us, but it would be useful if the
09549             // sanitizer layer normalized whitespace so neither of us has to
09550             // worry about it.
09551             var nodeText = node.data;
09552 
09553             var ret = matchRegexpOrString(phrase, nodeText, 0);
09554             if (ret) {
09555               matches.push(
09556                 snippetMatchHelper(nodeText, ret.index, ret[0].length,
09557                                    contextBefore, contextAfter,
09558                                    htmlPath.concat()));
09559               if (matches.length >= stopAfter)
09560                 break;
09561             }
09562           }
09563 
09564           while (!node.nextSibling) {
09565             node = node.parentNode;
09566             htmlPath.pop();
09567             if (node === rootNode) {
09568               done = true;
09569               break;
09570             }
09571           }
09572           if (!done) {
09573             node = node.nextSibling;
09574             htmlPath[htmlPath.length - 1]++;
09575           }
09576         }
09577       }
09578     }
09579 
09580     if (matches.length) {
09581       match.body = matches;
09582       return true;
09583     }
09584     else {
09585       match.body = null;
09586       return false;
09587     }
09588   },
09589 };
09590 
09595 function MessageFilterer(filters) {
09596   this.filters = filters;
09597   this.bodiesNeeded = false;
09598 
09599   for (var i = 0; i < filters.length; i++) {
09600     var filter = filters[i];
09601     if (filter.needsBody)
09602       this.bodiesNeeded = true;
09603   }
09604 }
09605 exports.MessageFilterer = MessageFilterer;
09606 MessageFilterer.prototype = {
09612   testMessage: function(header, body) {
09613     //console.log('sf: testMessage(', header.suid, header.author.address,
09614     //            header.subject, 'body?', !!body, ')');
09615     var matched = false, matchObj = {};
09616     var filters = this.filters;
09617     try {
09618       for (var i = 0; i < filters.length; i++) {
09619         var filter = filters[i];
09620         if (filter.testMessage(header, body, matchObj))
09621           matched = true;
09622       }
09623     }
09624     catch (ex) {
09625       console.error('filter exception', ex, '\n', ex.stack);
09626     }
09627     //console.log('   =>', matched, JSON.stringify(matchObj));
09628     if (matched)
09629       return matchObj;
09630     else
09631       return false;
09632   },
09633 };
09634 
09635 var CONTEXT_CHARS_BEFORE = 16;
09636 var CONTEXT_CHARS_AFTER = 40;
09637 
09641 function SearchSlice(bridgeHandle, storage, phrase, whatToSearch, _parentLog) {
09642 console.log('sf: creating SearchSlice:', phrase);
09643   this._bridgeHandle = bridgeHandle;
09644   bridgeHandle.__listener = this;
09645   // this mechanism never allows triggering synchronization.
09646   bridgeHandle.userCanGrowDownwards = false;
09647 
09648   this._storage = storage;
09649   this._LOG = LOGFAB.SearchSlice(this, _parentLog, bridgeHandle._handle);
09650 
09651   // These correspond to the range of headers that we have searched to generate
09652   // the current set of matched headers.  Our matches will always be fully
09653   // contained by this range.
09654   this.startTS = null;
09655   this.startUID = null;
09656   this.endTS = null;
09657   this.endUID = null;
09658 
09659   if (!(phrase instanceof RegExp)) {
09660     phrase = new RegExp(phrase.replace(/[\-\[\]\/\{\}\(\)\*\+\?\.\\\^\$\|]/g,
09661                                        '\\$&'),
09662                         'i');
09663   }
09664 
09665   var filters = [];
09666   if (whatToSearch.author)
09667     filters.push(new AuthorFilter(phrase));
09668   if (whatToSearch.recipients)
09669     filters.push(new RecipientFilter(phrase, 1, true, true, true));
09670   if (whatToSearch.subject)
09671     filters.push(new SubjectFilter(
09672                    phrase, 1, CONTEXT_CHARS_BEFORE, CONTEXT_CHARS_AFTER));
09673   if (whatToSearch.body)
09674     filters.push(new BodyFilter(
09675                    phrase, whatToSearch.body === 'yes-quotes',
09676                    1, CONTEXT_CHARS_BEFORE, CONTEXT_CHARS_AFTER));
09677 
09678   this.filterer = new MessageFilterer(filters);
09679 
09680   this._bound_gotOlderMessages = this._gotMessages.bind(this, 1);
09681   this._bound_gotNewerMessages = this._gotMessages.bind(this, -1);
09682 
09683   this.headers = [];
09684   this.desiredHeaders = $syncbase.INITIAL_FILL_SIZE;
09685   // Fetch as many headers as we want in our results; we probably will have
09686   // less than a 100% hit-rate, but there isn't much savings from getting the
09687   // extra headers now, so punt on those.
09688   this._storage.getMessagesInImapDateRange(
09689     0, null, this.desiredHeaders, this.desiredHeaders,
09690     this._gotMessages.bind(this, 1));
09691 }
09692 exports.SearchSlice = SearchSlice;
09693 SearchSlice.prototype = {
09694   set atTop(val) {
09695     this._bridgeHandle.atTop = val;
09696   },
09697   set atBottom(val) {
09698     this._bridgeHandle.atBottom = val;
09699   },
09700 
09701   _gotMessages: function(dir, headers, moreMessagesComing) {
09702 console.log('sf: gotMessages', headers.length);
09703     // update the range of what we have seen and searched
09704     if (headers.length) {
09705       if (dir === -1) { // (more recent)
09706         this.endTS = headers[0].date;
09707         this.endUID = headers[0].id;
09708       }
09709       else { // (older)
09710         var lastHeader = headers[headers.length - 1];
09711         this.startTS = lastHeader.date;
09712         this.startUID = lastHeader.id;
09713         if (this.endTS === null) {
09714           this.endTS = headers[0].date;
09715           this.endUID = headers[0].id;
09716         }
09717       }
09718     }
09719 
09720     var checkHandle = function checkHandle(headers, bodies) {
09721       // run a filter on these
09722       var matchPairs = [];
09723       for (i = 0; i < headers.length; i++) {
09724         var header = headers[i],
09725             body = bodies ? bodies[i] : null;
09726         var matchObj = this.filterer.testMessage(header, body);
09727         if (matchObj)
09728           matchPairs.push({ header: header, matches: matchObj });
09729       }
09730 
09731       var atTop = this.atTop = this._storage.headerIsYoungestKnown(
09732                     this.endTS, this.endUID);
09733       var atBottom = this.atBottom = this._storage.headerIsOldestKnown(
09734                        this.startTS, this.startUID);
09735       var canGetMore = (dir === -1) ? !atTop : !atBottom;
09736       if (matchPairs.length) {
09737         var willHave = this.headers.length + matchPairs.length,
09738             wantMore = !moreMessagesComing &&
09739                        (willHave < this.desiredHeaders) &&
09740                        canGetMore;
09741 console.log('sf: willHave', willHave, 'of', this.desiredHeaders, 'want more?', wantMore);
09742         var insertAt = dir === -1 ? 0 : this.headers.length;
09743         this._bridgeHandle.sendSplice(
09744           insertAt, 0, matchPairs, true,
09745           moreMessagesComing || wantMore);
09746         this.headers.splice.apply(this.headers,
09747                                   [insertAt, 0].concat(matchPairs));
09748         if (wantMore)
09749           this.reqGrow(dir, false);
09750       }
09751       else if (!moreMessagesComing) {
09752         // If there aren't more messages coming, we either need to get more
09753         // messages (if there are any left in the folder that we haven't seen)
09754         // or signal completion.  We can use our growth function directly since
09755         // there are no state invariants that will get confused.
09756         if (canGetMore)
09757           this.reqGrow(dir, false);
09758         else
09759           this._bridgeHandle.sendStatus('synced', true, false);
09760       }
09761       // (otherwise we need to wait for the additional messages to show before
09762       //  doing anything conclusive)
09763     }.bind(this);
09764 
09765     if (this.filterer.bodiesNeeded) {
09766       // To batch our updates to the UI, just get all the bodies then advance
09767       // to the next stage of processing.  It would be nice
09768       var bodies = [];
09769       var gotBody = function(body) {
09770         if (!body)
09771           console.log('failed to get a body for: ',
09772                       headers[bodies.length].suid,
09773                       headers[bodies.length].subject);
09774         bodies.push(body);
09775         if (bodies.length === headers.length)
09776           checkHandle(headers, bodies);
09777       };
09778       for (var i = 0; i < headers.length; i++) {
09779         var header = headers[i];
09780         this._storage.getMessageBody(header.suid, header.date, gotBody);
09781       }
09782     }
09783     else {
09784       checkHandle(headers, null);
09785     }
09786   },
09787 
09788   refresh: function() {
09789     // no one should actually call this.
09790   },
09791 
09792   reqNoteRanges: function(firstIndex, firstSuid, lastIndex, lastSuid) {
09793     // when shrinking our range, we could try and be clever and use the values
09794     // of the first thing we are updating to adjust our range, but it's safest/
09795     // easiest right now to just use what we are left with.
09796 
09797     // THIS CODE IS COPIED FROM `MailSlice`'s reqNoteRanges implementation
09798 
09799     var i;
09800     // - Fixup indices if required
09801     if (firstIndex >= this.headers.length ||
09802         this.headers[firstIndex].suid !== firstSuid) {
09803       firstIndex = 0; // default to not splicing if it's gone
09804       for (i = 0; i < this.headers.length; i++) {
09805         if (this.headers[i].suid === firstSuid) {
09806           firstIndex = i;
09807           break;
09808         }
09809       }
09810     }
09811     if (lastIndex >= this.headers.length ||
09812         this.headers[lastIndex].suid !== lastSuid) {
09813       for (i = this.headers.length - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
09814         if (this.headers[i].suid === lastSuid) {
09815           lastIndex = i;
09816           break;
09817         }
09818       }
09819     }
09820 
09821     // - Perform splices as required
09822     // (high before low to avoid index changes)
09823     if (lastIndex + 1 < this.headers.length) {
09824       this.atBottom = false;
09825       this.userCanGrowDownwards = false;
09826       var delCount = this.headers.length - lastIndex  - 1;
09827       this.desiredHeaders -= delCount;
09828       if (!this._accumulating)
09829         this._bridgeHandle.sendSplice(
09830           lastIndex + 1, delCount, [],
09831           // This is expected; more coming if there's a low-end splice
09832           true, firstIndex > 0);
09833       this.headers.splice(lastIndex + 1, this.headers.length - lastIndex - 1);
09834       var lastHeader = this.headers[lastIndex];
09835       this.startTS = lastHeader.date;
09836       this.startUID = lastHeader.id;
09837     }
09838     if (firstIndex > 0) {
09839       this.atTop = false;
09840       this.desiredHeaders -= firstIndex;
09841       if (!this._accumulating)
09842         this._bridgeHandle.sendSplice(0, firstIndex, [], true, false);
09843       this.headers.splice(0, firstIndex);
09844       var firstHeader = this.headers[0];
09845       this.endTS = firstHeader.date;
09846       this.endUID = firstHeader.id;
09847     }
09848   },
09849 
09850   reqGrow: function(dirMagnitude, userRequestsGrowth) {
09851     if (dirMagnitude === -1) {
09852       this._storage.getMessagesAfterMessage(this.endTS, this.endUID,
09853                                             $syncbase.INITIAL_FILL_SIZE,
09854                                             this._gotMessages.bind(this, -1));
09855     }
09856     else if (dirMagnitude === 1) {
09857       this._storage.getMessagesBeforeMessage(this.startTS, this.startUID,
09858                                              $syncbase.INITIAL_FILL_SIZE,
09859                                              this._gotMessages.bind(this, 1));
09860     }
09861   },
09862 
09863   die: function() {
09864     this._bridgeHandle = null;
09865     this._LOG.__die();
09866   },
09867 };
09868 
09869 var LOGFAB = exports.LOGFAB = $log.register($module, {
09870   SearchSlice: {
09871     type: $log.QUERY,
09872     events: {
09873     },
09874     TEST_ONLY_events: {
09875     },
09876   },
09877 }); // end LOGFAB
09878 
09879 
09880 }); // end define
09881 ;
09882 define('mailapi/worker-router',[],function() {
09883 
09884 var listeners = {};
09885 
09886 function receiveMessage(evt) {
09887   var data = evt.data;
09888 //dump('\x1b[37mw <= M: recv: '+data.type+' '+data.uid+' '+data.cmd +'\x1b[0m\n');
09889   var listener = listeners[data.type];
09890   if (listener)
09891     listener(data);
09892 }
09893 
09894 window.addEventListener('message', receiveMessage);
09895 
09896 
09897 function unregister(type) {
09898   delete listeners[type];
09899 }
09900 
09901 function registerSimple(type, callback) {
09902   listeners[type] = callback;
09903 
09904   return function sendSimpleMessage(cmd, args) {
09905     //dump('\x1b[34mw => M: send: ' + type + ' null ' + cmd + '\x1b[0m\n');
09906     window.postMessage({ type: type, uid: null, cmd: cmd, args: args });
09907   };
09908 }
09909 
09910 var callbackSenders = {};
09911 
09917 function registerCallbackType(type) {
09918   if (callbackSenders.hasOwnProperty(type))
09919     return callbackSenders[type];
09920   listeners[type] = function receiveCallbackMessage(data) {
09921     var callback = callbacks[data.uid];
09922     if (!callback)
09923       return;
09924     delete callbacks[data.uid];
09925 
09926     callback.apply(callback, data.args);
09927   };
09928   var callbacks = {};
09929   var uid = 0;
09930 
09931   var sender = function sendCallbackMessage(cmd, args, callback) {
09932     if (callback) {
09933       callbacks[uid] = callback;
09934     }
09935 
09936     //dump('\x1b[34mw => M: send: ' + type + ' ' + uid + ' ' + cmd + '\x1b[0m\n');
09937     window.postMessage({ type: type, uid: uid++, cmd: cmd, args: args });
09938   };
09939   callbackSenders[type] = sender;
09940   return sender;
09941 }
09942 
09947 function registerInstanceType(type) {
09948   var uid = 0;
09949   var instanceMap = {};
09950   listeners[type] = function receiveInstanceMessage(data) {
09951     var instanceListener = instanceMap[data.uid];
09952     if (!instanceListener)
09953       return;
09954 
09955     instanceListener(data);
09956   };
09957 
09958   return {
09959     register: function(instanceListener) {
09960       var thisUid = uid++;
09961       instanceMap[thisUid] = instanceListener;
09962 
09963       return {
09964         sendMessage: function sendInstanceMessage(cmd, args) {
09965 //dump('\x1b[34mw => M: send: ' + type + ' ' + thisUid + ' ' + cmd + '\x1b[0m\n');
09966           window.postMessage({ type: type, uid: thisUid,
09967                                cmd: cmd, args: args });
09968         },
09969         unregister: function unregisterInstance() {
09970           delete instanceMap[thisUid];
09971         }
09972       };
09973     },
09974   };
09975 }
09976 
09977 function shutdown() {
09978   window.removeEventListener('message', receiveMessage);
09979   listeners = {};
09980   callbackSenders = {};
09981 }
09982 
09983 return {
09984   registerSimple: registerSimple,
09985   registerCallbackType: registerCallbackType,
09986   registerInstanceType: registerInstanceType,
09987   unregister: unregister,
09988   shutdown: shutdown
09989 };
09990 
09991 }); // end define
09992 ;
09997 define('mailapi/jobmixins',
09998   [
09999     './worker-router',
10000     './util',
10001     'exports'
10002   ],
10003   function(
10004     $router,
10005     $util,
10006     exports
10007   ) {
10008 
10009 var sendMessage = $router.registerCallbackType('devicestorage');
10010 
10011 exports.local_do_modtags = function(op, doneCallback, undo) {
10012   var addTags = undo ? op.removeTags : op.addTags,
10013       removeTags = undo ? op.addTags : op.removeTags;
10014   this._partitionAndAccessFoldersSequentially(
10015     op.messages,
10016     false,
10017     function perFolder(ignoredConn, storage, headers, namers, callWhenDone) {
10018       var waitingOn = headers.length;
10019       function next() {
10020         if (--waitingOn === 0)
10021           callWhenDone();
10022       }
10023       for (var iHeader = 0; iHeader < headers.length; iHeader++) {
10024         var header = headers[iHeader];
10025         var iTag, tag, existing, modified = false;
10026         if (addTags) {
10027           for (iTag = 0; iTag < addTags.length; iTag++) {
10028             tag = addTags[iTag];
10029             // The list should be small enough that native stuff is better
10030             // than JS bsearch.
10031             existing = header.flags.indexOf(tag);
10032             if (existing !== -1)
10033               continue;
10034             header.flags.push(tag);
10035             header.flags.sort(); // (maintain sorted invariant)
10036             modified = true;
10037           }
10038         }
10039         if (removeTags) {
10040           for (iTag = 0; iTag < removeTags.length; iTag++) {
10041             tag = removeTags[iTag];
10042             existing = header.flags.indexOf(tag);
10043             if (existing === -1)
10044               continue;
10045             header.flags.splice(existing, 1);
10046             modified = true;
10047           }
10048         }
10049         storage.updateMessageHeader(header.date, header.id, false,
10050                                     header, next);
10051       }
10052     },
10053     function() {
10054       doneCallback(null, null, true);
10055     },
10056     null, // connection loss does not happen for local-only ops
10057     undo,
10058     'modtags');
10059 };
10060 
10061 exports.local_undo_modtags = function(op, callback) {
10062   // Undoing is just a question of flipping the add and remove lists.
10063   return this.local_do_modtags(op, callback, true);
10064 };
10065 
10066 
10067 exports.local_do_move = function(op, doneCallback, targetFolderId) {
10068   // create a scratch field to store the guid's for check purposes
10069   op.guids = {};
10070   var nukeServerIds = !this.resilientServerIds;
10071 
10072   var stateDelta = this._stateDelta, addWait = 0, self = this;
10073   if (!stateDelta.moveMap)
10074     stateDelta.moveMap = {};
10075   if (!stateDelta.serverIdMap)
10076     stateDelta.serverIdMap = {};
10077   if (!targetFolderId)
10078     targetFolderId = op.targetFolder;
10079 
10080   this._partitionAndAccessFoldersSequentially(
10081     op.messages, false,
10082     function perFolder(ignoredConn, sourceStorage, headers, namers,
10083                        perFolderDone) {
10084       // -- open the target folder for processing
10085       function targetOpened_nowProcess(ignoredConn, _targetStorage) {
10086         targetStorage = _targetStorage;
10087         processNext();
10088       }
10089       // -- get the body for the next header (or be done)
10090       function processNext() {
10091         if (iNextHeader >= headers.length) {
10092           perFolderDone();
10093           return;
10094         }
10095         header = headers[iNextHeader++];
10096         sourceStorage.getMessageBody(header.suid, header.date,
10097                                      gotBody_nowDelete);
10098       }
10099       // -- delete the header and body from the source
10100       function gotBody_nowDelete(_body) {
10101         body = _body;
10102 
10103         // We need an entry in the server id map if we are moving/deleting it.
10104         // We don't need this if we're moving a message to the folder it's
10105         // already in, but it doesn't hurt anything.
10106         if (header.srvid)
10107           stateDelta.serverIdMap[header.suid] = header.srvid;
10108 
10109         if (sourceStorage === targetStorage ||
10110             // localdraft messages aren't real, and so must not be moved and
10111             // are only eligible for nuke deletion.
10112             sourceStorage.folderMeta.type === 'localdrafts') {
10113           if (op.type === 'move') {
10114             // A move from a folder to itself is a no-op.
10115             processNext();
10116           }
10117           else { // op.type === 'delete'
10118             // If the op is a delete and the source and destination folders
10119             // match, we're deleting from trash, so just perma-delete it.
10120             sourceStorage.deleteMessageHeaderAndBodyUsingHeader(
10121               header, processNext);
10122           }
10123         }
10124         else {
10125           sourceStorage.deleteMessageHeaderAndBodyUsingHeader(
10126             header, deleted_nowAdd);
10127         }
10128       }
10129       // -- add the header/body to the target folder
10130       function deleted_nowAdd() {
10131         var sourceSuid = header.suid;
10132 
10133         // - update id fields
10134         header.id = targetStorage._issueNewHeaderId();
10135         header.suid = targetStorage.folderId + '/' + header.id;
10136         if (nukeServerIds)
10137           header.srvid = null;
10138 
10139         stateDelta.moveMap[sourceSuid] = header.suid;
10140 
10141         addWait = 2;
10142         targetStorage.addMessageHeader(header, added);
10143         targetStorage.addMessageBody(header, body, added);
10144       }
10145       function added() {
10146         if (--addWait !== 0)
10147           return;
10148         processNext();
10149       }
10150       var iNextHeader = 0, targetStorage = null, header = null, body = null,
10151           addWait = 0;
10152 
10153       // If the source folder and the target folder are the same, don't try
10154       // to access the target folder!
10155       if (sourceStorage.folderId === targetFolderId) {
10156         targetStorage = sourceStorage;
10157         processNext();
10158       }
10159       else {
10160         self._accessFolderForMutation(targetFolderId, false,
10161                                       targetOpened_nowProcess, null,
10162                                       'local move target');
10163       }
10164     },
10165     function() {
10166       doneCallback(null, null, true);
10167     },
10168     null, // connection loss does not happen for local-only ops
10169     false,
10170     'local move source');
10171 };
10172 
10173 // XXX implement!
10174 exports.local_undo_move = function(op, doneCallback, targetFolderId) {
10175   doneCallback(null);
10176 };
10177 
10178 exports.local_do_delete = function(op, doneCallback) {
10179   var trashFolder = this.account.getFirstFolderWithType('trash');
10180   if (!trashFolder) {
10181     this.account.ensureEssentialFolders();
10182     doneCallback('defer');
10183     return;
10184   }
10185   this.local_do_move(op, doneCallback, trashFolder.id);
10186 };
10187 
10188 exports.local_undo_delete = function(op, doneCallback) {
10189   var trashFolder = this.account.getFirstFolderWithType('trash');
10190   if (!trashFolder) {
10191     // the absence of the trash folder when it must have previously existed is
10192     // confusing.
10193     doneCallback('unknown');
10194     return;
10195   }
10196   this.local_undo_move(op, doneCallback, trashFolder.id);
10197 };
10198 
10199 exports.do_download = function(op, callback) {
10200   var self = this;
10201   var idxLastSlash = op.messageSuid.lastIndexOf('/'),
10202       folderId = op.messageSuid.substring(0, idxLastSlash);
10203 
10204   var folderConn, folderStorage;
10205   // Once we have the connection, get the current state of the body rep.
10206   var gotConn = function gotConn(_folderConn, _folderStorage) {
10207     folderConn = _folderConn;
10208     folderStorage = _folderStorage;
10209 
10210     folderStorage.getMessageHeader(op.messageSuid, op.messageDate, gotHeader);
10211   };
10212   var deadConn = function deadConn() {
10213     callback('aborted-retry');
10214   };
10215   // Now that we have the body, we can know the part numbers and eliminate /
10216   // filter out any redundant download requests.  Issue all the fetches at
10217   // once.
10218   var partsToDownload = [], storePartsTo = [], header, bodyInfo, uid;
10219   var gotHeader = function gotHeader(_headerInfo) {
10220     header = _headerInfo;
10221     uid = header.srvid;
10222     folderStorage.getMessageBody(op.messageSuid, op.messageDate, gotBody);
10223   };
10224   var gotBody = function gotBody(_bodyInfo) {
10225     bodyInfo = _bodyInfo;
10226     var i, partInfo;
10227     for (i = 0; i < op.relPartIndices.length; i++) {
10228       partInfo = bodyInfo.relatedParts[op.relPartIndices[i]];
10229       if (partInfo.file)
10230         continue;
10231       partsToDownload.push(partInfo);
10232       storePartsTo.push('idb');
10233     }
10234     for (i = 0; i < op.attachmentIndices.length; i++) {
10235       partInfo = bodyInfo.attachments[op.attachmentIndices[i]];
10236       if (partInfo.file)
10237         continue;
10238       partsToDownload.push(partInfo);
10239       // right now all attachments go in sdcard
10240       storePartsTo.push('sdcard');
10241     }
10242 
10243     folderConn.downloadMessageAttachments(uid, partsToDownload, gotParts);
10244   };
10245   var pendingStorageWrites = 0, downloadErr = null;
10250   function saveToStorage(blob, storage, filename, partInfo, isRetry) {
10251     pendingStorageWrites++;
10252 
10253     var callback = function(success, error, savedFilename) {
10254       if (success) {
10255         self._LOG.savedAttachment(storage, blob.type, blob.size);
10256         console.log('saved attachment to', storage, savedFilename, 'type:', blob.type);
10257         partInfo.file = [storage, savedFilename];
10258         if (--pendingStorageWrites === 0)
10259           done();
10260       } else {
10261         self._LOG.saveFailure(storage, blob.type, error, filename);
10262         console.warn('failed to save attachment to', storage, filename,
10263                      'type:', blob.type);
10264         pendingStorageWrites--;
10265         // if we failed to unique the file after appending junk, just give up
10266         if (isRetry) {
10267           if (pendingStorageWrites === 0)
10268             done();
10269           return;
10270         }
10271         // retry by appending a super huge timestamp to the file before its
10272         // extension.
10273         var idxLastPeriod = filename.lastIndexOf('.');
10274         if (idxLastPeriod === -1)
10275           idxLastPeriod = filename.length;
10276         filename = filename.substring(0, idxLastPeriod) + '-' + Date.now() +
10277                     filename.substring(idxLastPeriod);
10278         saveToStorage(blob, storage, filename, partInfo, true);
10279       }
10280     };
10281     sendMessage('save', [storage, blob, filename], callback);
10282   }
10283   var gotParts = function gotParts(err, bodyBlobs) {
10284     if (bodyBlobs.length !== partsToDownload.length) {
10285       callback(err, null, false);
10286       return;
10287     }
10288     downloadErr = err;
10289     for (var i = 0; i < partsToDownload.length; i++) {
10290       // Because we should be under a mutex, this part should still be the
10291       // live representation and we can mutate it.
10292       var partInfo = partsToDownload[i],
10293           blob = bodyBlobs[i],
10294           storeTo = storePartsTo[i];
10295 
10296       if (blob) {
10297         partInfo.sizeEstimate = blob.size;
10298         partInfo.type = blob.type;
10299         if (storeTo === 'idb')
10300           partInfo.file = blob;
10301         else
10302           saveToStorage(blob, storeTo, partInfo.name, partInfo);
10303       }
10304     }
10305     if (!pendingStorageWrites)
10306       done();
10307   };
10308 
10309   function done() {
10310     folderStorage.updateMessageBody(header, bodyInfo, function() {
10311       callback(downloadErr, bodyInfo, true);
10312     });
10313   };
10314 
10315   self._accessFolderForMutation(folderId, true, gotConn, deadConn,
10316                                 'download');
10317 };
10318 
10319 exports.local_do_download = function(op, callback) {
10320   // Downloads are inherently online operations.
10321   callback(null);
10322 };
10323 
10324 exports.check_download = function(op, callback) {
10325   // If we downloaded the file and persisted it successfully, this job would be
10326   // marked done because of the atomicity guarantee on our commits.
10327   callback(null, 'coherent-notyet');
10328 };
10329 exports.local_undo_download = function(op, callback) {
10330   callback(null);
10331 };
10332 exports.undo_download = function(op, callback) {
10333   callback(null);
10334 };
10335 
10336 
10337 exports.local_do_downloadBodies = function(op, callback) {
10338   callback(null);
10339 };
10340 
10341 exports.do_downloadBodies = function(op, callback) {
10342   var aggrErr, totalDownloaded = 0;
10343   this._partitionAndAccessFoldersSequentially(
10344     op.messages,
10345     true,
10346     function perFolder(folderConn, storage, headers, namers, callWhenDone) {
10347       folderConn.downloadBodies(headers, op.options, function(err, numDownloaded) {
10348         totalDownloaded += numDownloaded;
10349         if (err && !aggrErr) {
10350           aggrErr = err;
10351         }
10352         callWhenDone();
10353       });
10354     },
10355     function allDone() {
10356       callback(aggrErr, null,
10357                // save if we might have done work.
10358                totalDownloaded > 0);
10359     },
10360     function deadConn() {
10361       aggrErr = 'aborted-retry';
10362     },
10363     false, // reverse?
10364     'downloadBodies',
10365     true // require headers
10366   );
10367 };
10368 
10369 exports.check_downloadBodies = function(op, callback) {
10370   // If we had downloaded the bodies and persisted them successfully, this job
10371   // would be marked done because of the atomicity guarantee on our commits.  It
10372   // is possible this request might only be partially serviced, in which case we
10373   // will avoid redundant body fetches, but redundant folder selection is
10374   // possible if this request spans multiple folders.
10375   callback(null, 'coherent-notyet');
10376 };
10377 
10378 exports.check_downloadBodyReps = function(op, callback) {
10379   // If we downloaded all of the body parts and persisted them successfully,
10380   // this job would be marked done because of the atomicity guarantee on our
10381   // commits.  But it's not, so there's more to do.
10382   callback(null, 'coherent-notyet');
10383 };
10384 
10385 exports.do_downloadBodyReps = function(op, callback) {
10386   var self = this;
10387   var idxLastSlash = op.messageSuid.lastIndexOf('/'),
10388       folderId = op.messageSuid.substring(0, idxLastSlash);
10389 
10390   var folderConn, folderStorage;
10391   // Once we have the connection, get the current state of the body rep.
10392   var gotConn = function gotConn(_folderConn, _folderStorage) {
10393     folderConn = _folderConn;
10394     folderStorage = _folderStorage;
10395 
10396     folderStorage.getMessageHeader(op.messageSuid, op.messageDate, gotHeader);
10397   };
10398   var deadConn = function deadConn() {
10399     callback('aborted-retry');
10400   };
10401 
10402   var gotHeader = function gotHeader(header) {
10403     // header may have been deleted by the time we get here...
10404     if (!header) {
10405       callback();
10406       return;
10407     }
10408 
10409     folderConn.downloadBodyReps(header, onDownloadReps);
10410   };
10411 
10412   var onDownloadReps = function onDownloadReps(err, bodyInfo) {
10413     if (err) {
10414       console.error('Error downloading reps', err);
10415       // fail we cannot download for some reason?
10416       callback('unknown');
10417       return;
10418     }
10419 
10420     // success
10421     callback(null, bodyInfo, true);
10422   };
10423 
10424   self._accessFolderForMutation(folderId, true, gotConn, deadConn,
10425                                 'downloadBodyReps');
10426 };
10427 
10428 exports.local_do_downloadBodyReps = function(op, callback) {
10429   callback(null);
10430 };
10431 
10432 
10433 exports.local_do_saveDraft = function(op, callback) {
10434   var localDraftsFolder = this.account.getFirstFolderWithType('localdrafts');
10435   if (!localDraftsFolder) {
10436     callback('moot');
10437     return;
10438   }
10439   var self = this;
10440   this._accessFolderForMutation(
10441     localDraftsFolder.id, /* needConn*/ false,
10442     function(nullFolderConn, folderStorage) {
10443       function next() {
10444         if (--waitingFor === 0) {
10445           callback(
10446             null,
