10447             { suid: header.suid, date: header.date },
10448             /* save account */ true);
10449         }
10450       }
10451       var waitingFor = 2;
10452 
10453       var header = op.header, body = op.body;
10454       // fill-in header id's
10455       header.id = folderStorage._issueNewHeaderId();
10456       header.suid = folderStorage.folderId + '/' + header.id;
10457 
10458       // If there already was a draft saved, delete it.
10459       // Note that ordering of the removal and the addition doesn't really
10460       // matter here because of our use of transactions.
10461       if (op.existingNamer) {
10462         waitingFor++;
10463         folderStorage.deleteMessageHeaderAndBody(
10464           op.existingNamer.suid, op.existingNamer.date, next);
10465       }
10466 
10467       folderStorage.addMessageHeader(header, next);
10468       folderStorage.addMessageBody(header, body, next);
10469     },
10470     /* no conn => no deathback required */ null,
10471     'saveDraft');
10472 };
10473 
10474 exports.do_saveDraft = function(op, callback) {
10475   // there is no server component for this
10476   callback(null);
10477 };
10478 exports.check_saveDraft = function(op, callback) {
10479   callback(null, 'moot');
10480 };
10481 exports.local_undo_saveDraft = function(op, callback) {
10482   callback(null);
10483 };
10484 exports.undo_saveDraft = function(op, callback) {
10485   callback(null);
10486 };
10487 
10488 exports.local_do_deleteDraft = function(op, callback) {
10489   var localDraftsFolder = this.account.getFirstFolderWithType('localdrafts');
10490   if (!localDraftsFolder) {
10491     callback('moot');
10492     return;
10493   }
10494   var self = this;
10495   this._accessFolderForMutation(
10496     localDraftsFolder.id, /* needConn*/ false,
10497     function(nullFolderConn, folderStorage) {
10498       folderStorage.deleteMessageHeaderAndBody(
10499         op.messageNamer.suid, op.messageNamer.date,
10500         function() {
10501           callback(null, null, /* save account */ true);
10502         });
10503     },
10504     /* no conn => no deathback required */ null,
10505     'deleteDraft');
10506 };
10507 
10508 exports.do_deleteDraft = function(op, callback) {
10509   // there is no server component for this
10510   callback(null);
10511 };
10512 exports.check_deleteDraft = function(op, callback) {
10513   callback(null, 'moot');
10514 };
10515 exports.local_undo_deleteDraft = function(op, callback) {
10516   callback(null);
10517 };
10518 exports.undo_deleteDraft = function(op, callback) {
10519   callback(null);
10520 };
10521 
10522 
10523 exports.postJobCleanup = function(passed) {
10524   if (passed) {
10525     var deltaMap, fullMap;
10526     // - apply updates to the serverIdMap map
10527     if (this._stateDelta.serverIdMap) {
10528       deltaMap = this._stateDelta.serverIdMap;
10529       fullMap = this._state.suidToServerId;
10530       for (var suid in deltaMap) {
10531         var srvid = deltaMap[suid];
10532         if (srvid === null)
10533           delete fullMap[suid];
10534         else
10535           fullMap[suid] = srvid;
10536       }
10537     }
10538     // - apply updates to the move map
10539     if (this._stateDelta.moveMap) {
10540       deltaMap = this._stateDelta.moveMap;
10541       fullMap = this._state.moveMap;
10542       for (var oldSuid in deltaMap) {
10543         var newSuid = deltaMap[oldSuid];
10544         fullMap[oldSuid] = newSuid;
10545       }
10546     }
10547   }
10548 
10549   for (var i = 0; i < this._heldMutexReleasers.length; i++) {
10550     this._heldMutexReleasers[i]();
10551   }
10552   this._heldMutexReleasers = [];
10553 
10554   this._stateDelta.serverIdMap = null;
10555   this._stateDelta.moveMap = null;
10556 };
10557 
10558 exports.allJobsDone =  function() {
10559   this._state.suidToServerId = {};
10560   this._state.moveMap = {};
10561 };
10562 
10621 exports._partitionAndAccessFoldersSequentially = function(
10622     allMessageNamers,
10623     needConn,
10624     callInFolder,
10625     callWhenDone,
10626     callOnConnLoss,
10627     reverse,
10628     label,
10629     requireHeaders) {
10630   var partitions = $util.partitionMessagesByFolderId(allMessageNamers);
10631   var folderConn, storage, self = this,
10632       folderId = null, folderMessageNamers = null, serverIds = null,
10633       iNextPartition = 0, curPartition = null, modsToGo = 0,
10634       // Set to true immediately before calling callWhenDone; causes us to
10635       // immediately bail out of any of our callbacks in order to avoid
10636       // continuing beyond the point when we should have stopped.
10637       terminated = false;
10638 
10639   if (reverse)
10640     partitions.reverse();
10641 
10642   var openNextFolder = function openNextFolder() {
10643     if (terminated)
10644       return;
10645     if (iNextPartition >= partitions.length) {
10646       terminated = true;
10647       callWhenDone(null);
10648       return;
10649     }
10650     // Cleanup the last folder (if there was one)
10651     if (iNextPartition) {
10652       folderConn = null;
10653       // The folder's mutex should be last; if the callee acquired any
10654       // additional mutexes in the last round, it should have freed it then
10655       // too.
10656       var releaser = self._heldMutexReleasers.pop();
10657       if (releaser)
10658         releaser();
10659       folderConn = null;
10660     }
10661 
10662     curPartition = partitions[iNextPartition++];
10663     folderMessageNamers = curPartition.messages;
10664     serverIds = null;
10665     if (curPartition.folderId !== folderId) {
10666       folderId = curPartition.folderId;
10667       self._accessFolderForMutation(folderId, needConn, gotFolderConn,
10668                                     connDied, label);
10669     }
10670   };
10671   var connDied = function connDied() {
10672     if (terminated)
10673       return;
10674     if (callOnConnLoss) {
10675       try {
10676         callOnConnLoss();
10677       }
10678       catch (ex) {
10679         self._LOG.callbackErr(ex);
10680       }
10681     }
10682     terminated = true;
10683     callWhenDone('connection-lost');
10684   };
10685   var gotFolderConn = function gotFolderConn(_folderConn, _storage) {
10686     if (terminated)
10687       return;
10688     folderConn = _folderConn;
10689     storage = _storage;
10690     // - Get headers or resolve current server id from name map
10691     if (needConn && !requireHeaders) {
10692       var neededHeaders = [],
10693           suidToServerId = self._state.suidToServerId;
10694       serverIds = [];
10695       for (var i = 0; i < folderMessageNamers.length; i++) {
10696         var namer = folderMessageNamers[i];
10697         var srvid = suidToServerId[namer.suid];
10698         if (srvid) {
10699           serverIds.push(srvid);
10700         }
10701         else {
10702           serverIds.push(null);
10703           neededHeaders.push(namer);
10704         }
10705       }
10706 
10707       if (!neededHeaders.length) {
10708         try {
10709           callInFolder(folderConn, storage, serverIds, folderMessageNamers,
10710                        openNextFolder);
10711         }
10712         catch (ex) {
10713           console.error('PAAFS error:', ex, '\n', ex.stack);
10714         }
10715       }
10716       else {
10717         storage.getMessageHeaders(neededHeaders, gotNeededHeaders);
10718       }
10719     }
10720     else {
10721       storage.getMessageHeaders(folderMessageNamers, gotHeaders);
10722     }
10723   };
10724   var gotNeededHeaders = function gotNeededHeaders(headers) {
10725     if (terminated)
10726       return;
10727     var iNextServerId = serverIds.indexOf(null);
10728     for (var i = 0; i < headers.length; i++) {
10729       var header = headers[i];
10730       // It's possible that by the time this job actually gets a chance to run
10731       // that the header is no longer in the folder.  This is rare but not
10732       // particularly exceptional.
10733       if (header) {
10734         var srvid = header.srvid;
10735         serverIds[iNextServerId] = srvid;
10736         // A header that exists but does not have a server id is exceptional and
10737         // bad, although logic should handle it because of the above dead-header
10738         // case.  suidToServerId should really have provided this information to
10739         // us.
10740         if (!srvid)
10741           console.warn('Header', headers[i].suid, 'missing server id in job!');
10742       }
10743       iNextServerId = serverIds.indexOf(null, iNextServerId + 1);
10744     }
10745 
10746     // its entirely possible that we need headers but there are none so we can
10747     // skip entering this folder as the job cannot do anything with an empty
10748     // header.
10749     if (!serverIds.length) {
10750       openNextFolder();
10751       return;
10752     }
10753 
10754     try {
10755       callInFolder(folderConn, storage, serverIds, folderMessageNamers,
10756                    openNextFolder);
10757     }
10758     catch (ex) {
10759       console.error('PAAFS error:', ex, '\n', ex.stack);
10760     }
10761   };
10762   var gotHeaders = function gotHeaders(headers) {
10763     if (terminated)
10764       return;
10765     // its unlikely but entirely possible that all pending headers have been
10766     // removed somehow between when the job was queued and now.
10767     if (!headers.length) {
10768       openNextFolder();
10769       return;
10770     }
10771 
10772     // Sort the headers in ascending-by-date order so that slices hear about
10773     // changes from oldest to newest. That way, they won't get upset about being
10774     // asked to expand into the past.
10775     headers.sort(function(a, b) { return a.date > b.date; });
10776     try {
10777       callInFolder(folderConn, storage, headers, folderMessageNamers,
10778                    openNextFolder);
10779     }
10780     catch (ex) {
10781       console.error('PAAFS error:', ex, '\n', ex.stack);
10782     }
10783   };
10784   openNextFolder();
10785 };
10786 
10787 
10788 
10789 }); // end define
10790 ;
10795 define('mailapi/accountmixins',
10796   [
10797     'exports'
10798   ],
10799   function(
10800     exports
10801   ) {
10802 
10833 exports.runOp = function runOp(op, mode, callback) {
10834   console.log('runOp(' + mode + ': ' + JSON.stringify(op).substring(0, 160) +
10835               ')');
10836 
10837   var methodName = mode + '_' + op.type, self = this;
10838 
10839   if (!(methodName in this._jobDriver)) {
10840     console.warn('Unsupported op:', op.type, 'mode:', mode);
10841     callback('failure-give-up');
10842     return;
10843   }
10844 
10845   this._LOG.runOp_begin(mode, op.type, null, op);
10846   // _LOG supports wrapping calls, but we want to be able to strip out all
10847   // logging, and that wouldn't work.
10848   try {
10849     this._jobDriver[methodName](op, function(error, resultIfAny,
10850                                              accountSaveSuggested) {
10851       self._jobDriver.postJobCleanup(!error);
10852       self._LOG.runOp_end(mode, op.type, error, op);
10853       // defer the callback to the next tick to avoid deep recursion
10854       window.setZeroTimeout(function() {
10855         callback(error, resultIfAny, accountSaveSuggested);
10856       });
10857     });
10858   }
10859   catch (ex) {
10860     this._LOG.opError(mode, op.type, ex);
10861   }
10862 };
10863 
10864 
10869 exports.getFirstFolderWithType = function(type) {
10870   var folders = this.folders;
10871   for (var iFolder = 0; iFolder < folders.length; iFolder++) {
10872     if (folders[iFolder].type === type)
10873       return folders[iFolder];
10874   }
10875  return null;
10876 };
10877 exports.getFolderByPath = function(folderPath) {
10878   var folders = this.folders;
10879   for (var iFolder = 0; iFolder < folders.length; iFolder++) {
10880     if (folders[iFolder].path === folderPath)
10881       return folders[iFolder];
10882   }
10883  return null;
10884 };
10885 
10886 
10887 
10898 exports.saveAccountState = function(reuseTrans, callback, reason) {
10899   if (!this._alive) {
10900     this._LOG.accountDeleted('saveAccountState');
10901     return null;
10902   }
10903 
10904   // Indicate save is active, in case something, like
10905   // signaling the end of a sync, needs to run after
10906   // a save, via runAfterSaves.
10907   this._saveAccountStateActive = true;
10908   if (!this._deferredSaveAccountCalls) {
10909     this._deferredSaveAccountCalls = [];
10910   }
10911 
10912   if (callback)
10913     this.runAfterSaves(callback);
10914 
10915   var perFolderStuff = [], self = this;
10916   for (var iFolder = 0; iFolder < this.folders.length; iFolder++) {
10917     var folderPub = this.folders[iFolder],
10918         folderStorage = this._folderStorages[folderPub.id],
10919         folderStuff = folderStorage.generatePersistenceInfo();
10920     if (folderStuff)
10921       perFolderStuff.push(folderStuff);
10922   }
10923   this._LOG.saveAccountState(reason);
10924   var trans = this._db.saveAccountFolderStates(
10925     this.id, this._folderInfos, perFolderStuff,
10926     this._deadFolderIds,
10927     function stateSaved() {
10928       this._saveAccountStateActive = false;
10929 
10930       // NB: we used to log when the save completed, but it ended up being
10931       // annoying to the unit tests since we don't block our actions on
10932       // the completion of the save at this time.
10933 
10934       var callbacks = this._deferredSaveAccountCalls;
10935       this._deferredSaveAccountCalls = [];
10936       callbacks.forEach(function(callback) {
10937         callback();
10938       });
10939     }.bind(this),
10940     reuseTrans);
10941   this._deadFolderIds = null;
10942   return trans;
10943 };
10944 
10945 exports.runAfterSaves = function(callback) {
10946   if (this._saveAccountStateActive || this._saveAccountIsImminent) {
10947     this._deferredSaveAccountCalls.push(callback);
10948   } else {
10949     callback();
10950   }
10951 };
10952 
10953 }); // end define
10954 ;
10955 define('events',['require','exports','module'],function (require, exports, module) {
10956 if (!process.EventEmitter) process.EventEmitter = function () {};
10957 
10958 var EventEmitter = exports.EventEmitter = process.EventEmitter;
10959 var isArray = typeof Array.isArray === 'function'
10960     ? Array.isArray
10961     : function (xs) {
10962         return Object.toString.call(xs) === '[object Array]'
10963     }
10964 ;
10965 
10966 // By default EventEmitters will print a warning if more than
10967 // 10 listeners are added to it. This is a useful default which
10968 // helps finding memory leaks.
10969 //
10970 // Obviously not all Emitters should be limited to 10. This function allows
10971 // that to be increased. Set to zero for unlimited.
10972 var defaultMaxListeners = 10;
10973 EventEmitter.prototype.setMaxListeners = function(n) {
10974   if (!this._events) this._events = {};
10975   this._events.maxListeners = n;
10976 };
10977 
10978 
10979 EventEmitter.prototype.emit = function(type) {
10980   // If there is no 'error' event listener then throw.
10981   if (type === 'error') {
10982     if (!this._events || !this._events.error ||
10983         (isArray(this._events.error) && !this._events.error.length))
10984     {
10985       if (arguments[1] instanceof Error) {
10986         throw arguments[1]; // Unhandled 'error' event
10987       } else {
10988         throw new Error("Uncaught, unspecified 'error' event.");
10989       }
10990       return false;
10991     }
10992   }
10993 
10994   if (!this._events) return false;
10995   var handler = this._events[type];
10996   if (!handler) return false;
10997 
10998   if (typeof handler == 'function') {
10999     switch (arguments.length) {
11000       // fast cases
11001       case 1:
11002         handler.call(this);
11003         break;
11004       case 2:
11005         handler.call(this, arguments[1]);
11006         break;
11007       case 3:
11008         handler.call(this, arguments[1], arguments[2]);
11009         break;
11010       // slower
11011       default:
11012         var args = Array.prototype.slice.call(arguments, 1);
11013         handler.apply(this, args);
11014     }
11015     return true;
11016 
11017   } else if (isArray(handler)) {
11018     var args = Array.prototype.slice.call(arguments, 1);
11019 
11020     var listeners = handler.slice();
11021     for (var i = 0, l = listeners.length; i < l; i++) {
11022       listeners[i].apply(this, args);
11023     }
11024     return true;
11025 
11026   } else {
11027     return false;
11028   }
11029 };
11030 
11031 // EventEmitter is defined in src/node_events.cc
11032 // EventEmitter.prototype.emit() is also defined there.
11033 EventEmitter.prototype.addListener = function(type, listener) {
11034   if ('function' !== typeof listener) {
11035     throw new Error('addListener only takes instances of Function');
11036   }
11037 
11038   if (!this._events) this._events = {};
11039 
11040   // To avoid recursion in the case that type == "newListeners"! Before
11041   // adding it to the listeners, first emit "newListeners".
11042   this.emit('newListener', type, listener);
11043 
11044   if (!this._events[type]) {
11045     // Optimize the case of one listener. Don't need the extra array object.
11046     this._events[type] = listener;
11047   } else if (isArray(this._events[type])) {
11048 
11049     // Check for listener leak
11050     if (!this._events[type].warned) {
11051       var m;
11052       if (this._events.maxListeners !== undefined) {
11053         m = this._events.maxListeners;
11054       } else {
11055         m = defaultMaxListeners;
11056       }
11057 
11058       if (m && m > 0 && this._events[type].length > m) {
11059         this._events[type].warned = true;
11060         console.error('(node) warning: possible EventEmitter memory ' +
11061                       'leak detected. %d listeners added. ' +
11062                       'Use emitter.setMaxListeners() to increase limit.',
11063                       this._events[type].length);
11064         console.trace();
11065       }
11066     }
11067 
11068     // If we've already got an array, just append.
11069     this._events[type].push(listener);
11070   } else {
11071     // Adding the second element, need to change to array.
11072     this._events[type] = [this._events[type], listener];
11073   }
11074 
11075   return this;
11076 };
11077 
11078 EventEmitter.prototype.on = EventEmitter.prototype.addListener;
11079 
11080 EventEmitter.prototype.once = function(type, listener) {
11081   var self = this;
11082   self.on(type, function g() {
11083     self.removeListener(type, g);
11084     listener.apply(this, arguments);
11085   });
11086 
11087   return this;
11088 };
11089 
11090 EventEmitter.prototype.removeListener = function(type, listener) {
11091   if ('function' !== typeof listener) {
11092     throw new Error('removeListener only takes instances of Function');
11093   }
11094 
11095   // does not use listeners(), so no side effect of creating _events[type]
11096   if (!this._events || !this._events[type]) return this;
11097 
11098   var list = this._events[type];
11099 
11100   if (isArray(list)) {
11101     var i = list.indexOf(listener);
11102     if (i < 0) return this;
11103     list.splice(i, 1);
11104     if (list.length == 0)
11105       delete this._events[type];
11106   } else if (this._events[type] === listener) {
11107     delete this._events[type];
11108   }
11109 
11110   return this;
11111 };
11112 
11113 EventEmitter.prototype.removeAllListeners = function(type) {
11114   // does not use listeners(), so no side effect of creating _events[type]
11115   if (type && this._events && this._events[type]) this._events[type] = null;
11116   if (!type) this._events = {};
11117   return this;
11118 };
11119 
11120 EventEmitter.prototype.listeners = function(type) {
11121   if (!this._events) this._events = {};
11122   if (!this._events[type]) this._events[type] = [];
11123   if (!isArray(this._events[type])) {
11124     this._events[type] = [this._events[type]];
11125   }
11126   return this._events[type];
11127 };
11128 
11129 });
11130 define('util',['require','exports','module','events'],function (require, exports, module) {
11131 var events = require('events');
11132 
11133 exports.print = function () {};
11134 exports.puts = function () {};
11135 exports.debug = function() {};
11136 
11137 exports.log = function (msg) {};
11138 
11139 exports.pump = null;
11140 
11141 exports.inherits = function(ctor, superCtor) {
11142   ctor.super_ = superCtor;
11143   ctor.prototype = Object.create(superCtor.prototype, {
11144     constructor: {
11145       value: ctor,
11146       enumerable: false,
11147       writable: true,
11148       configurable: true
11149     }
11150   });
11151 };
11152 
11153 });
11154 define('stream',['require','exports','module','events','util'],function (require, exports, module) {
11155 var events = require('events');
11156 var util = require('util');
11157 
11158 function Stream() {
11159   events.EventEmitter.call(this);
11160 }
11161 util.inherits(Stream, events.EventEmitter);
11162 module.exports = Stream;
11163 // Backwards-compat with node 0.4.x
11164 Stream.Stream = Stream;
11165 
11166 Stream.prototype.pipe = function(dest, options) {
11167   var source = this;
11168 
11169   function ondata(chunk) {
11170     if (dest.writable) {
11171       if (false === dest.write(chunk) && source.pause) {
11172         source.pause();
11173       }
11174     }
11175   }
11176 
11177   source.on('data', ondata);
11178 
11179   function ondrain() {
11180     if (source.readable && source.resume) {
11181       source.resume();
11182     }
11183   }
11184 
11185   dest.on('drain', ondrain);
11186 
11187   // If the 'end' option is not supplied, dest.end() will be called when
11188   // source gets the 'end' or 'close' events.  Only dest.end() once, and
11189   // only when all sources have ended.
11190   if (!dest._isStdio && (!options || options.end !== false)) {
11191     dest._pipeCount = dest._pipeCount || 0;
11192     dest._pipeCount++;
11193 
11194     source.on('end', onend);
11195     source.on('close', onclose);
11196   }
11197 
11198   var didOnEnd = false;
11199   function onend() {
11200     if (didOnEnd) return;
11201     didOnEnd = true;
11202 
11203     dest._pipeCount--;
11204 
11205     // remove the listeners
11206     cleanup();
11207 
11208     if (dest._pipeCount > 0) {
11209       // waiting for other incoming streams to end.
11210       return;
11211     }
11212 
11213     dest.end();
11214   }
11215 
11216 
11217   function onclose() {
11218     if (didOnEnd) return;
11219     didOnEnd = true;
11220 
11221     dest._pipeCount--;
11222 
11223     // remove the listeners
11224     cleanup();
11225 
11226     if (dest._pipeCount > 0) {
11227       // waiting for other incoming streams to end.
11228       return;
11229     }
11230 
11231     dest.destroy();
11232   }
11233 
11234   // don't leave dangling pipes when there are errors.
11235   function onerror(er) {
11236     cleanup();
11237     if (this.listeners('error').length === 0) {
11238       throw er; // Unhandled stream error in pipe.
11239     }
11240   }
11241 
11242   source.on('error', onerror);
11243   dest.on('error', onerror);
11244 
11245   // remove all the event listeners that were added.
11246   function cleanup() {
11247     source.removeListener('data', ondata);
11248     dest.removeListener('drain', ondrain);
11249 
11250     source.removeListener('end', onend);
11251     source.removeListener('close', onclose);
11252 
11253     source.removeListener('error', onerror);
11254     dest.removeListener('error', onerror);
11255 
11256     source.removeListener('end', cleanup);
11257     source.removeListener('close', cleanup);
11258 
11259     dest.removeListener('end', cleanup);
11260     dest.removeListener('close', cleanup);
11261   }
11262 
11263   source.on('end', cleanup);
11264   source.on('close', cleanup);
11265 
11266   dest.on('end', cleanup);
11267   dest.on('close', cleanup);
11268 
11269   dest.emit('pipe', source);
11270 
11271   // Allow for unix-like usage: A.pipe(B).pipe(C)
11272   return dest;
11273 };
11274 
11275 });
11276 define('crypto',['require','exports','module'],function(require, exports, module) {
11277 
11278 exports.createHash = function(algorithm) {
11279   if (algorithm !== "md5")
11280     throw new Error("MD5 or bust!");
11281 
11282   var data = "";
11283   return {
11284     update: function(addData) {
11285       data += addData;
11286     },
11287     digest: function(encoding) {
11288       switch (encoding) {
11289         case "hex":
11290           return hex_md5(data);
11291         case "base64":
11292           return b64_md5(data);
11293         default:
11294           throw new Error("The encoding is no good: " + encoding);
11295       }
11296     }
11297   };
11298 };
11299 
11300 /*
11301  * A JavaScript implementation of the RSA Data Security, Inc. MD5 Message
11302  * Digest Algorithm, as defined in RFC 1321.
11303  * Version 2.2 Copyright (C) Paul Johnston 1999 - 2009
11304  * Other contributors: Greg Holt, Andrew Kepert, Ydnar, Lostinet
11305  * Distributed under the BSD License
11306  * See http://pajhome.org.uk/crypt/md5 for more info.
11307  */
11308 
11309 /*
11310  * Configurable variables. You may need to tweak these to be compatible with
11311  * the server-side, but the defaults work in most cases.
11312  */
11313 var hexcase = 0;   /* hex output format. 0 - lowercase; 1 - uppercase        */
11314 var b64pad  = "";  /* base-64 pad character. "=" for strict RFC compliance   */
11315 
11316 /*
11317  * These are the functions you'll usually want to call
11318  * They take string arguments and return either hex or base-64 encoded strings
11319  */
11320 function hex_md5(s)    { return rstr2hex(rstr_md5(str2rstr_utf8(s))); }
11321 function b64_md5(s)    { return rstr2b64(rstr_md5(str2rstr_utf8(s))); }
11322 function any_md5(s, e) { return rstr2any(rstr_md5(str2rstr_utf8(s)), e); }
11323 function hex_hmac_md5(k, d)
11324   { return rstr2hex(rstr_hmac_md5(str2rstr_utf8(k), str2rstr_utf8(d))); }
11325 function b64_hmac_md5(k, d)
11326   { return rstr2b64(rstr_hmac_md5(str2rstr_utf8(k), str2rstr_utf8(d))); }
11327 function any_hmac_md5(k, d, e)
11328   { return rstr2any(rstr_hmac_md5(str2rstr_utf8(k), str2rstr_utf8(d)), e); }
11329 
11330 /*
11331  * Perform a simple self-test to see if the VM is working
11332  */
11333 function md5_vm_test()
11334 {
11335   return hex_md5("abc").toLowerCase() == "900150983cd24fb0d6963f7d28e17f72";
11336 }
11337 
11338 /*
11339  * Calculate the MD5 of a raw string
11340  */
11341 function rstr_md5(s)
11342 {
11343   return binl2rstr(binl_md5(rstr2binl(s), s.length * 8));
11344 }
11345 
11346 /*
11347  * Calculate the HMAC-MD5, of a key and some data (raw strings)
11348  */
11349 function rstr_hmac_md5(key, data)
11350 {
11351   var bkey = rstr2binl(key);
11352   if(bkey.length > 16) bkey = binl_md5(bkey, key.length * 8);
11353 
11354   var ipad = Array(16), opad = Array(16);
11355   for(var i = 0; i < 16; i++)
11356   {
11357     ipad[i] = bkey[i] ^ 0x36363636;
11358     opad[i] = bkey[i] ^ 0x5C5C5C5C;
11359   }
11360 
11361   var hash = binl_md5(ipad.concat(rstr2binl(data)), 512 + data.length * 8);
11362   return binl2rstr(binl_md5(opad.concat(hash), 512 + 128));
11363 }
11364 
11365 /*
11366  * Convert a raw string to a hex string
11367  */
11368 function rstr2hex(input)
11369 {
11370   try { hexcase } catch(e) { hexcase=0; }
11371   var hex_tab = hexcase ? "0123456789ABCDEF" : "0123456789abcdef";
11372   var output = "";
11373   var x;
11374   for(var i = 0; i < input.length; i++)
11375   {
11376     x = input.charCodeAt(i);
11377     output += hex_tab.charAt((x >>> 4) & 0x0F)
11378            +  hex_tab.charAt( x        & 0x0F);
11379   }
11380   return output;
11381 }
11382 
11383 /*
11384  * Convert a raw string to a base-64 string
11385  */
11386 function rstr2b64(input)
11387 {
11388   try { b64pad } catch(e) { b64pad=''; }
11389   var tab = "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz0123456789+/";
11390   var output = "";
11391   var len = input.length;
11392   for(var i = 0; i < len; i += 3)
11393   {
11394     var triplet = (input.charCodeAt(i) << 16)
11395                 | (i + 1 < len ? input.charCodeAt(i+1) << 8 : 0)
11396                 | (i + 2 < len ? input.charCodeAt(i+2)      : 0);
11397     for(var j = 0; j < 4; j++)
11398     {
11399       if(i * 8 + j * 6 > input.length * 8) output += b64pad;
11400       else output += tab.charAt((triplet >>> 6*(3-j)) & 0x3F);
11401     }
11402   }
11403   return output;
11404 }
11405 
11406 /*
11407  * Convert a raw string to an arbitrary string encoding
11408  */
11409 function rstr2any(input, encoding)
11410 {
11411   var divisor = encoding.length;
11412   var i, j, q, x, quotient;
11413 
11414   /* Convert to an array of 16-bit big-endian values, forming the dividend */
11415   var dividend = Array(Math.ceil(input.length / 2));
11416   for(i = 0; i < dividend.length; i++)
11417   {
11418     dividend[i] = (input.charCodeAt(i * 2) << 8) | input.charCodeAt(i * 2 + 1);
11419   }
11420 
11421   /*
11422    * Repeatedly perform a long division. The binary array forms the dividend,
11423    * the length of the encoding is the divisor. Once computed, the quotient
11424    * forms the dividend for the next step. All remainders are stored for later
11425    * use.
11426    */
11427   var full_length = Math.ceil(input.length * 8 /
11428                                     (Math.log(encoding.length) / Math.log(2)));
11429   var remainders = Array(full_length);
11430   for(j = 0; j < full_length; j++)
11431   {
11432     quotient = Array();
11433     x = 0;
11434     for(i = 0; i < dividend.length; i++)
11435     {
11436       x = (x << 16) + dividend[i];
11437       q = Math.floor(x / divisor);
11438       x -= q * divisor;
11439       if(quotient.length > 0 || q > 0)
11440         quotient[quotient.length] = q;
11441     }
11442     remainders[j] = x;
11443     dividend = quotient;
11444   }
11445 
11446   /* Convert the remainders to the output string */
11447   var output = "";
11448   for(i = remainders.length - 1; i >= 0; i--)
11449     output += encoding.charAt(remainders[i]);
11450 
11451   return output;
11452 }
11453 
11454 /*
11455  * Encode a string as utf-8.
11456  * For efficiency, this assumes the input is valid utf-16.
11457  */
11458 function str2rstr_utf8(input)
11459 {
11460   var output = "";
11461   var i = -1;
11462   var x, y;
11463 
11464   while(++i < input.length)
11465   {
11466     /* Decode utf-16 surrogate pairs */
11467     x = input.charCodeAt(i);
11468     y = i + 1 < input.length ? input.charCodeAt(i + 1) : 0;
11469     if(0xD800 <= x && x <= 0xDBFF && 0xDC00 <= y && y <= 0xDFFF)
11470     {
11471       x = 0x10000 + ((x & 0x03FF) << 10) + (y & 0x03FF);
11472       i++;
11473     }
11474 
11475     /* Encode output as utf-8 */
11476     if(x <= 0x7F)
11477       output += String.fromCharCode(x);
11478     else if(x <= 0x7FF)
11479       output += String.fromCharCode(0xC0 | ((x >>> 6 ) & 0x1F),
11480                                     0x80 | ( x         & 0x3F));
11481     else if(x <= 0xFFFF)
11482       output += String.fromCharCode(0xE0 | ((x >>> 12) & 0x0F),
11483                                     0x80 | ((x >>> 6 ) & 0x3F),
11484                                     0x80 | ( x         & 0x3F));
11485     else if(x <= 0x1FFFFF)
11486       output += String.fromCharCode(0xF0 | ((x >>> 18) & 0x07),
11487                                     0x80 | ((x >>> 12) & 0x3F),
11488                                     0x80 | ((x >>> 6 ) & 0x3F),
11489                                     0x80 | ( x         & 0x3F));
11490   }
11491   return output;
11492 }
11493 
11494 /*
11495  * Encode a string as utf-16
11496  */
11497 function str2rstr_utf16le(input)
11498 {
11499   var output = "";
11500   for(var i = 0; i < input.length; i++)
11501     output += String.fromCharCode( input.charCodeAt(i)        & 0xFF,
11502                                   (input.charCodeAt(i) >>> 8) & 0xFF);
11503   return output;
11504 }
11505 
11506 function str2rstr_utf16be(input)
11507 {
11508   var output = "";
11509   for(var i = 0; i < input.length; i++)
11510     output += String.fromCharCode((input.charCodeAt(i) >>> 8) & 0xFF,
11511                                    input.charCodeAt(i)        & 0xFF);
11512   return output;
11513 }
11514 
11515 /*
11516  * Convert a raw string to an array of little-endian words
11517  * Characters >255 have their high-byte silently ignored.
11518  */
11519 function rstr2binl(input)
11520 {
11521   var output = Array(input.length >> 2);
11522   for(var i = 0; i < output.length; i++)
11523     output[i] = 0;
11524   for(var i = 0; i < input.length * 8; i += 8)
11525     output[i>>5] |= (input.charCodeAt(i / 8) & 0xFF) << (i%32);
11526   return output;
11527 }
11528 
11529 /*
11530  * Convert an array of little-endian words to a string
11531  */
11532 function binl2rstr(input)
11533 {
11534   var output = "";
11535   for(var i = 0; i < input.length * 32; i += 8)
11536     output += String.fromCharCode((input[i>>5] >>> (i % 32)) & 0xFF);
11537   return output;
11538 }
11539 
11540 /*
11541  * Calculate the MD5 of an array of little-endian words, and a bit length.
11542  */
11543 function binl_md5(x, len)
11544 {
11545   /* append padding */
11546   x[len >> 5] |= 0x80 << ((len) % 32);
11547   x[(((len + 64) >>> 9) << 4) + 14] = len;
11548 
11549   var a =  1732584193;
11550   var b = -271733879;
11551   var c = -1732584194;
11552   var d =  271733878;
11553 
11554   for(var i = 0; i < x.length; i += 16)
11555   {
11556     var olda = a;
11557     var oldb = b;
11558     var oldc = c;
11559     var oldd = d;
11560 
11561     a = md5_ff(a, b, c, d, x[i+ 0], 7 , -680876936);
11562     d = md5_ff(d, a, b, c, x[i+ 1], 12, -389564586);
11563     c = md5_ff(c, d, a, b, x[i+ 2], 17,  606105819);
11564     b = md5_ff(b, c, d, a, x[i+ 3], 22, -1044525330);
11565     a = md5_ff(a, b, c, d, x[i+ 4], 7 , -176418897);
11566     d = md5_ff(d, a, b, c, x[i+ 5], 12,  1200080426);
11567     c = md5_ff(c, d, a, b, x[i+ 6], 17, -1473231341);
11568     b = md5_ff(b, c, d, a, x[i+ 7], 22, -45705983);
11569     a = md5_ff(a, b, c, d, x[i+ 8], 7 ,  1770035416);
11570     d = md5_ff(d, a, b, c, x[i+ 9], 12, -1958414417);
11571     c = md5_ff(c, d, a, b, x[i+10], 17, -42063);
11572     b = md5_ff(b, c, d, a, x[i+11], 22, -1990404162);
11573     a = md5_ff(a, b, c, d, x[i+12], 7 ,  1804603682);
11574     d = md5_ff(d, a, b, c, x[i+13], 12, -40341101);
11575     c = md5_ff(c, d, a, b, x[i+14], 17, -1502002290);
11576     b = md5_ff(b, c, d, a, x[i+15], 22,  1236535329);
11577 
11578     a = md5_gg(a, b, c, d, x[i+ 1], 5 , -165796510);
11579     d = md5_gg(d, a, b, c, x[i+ 6], 9 , -1069501632);
11580     c = md5_gg(c, d, a, b, x[i+11], 14,  643717713);
11581     b = md5_gg(b, c, d, a, x[i+ 0], 20, -373897302);
11582     a = md5_gg(a, b, c, d, x[i+ 5], 5 , -701558691);
11583     d = md5_gg(d, a, b, c, x[i+10], 9 ,  38016083);
11584     c = md5_gg(c, d, a, b, x[i+15], 14, -660478335);
11585     b = md5_gg(b, c, d, a, x[i+ 4], 20, -405537848);
11586     a = md5_gg(a, b, c, d, x[i+ 9], 5 ,  568446438);
11587     d = md5_gg(d, a, b, c, x[i+14], 9 , -1019803690);
11588     c = md5_gg(c, d, a, b, x[i+ 3], 14, -187363961);
11589     b = md5_gg(b, c, d, a, x[i+ 8], 20,  1163531501);
11590     a = md5_gg(a, b, c, d, x[i+13], 5 , -1444681467);
11591     d = md5_gg(d, a, b, c, x[i+ 2], 9 , -51403784);
11592     c = md5_gg(c, d, a, b, x[i+ 7], 14,  1735328473);
11593     b = md5_gg(b, c, d, a, x[i+12], 20, -1926607734);
11594 
11595     a = md5_hh(a, b, c, d, x[i+ 5], 4 , -378558);
11596     d = md5_hh(d, a, b, c, x[i+ 8], 11, -2022574463);
11597     c = md5_hh(c, d, a, b, x[i+11], 16,  1839030562);
11598     b = md5_hh(b, c, d, a, x[i+14], 23, -35309556);
11599     a = md5_hh(a, b, c, d, x[i+ 1], 4 , -1530992060);
11600     d = md5_hh(d, a, b, c, x[i+ 4], 11,  1272893353);
11601     c = md5_hh(c, d, a, b, x[i+ 7], 16, -155497632);
11602     b = md5_hh(b, c, d, a, x[i+10], 23, -1094730640);
11603     a = md5_hh(a, b, c, d, x[i+13], 4 ,  681279174);
11604     d = md5_hh(d, a, b, c, x[i+ 0], 11, -358537222);
11605     c = md5_hh(c, d, a, b, x[i+ 3], 16, -722521979);
11606     b = md5_hh(b, c, d, a, x[i+ 6], 23,  76029189);
11607     a = md5_hh(a, b, c, d, x[i+ 9], 4 , -640364487);
11608     d = md5_hh(d, a, b, c, x[i+12], 11, -421815835);
11609     c = md5_hh(c, d, a, b, x[i+15], 16,  530742520);
11610     b = md5_hh(b, c, d, a, x[i+ 2], 23, -995338651);
11611 
11612     a = md5_ii(a, b, c, d, x[i+ 0], 6 , -198630844);
11613     d = md5_ii(d, a, b, c, x[i+ 7], 10,  1126891415);
11614     c = md5_ii(c, d, a, b, x[i+14], 15, -1416354905);
11615     b = md5_ii(b, c, d, a, x[i+ 5], 21, -57434055);
11616     a = md5_ii(a, b, c, d, x[i+12], 6 ,  1700485571);
11617     d = md5_ii(d, a, b, c, x[i+ 3], 10, -1894986606);
11618     c = md5_ii(c, d, a, b, x[i+10], 15, -1051523);
11619     b = md5_ii(b, c, d, a, x[i+ 1], 21, -2054922799);
11620     a = md5_ii(a, b, c, d, x[i+ 8], 6 ,  1873313359);
11621     d = md5_ii(d, a, b, c, x[i+15], 10, -30611744);
11622     c = md5_ii(c, d, a, b, x[i+ 6], 15, -1560198380);
11623     b = md5_ii(b, c, d, a, x[i+13], 21,  1309151649);
11624     a = md5_ii(a, b, c, d, x[i+ 4], 6 , -145523070);
11625     d = md5_ii(d, a, b, c, x[i+11], 10, -1120210379);
11626     c = md5_ii(c, d, a, b, x[i+ 2], 15,  718787259);
11627     b = md5_ii(b, c, d, a, x[i+ 9], 21, -343485551);
11628 
11629     a = safe_add(a, olda);
11630     b = safe_add(b, oldb);
11631     c = safe_add(c, oldc);
11632     d = safe_add(d, oldd);
11633   }
11634   return Array(a, b, c, d);
11635 }
11636 
11637 /*
11638  * These functions implement the four basic operations the algorithm uses.
11639  */
11640 function md5_cmn(q, a, b, x, s, t)
11641 {
11642   return safe_add(bit_rol(safe_add(safe_add(a, q), safe_add(x, t)), s),b);
11643 }
11644 function md5_ff(a, b, c, d, x, s, t)
11645 {
11646   return md5_cmn((b & c) | ((~b) & d), a, b, x, s, t);
11647 }
11648 function md5_gg(a, b, c, d, x, s, t)
11649 {
11650   return md5_cmn((b & d) | (c & (~d)), a, b, x, s, t);
11651 }
11652 function md5_hh(a, b, c, d, x, s, t)
11653 {
11654   return md5_cmn(b ^ c ^ d, a, b, x, s, t);
11655 }
11656 function md5_ii(a, b, c, d, x, s, t)
11657 {
11658   return md5_cmn(c ^ (b | (~d)), a, b, x, s, t);
11659 }
11660 
11661 /*
11662  * Add integers, wrapping at 2^32. This uses 16-bit operations internally
11663  * to work around bugs in some JS interpreters.
11664  */
11665 function safe_add(x, y)
11666 {
11667   var lsw = (x & 0xFFFF) + (y & 0xFFFF);
11668   var msw = (x >> 16) + (y >> 16) + (lsw >> 16);
11669   return (msw << 16) | (lsw & 0xFFFF);
11670 }
11671 
11672 /*
11673  * Bitwise rotate a 32-bit number to the left.
11674  */
11675 function bit_rol(num, cnt)
11676 {
11677   return (num << cnt) | (num >>> (32 - cnt));
11678 }
11679 
11680 });
11681 
11688 define('encoding',['require','exports','module'],function(require, exports, module) {
11689 
11690 // from https://github.com/andris9/encoding/blob/master/index.js
11691 // (MIT licensed)
11698 function checkEncoding(name){
11699     name = (name || "").toString().trim().toLowerCase().
11700         // this handles aliases with dashes and underscores too; built-in
11701         // aliase are only for latin1, latin2, etc.
11702         replace(/^latin[\-_]?(\d+)$/, "iso-8859-$1").
11703         // win949, win-949, ms949 => windows-949
11704         replace(/^(?:(?:win(?:dows)?)|ms)[\-_]?(\d+)$/, "windows-$1").
11705         replace(/^utf[\-_]?(\d+)$/, "utf-$1").
11706         replace(/^us_?ascii$/, "ascii"); // maps to windows-1252
11707     return name;
11708 }
11709 exports.checkEncoding = checkEncoding;
11710 
11711 var ENCODER_OPTIONS = { fatal: false };
11712 
11713 exports.convert = function(str, destEnc, sourceEnc, ignoredUseLite) {
11714   destEnc = checkEncoding(destEnc || 'utf-8');
11715   sourceEnc = checkEncoding(sourceEnc || 'utf-8');
11716 
11717   if (destEnc === sourceEnc)
11718     return new Buffer(str, 'utf-8');
11719 
11720   // - decoding (Uint8Array => String)
11721   else if (/^utf-8$/.test(destEnc)) {
11722     var decoder = new TextDecoder(sourceEnc, ENCODER_OPTIONS);
11723     if (typeof(str) === 'string')
11724       str = new Buffer(str, 'binary');
11725     // XXX strictly speaking, we should be returning a buffer...
11726     return decoder.decode(str);
11727   }
11728   // - encoding (String => Uint8Array)
11729   else {
11730     var idxSlash = destEnc.indexOf('/');
11731     // ignore '//TRANSLIT//IGNORE' and the like.
11732     if (idxSlash !== -1 && destEnc[idxSlash+1] === '/')
11733       destEnc = destEnc.substring(0, idxSlash);
11734 
11735     var encoder = new TextEncoder(destEnc, ENCODER_OPTIONS);
11736     return encoder.encode(str);
11737   }
11738 };
11739 
11740 });
11741 
11742 /* Holds localized strings fo mailchew. mailbridge will set the values.
11743  * This is broken out as a separate module so that mailchew can be loaded
11744  * async as needed.
11745  **/
11746 
11747 define('mailapi/mailchew-strings',
11748   [
11749     'exports',
11750     'events'
11751   ],
11752   function(
11753     exports,
11754     $EventEmitter
11755   ) {
11756 
11757 exports.events = new $EventEmitter.EventEmitter();
11758 
11759 exports.set = function set(strings) {
11760   exports.strings = strings;
11761   exports.events.emit('strings', strings);
11762 };
11763 
11764 });
11765 
11766 /*global define */
11767 define('mailapi/slice_bridge_proxy',
11768   [
11769     'exports'
11770   ],
11771   function(
11772     exports
11773   ) {
11774 
11775 function SliceBridgeProxy(bridge, ns, handle) {
11776   this._bridge = bridge;
11777   this._ns = ns;
11778   this._handle = handle;
11779   this.__listener = null;
11780 
11781   this.status = 'synced';
11782   this.progress = 0.0;
11783   this.atTop = false;
11784   this.atBottom = false;
11796   this.userCanGrowUpwards = false;
11797   this.userCanGrowDownwards = false;
11798 }
11799 
11800 exports.SliceBridgeProxy = SliceBridgeProxy;
11801 
11802 SliceBridgeProxy.prototype = {
11808   sendSplice: function sbp_sendSplice(index, howMany, addItems, requested,
11809                                       moreExpected, newEmailCount) {
11810     this._bridge.__sendMessage({
11811       type: 'sliceSplice',
11812       handle: this._handle,
11813       index: index,
11814       howMany: howMany,
11815       addItems: addItems,
11816       requested: requested,
11817       moreExpected: moreExpected,
11818       status: this.status,
11819       progress: this.progress,
11820       atTop: this.atTop,
11821       atBottom: this.atBottom,
11822       userCanGrowUpwards: this.userCanGrowUpwards,
11823       userCanGrowDownwards: this.userCanGrowDownwards,
11824       newEmailCount: newEmailCount,
11825     });
11826   },
11827 
11831   sendUpdate: function sbp_sendUpdate(indexUpdatesRun) {
11832     this._bridge.__sendMessage({
11833       type: 'sliceUpdate',
11834       handle: this._handle,
11835       updates: indexUpdatesRun,
11836     });
11837   },
11838 
11843   sendStatus: function sbp_sendStatus(status, requested, moreExpected,
11844                                       progress, newEmailCount) {
11845     this.status = status;
11846     if (progress != null)
11847       this.progress = progress;
11848     this.sendSplice(0, 0, [], requested, moreExpected, newEmailCount);
11849   },
11850 
11851   sendSyncProgress: function(progress) {
11852     this.progress = progress;
11853     this.sendSplice(0, 0, [], true, true);
11854   },
11855 
11856   die: function sbp_die() {
11857     if (this.__listener)
11858       this.__listener.die();
11859   },
11860 };
11861 
11862 });
11863 
11868 define('mailapi/mailbridge',
11869   [
11870     'rdcommon/log',
11871     './util',
11872     './mailchew-strings',
11873     './date',
11874     './slice_bridge_proxy',
11875     'require',
11876     'module',
11877     'exports'
11878   ],
11879   function(
11880     $log,
11881     $imaputil,
11882     $mailchewStrings,
11883     $date,
11884     $sliceBridgeProxy,
11885     require,
11886     $module,
11887     exports
11888   ) {
11889 var bsearchForInsert = $imaputil.bsearchForInsert,
11890     bsearchMaybeExists = $imaputil.bsearchMaybeExists,
11891     SliceBridgeProxy = $sliceBridgeProxy.SliceBridgeProxy;
11892 
11893 function toBridgeWireOn(x) {
11894   return x.toBridgeWire();
11895 }
11896 
11897 var FOLDER_TYPE_TO_SORT_PRIORITY = {
11898   account: 'a',
11899   inbox: 'c',
11900   starred: 'e',
11901   important: 'f',
11902   drafts: 'g',
11903   localdrafts: 'h',
11904   queue: 'i',
11905   sent: 'j',
11906   junk: 'k',
11907   trash: 'm',
11908   archive: 'o',
11909   normal: 'z',
11910   // nomail folders are annoying since they are basically just hierarchy,
11911   //  but they are also rare and should only happen amongst normal folders.
11912   nomail: 'z',
11913 };
11914 
11924 function makeFolderSortString(account, folder) {
11925   if (!folder)
11926     return account.id;
11927 
11928   var parentFolder = account.getFolderMetaForFolderId(folder.parentId);
11929   return makeFolderSortString(account, parentFolder) + '!' +
11930          FOLDER_TYPE_TO_SORT_PRIORITY[folder.type] + '!' +
11931          folder.name.toLocaleLowerCase();
11932 }
11933 
11934 function strcmp(a, b) {
11935   if (a < b)
11936     return -1;
11937   else if (a > b)
11938     return 1;
11939   return 0;
11940 }
11941 
11942 function checkIfAddressListContainsAddress(list, addrPair) {
11943   if (!list)
11944     return false;
11945   var checkAddress = addrPair.address;
11946   for (var i = 0; i < list.length; i++) {
11947     if (list[i].address === checkAddress)
11948       return true;
11949   }
11950   return false;
11951 }
11952 
11958 function MailBridge(universe, name) {
11959   this.universe = universe;
11960   this.universe.registerBridge(this);
11961 
11962   this._LOG = LOGFAB.MailBridge(this, universe._LOG, name);
11964   this._slices = {};
11966   this._slicesByType = {
11967     accounts: [],
11968     identities: [],
11969     folders: [],
11970     headers: [],
11971     matchedHeaders: [],
11972   };
11973 
11987   this._observedBodies = {};
11988 
11989   // outstanding persistent objects that aren't slices. covers: composition
11990   this._pendingRequests = {};
11991   //
11992   this._lastUndoableOpPair = null;
11993 }
11994 exports.MailBridge = MailBridge;
11995 MailBridge.prototype = {
11996   __sendMessage: function(msg) {
11997     throw new Error('This is supposed to get hidden by an instance var.');
11998   },
11999 
12000   __receiveMessage: function mb___receiveMessage(msg) {
12001     var implCmdName = '_cmd_' + msg.type;
12002     if (!(implCmdName in this)) {
12003       this._LOG.badMessageType(msg.type);
12004       return;
12005     }
12006     var rval = this._LOG.cmd(msg.type, this, this[implCmdName], msg);
12007   },
12008 
12009   _cmd_ping: function mb__cmd_ping(msg) {
12010     this.__sendMessage({
12011       type: 'pong',
12012       handle: msg.handle,
12013     });
12014   },
12015 
12016   _cmd_modifyConfig: function mb__cmd_modifyConfig(msg) {
12017     this.universe.modifyConfig(msg.mods);
12018   },
12019 
12027   bodyHasObservers: function(suid) {
12028     return !!this._observedBodies[suid];
12029   },
12030 
12031   notifyConfig: function(config) {
12032     this.__sendMessage({
12033       type: 'config',
12034       config: config,
12035     });
12036   },
12037 
12038   _cmd_debugSupport: function mb__cmd_debugSupport(msg) {
12039     switch (msg.cmd) {
12040       case 'setLogging':
12041         this.universe.modifyConfig({ debugLogging: msg.arg });
12042         break;
12043 
12044       case 'dumpLog':
12045         switch (msg.arg) {
12046           case 'storage':
12047             this.universe.dumpLogToDeviceStorage();
12048             break;
12049         }
12050         break;
12051     }
12052   },
12053 
12054   _cmd_setInteractive: function mb__cmd_setInteractive(msg) {
12055     this.universe.setInteractive();
12056   },
12057 
12058   _cmd_localizedStrings: function mb__cmd_localizedStrings(msg) {
12059     $mailchewStrings.set(msg.strings);
12060   },
12061 
12062   _cmd_tryToCreateAccount: function mb__cmd_tryToCreateAccount(msg) {
12063     var self = this;
12064     this.universe.tryToCreateAccount(msg.details, msg.domainInfo,
12065                                      function(error, account, errorDetails) {
12066         self.__sendMessage({
12067             type: 'tryToCreateAccountResults',
12068             handle: msg.handle,
12069             account: account ? account.toBridgeWire() : null,
12070             error: error,
12071             errorDetails: errorDetails,
12072           });
12073       });
12074   },
12075 
12076   _cmd_clearAccountProblems: function mb__cmd_clearAccountProblems(msg) {
12077     var account = this.universe.getAccountForAccountId(msg.accountId),
12078         self = this;
12079     account.checkAccount(function(err) {
12080       // If we succeeded or the problem was not an authentication, assume
12081       // everything went fine and clear the problems.  This includes the case
12082       // we're offline.
12083       if (!err || (
12084           err !== 'bad-user-or-pass' &&
12085           err !== 'needs-app-pass' &&
12086           err !== 'imap-disabled'
12087         )) {
12088         self.universe.clearAccountProblems(account);
12089       }
12090       // The login information is still bad; re-send the bad login notification.
12091       else {
12092         // This is only being sent over this, the same bridge the clear request
12093         // came from rather than sent via the mailuniverse.  No point having the
12094         // notifications stack up on inactive UIs.
12095         self.notifyBadLogin(account, err);
12096       }
12097       self.__sendMessage({
12098         type: 'clearAccountProblems',
12099         handle: msg.handle,
12100       });
12101     });
12102   },
12103 
12104   _cmd_modifyAccount: function mb__cmd_modifyAccount(msg) {
12105     var account = this.universe.getAccountForAccountId(msg.accountId),
12106         accountDef = account.accountDef;
12107 
12108     for (var key in msg.mods) {
12109       var val = msg.mods[key];
12110 
12111       switch (key) {
12112         case 'name':
12113           accountDef.name = val;
12114           break;
12115 
12116         case 'username':
12117           accountDef.credentials.username = val;
12118           break;
12119         case 'password':
12120           accountDef.credentials.password = val;
12121           break;
12122 
12123         case 'identities':
12124           // TODO: support identity mutation
12125           // we expect a list of identity mutation objects, namely an id and the
12126           // rest are attributes to change
12127           break;
12128 
12129         case 'servers':
12130           // TODO: support server mutation
12131           // we expect a list of server mutation objects; namely, the type names
12132           // the server and the rest are attributes to change
12133           break;
12134 
12135         case 'syncRange':
12136           accountDef.syncRange = val;
12137           break;
12138 
12139         case 'syncInterval':
12140           accountDef.syncInterval = val;
12141           break;
12142 
12143         case 'notifyOnNew':
12144           accountDef.notifyOnNew = val;
12145           break;
12146 
12147         case 'setAsDefault':
12148           // Weird things can happen if the device's clock goes back in time,
12149           // but this way, at least the user can change their default if they
12150           // cycle through their accounts.
12151           if (val)
12152             accountDef.defaultPriority = $date.NOW();
12153           break;
12154       }
12155     }
12156 
12157     this.universe.saveAccountDef(accountDef, null);
12158   },
12159 
12160   _cmd_deleteAccount: function mb__cmd_deleteAccount(msg) {
12161     this.universe.deleteAccount(msg.accountId);
12162   },
12163 
12164   notifyBadLogin: function mb_notifyBadLogin(account, problem) {
12165     this.__sendMessage({
12166       type: 'badLogin',
12167       account: account.toBridgeWire(),
12168       problem: problem
12169     });
12170   },
12171 
12172   _cmd_viewAccounts: function mb__cmd_viewAccounts(msg) {
12173     var proxy = this._slices[msg.handle] =
12174           new SliceBridgeProxy(this, 'accounts', msg.handle);
12175     proxy.markers = this.universe.accounts.map(function(x) { return x.id; });
12176 
12177     this._slicesByType['accounts'].push(proxy);
12178     var wireReps = this.universe.accounts.map(toBridgeWireOn);
12179     // send all the accounts in one go.
12180     proxy.sendSplice(0, 0, wireReps, true, false);
12181   },
12182 
12183   notifyAccountAdded: function mb_notifyAccountAdded(account) {
12184     var accountWireRep = account.toBridgeWire();
12185     var i, proxy, slices, wireSplice = null, markersSplice = null;
12186     // -- notify account slices
12187     slices = this._slicesByType['accounts'];
12188     for (i = 0; i < slices.length; i++) {
12189       proxy = slices[i];
12190       proxy.sendSplice(proxy.markers.length, 0, [accountWireRep], false, false);
12191       proxy.markers.push(account.id);
12192     }
12193 
12194     // -- notify folder slices
12195     accountWireRep = account.toBridgeFolder();
12196     slices = this._slicesByType['folders'];
12197     var startMarker = makeFolderSortString(account, accountWireRep),
12198         idxStart;
12199     for (i = 0; i < slices.length; i++) {
12200       proxy = slices[i];
12201       // If it's filtered to an account, it can't care about us.  (You can't
12202       // know about an account before it's created.)
12203       if (proxy.mode === 'account')
12204         continue;
12205 
12206       idxStart = bsearchForInsert(proxy.markers, startMarker, strcmp);
12207       wireSplice = [accountWireRep];
12208       markersSplice = [startMarker];
12209       for (var iFolder = 0; iFolder < account.folders.length; iFolder++) {
12210         var folder = account.folders[iFolder],
12211             folderMarker = makeFolderSortString(account, folder),
12212             idxFolder = bsearchForInsert(markersSplice, folderMarker, strcmp);
12213         wireSplice.splice(idxFolder, 0, folder);
12214         markersSplice.splice(idxFolder, 0, folderMarker);
12215       }
12216       proxy.sendSplice(idxStart, 0, wireSplice, false, false);
12217       proxy.markers.splice.apply(proxy.markers,
12218                                  [idxStart, 0].concat(markersSplice));
12219     }
12220   },
12221 
12228   notifyAccountModified: function(account) {
12229     var slices = this._slicesByType['accounts'],
12230         accountWireRep = account.toBridgeWire();
12231     for (var i = 0; i < slices.length; i++) {
12232       var proxy = slices[i];
12233       var idx = proxy.markers.indexOf(account.id);
12234       if (idx !== -1) {
12235         proxy.sendUpdate([idx, accountWireRep]);
12236       }
12237     }
12238   },
12239 
12240   notifyAccountRemoved: function(accountId) {
12241     var i, proxy, slices;
12242     // -- notify account slices
12243     slices = this._slicesByType['accounts'];
12244     for (i = 0; i < slices.length; i++) {
12245       proxy = slices[i];
12246       var idx = proxy.markers.indexOf(accountId);
12247       if (idx !== -1) {
12248         proxy.sendSplice(idx, 1, [], false, false);
12249         proxy.markers.splice(idx, 1);
12250       }
12251     }
12252 
12253     // -- notify folder slices
12254     slices = this._slicesByType['folders'];
12255     var startMarker = accountId + '!!',
12256         endMarker = accountId + '!|';
12257     for (i = 0; i < slices.length; i++) {
12258       proxy = slices[i];
12259       var idxStart = bsearchForInsert(proxy.markers, startMarker,
12260                                       strcmp),
12261           idxEnd = bsearchForInsert(proxy.markers, endMarker,
12262                                     strcmp);
12263       if (idxEnd !== idxStart) {
12264         proxy.sendSplice(idxStart, idxEnd - idxStart, [], false, false);
12265         proxy.markers.splice(idxStart, idxEnd - idxStart);
12266       }
12267     }
12268   },
12269 
12270   _cmd_viewSenderIdentities: function mb__cmd_viewSenderIdentities(msg) {
12271     var proxy = this._slices[msg.handle] =
12272           new SliceBridgeProxy(this, identities, msg.handle);
12273     this._slicesByType['identities'].push(proxy);
12274     var wireReps = this.universe.identities;
12275     // send all the identities in one go.
12276     proxy.sendSplice(0, 0, wireReps, true, false);
12277   },
12278 
12279   _cmd_requestBodies: function(msg) {
12280     var self = this;
12281     this.universe.downloadBodies(msg.messages, msg.options, function() {
12282       self.__sendMessage({
12283         type: 'requestBodiesComplete',
12284         handle: msg.handle,
12285         requestId: msg.requestId
12286       });
12287     });
12288   },
12289 
12290   notifyFolderAdded: function(account, folderMeta) {
12291     var newMarker = makeFolderSortString(account, folderMeta);
12292 
12293     var slices = this._slicesByType['folders'];
12294     for (var i = 0; i < slices.length; i++) {
12295       var proxy = slices[i];
12296       var idx = bsearchForInsert(proxy.markers, newMarker, strcmp);
12297       proxy.sendSplice(idx, 0, [folderMeta], false, false);
12298       proxy.markers.splice(idx, 0, newMarker);
12299     }
12300   },
12301 
12302   notifyFolderModified: function(account, folderMeta) {
12303     var marker = makeFolderSortString(account, folderMeta);
12304 
12305     var slices = this._slicesByType['folders'];
12306     for (var i = 0; i < slices.length; i++) {
12307       var proxy = slices[i];
12308 
12309       var idx = bsearchMaybeExists(proxy.markers, marker, strcmp);
12310       if (idx === null)
12311         continue;
12312       proxy.sendUpdate([idx, folderMeta]);
12313     }
12314   },
12315 
12316   notifyFolderRemoved: function(account, folderMeta) {
12317     var marker = makeFolderSortString(account, folderMeta);
12318 
12319     var slices = this._slicesByType['folders'];
12320     for (var i = 0; i < slices.length; i++) {
12321       var proxy = slices[i];
12322 
12323       var idx = bsearchMaybeExists(proxy.markers, marker, strcmp);
12324       if (idx === null)
12325         continue;
12326       proxy.sendSplice(idx, 1, [], false, false);
12327       proxy.markers.splice(idx, 1);
12328     }
12329   },
12330 
12343   notifyBodyModified: function(suid, detail, body) {
12344     var handles = this._observedBodies[suid];
12345     var defaultHandler = this.__sendMessage;
12346 
12347     if (handles) {
12348       for (var handle in handles) {
12349         // the suid may have an existing handler which captures the output of
12350         // the notification instead of dispatching here... This allows us to
12351         // aggregate pending notifications while fetching the bodies so updates
12352         // never come before the actual body.
12353         var emit = handles[handle] || defaultHandler;
12354 
12355         emit.call(this, {
12356           type: 'bodyModified',
12357           handle: handle,
12358           bodyInfo: body,
12359           detail: detail
12360         });
12361       }
12362     }
12363   },
12364 
12365   _cmd_viewFolders: function mb__cmd_viewFolders(msg) {
12366     var proxy = this._slices[msg.handle] =
12367           new SliceBridgeProxy(this, 'folders', msg.handle);
12368     this._slicesByType['folders'].push(proxy);
12369     proxy.mode = msg.mode;
12370     proxy.argument = msg.argument;
12371     var markers = proxy.markers = [];
12372 
12373     var wireReps = [];
12374 
12375     function pushAccountFolders(acct) {
12376       for (var iFolder = 0; iFolder < acct.folders.length; iFolder++) {
12377         var folder = acct.folders[iFolder];
12378         var newMarker = makeFolderSortString(acct, folder);
12379         var idx = bsearchForInsert(markers, newMarker, strcmp);
12380         wireReps.splice(idx, 0, folder);
12381         markers.splice(idx, 0, newMarker);
12382       }
12383     }
12384 
12385     if (msg.mode === 'account') {
12386       pushAccountFolders(
12387         this.universe.getAccountForAccountId(msg.argument));
12388     }
12389     else {
12390       var accounts = this.universe.accounts.concat();
12391 
12392       // sort accounts by their id's
12393       accounts.sort(function (a, b) {
12394         return a.id.localeCompare(b.id);
12395       });
12396 
12397       for (var iAcct = 0; iAcct < accounts.length; iAcct++) {
12398         var acct = accounts[iAcct], acctBridgeRep = acct.toBridgeFolder(),
12399             acctMarker = makeFolderSortString(acct, acctBridgeRep),
12400             idxAcct = bsearchForInsert(markers, acctMarker, strcmp);
12401 
12402         wireReps.splice(idxAcct, 0, acctBridgeRep);
12403         markers.splice(idxAcct, 0, acctMarker);
12404         pushAccountFolders(acct);
12405       }
12406     }
12407     proxy.sendSplice(0, 0, wireReps, true, false);
12408   },
12409 
12410   _cmd_createFolder: function mb__cmd_createFolder(msg) {
12411     this.universe.createFolder(
12412       msg.accountId,
12413       msg.parentFolderId,
12414       msg.containOnlyOtherFolders);
12415   },
12416 
12417   _cmd_viewFolderMessages: function mb__cmd_viewFolderMessages(msg) {
12418     var proxy = this._slices[msg.handle] =
12419           new SliceBridgeProxy(this, 'headers', msg.handle);
12420     this._slicesByType['headers'].push(proxy);
12421 
12422     var account = this.universe.getAccountForFolderId(msg.folderId);
12423     account.sliceFolderMessages(msg.folderId, proxy);
12424   },
12425 
12426   _cmd_searchFolderMessages: function mb__cmd_searchFolderMessages(msg) {
12427     var proxy = this._slices[msg.handle] =
12428           new SliceBridgeProxy(this, 'matchedHeaders', msg.handle);
12429     this._slicesByType['matchedHeaders'].push(proxy);
12430     var account = this.universe.getAccountForFolderId(msg.folderId);
12431     account.searchFolderMessages(
12432       msg.folderId, proxy, msg.phrase, msg.whatToSearch);
12433   },
12434 
12435   _cmd_refreshHeaders: function mb__cmd_refreshHeaders(msg) {
12436     var proxy = this._slices[msg.handle];
12437     if (!proxy) {
12438       this._LOG.badSliceHandle(msg.handle);
12439       return;
12440     }
12441 
12442     if (proxy.__listener)
12443       proxy.__listener.refresh();
12444   },
12445 
12446   _cmd_growSlice: function mb__cmd_growSlice(msg) {
12447     var proxy = this._slices[msg.handle];
12448     if (!proxy) {
12449       this._LOG.badSliceHandle(msg.handle);
12450       return;
12451     }
12452 
12453     if (proxy.__listener)
12454       proxy.__listener.reqGrow(msg.dirMagnitude, msg.userRequestsGrowth);
12455   },
12456 
12457   _cmd_shrinkSlice: function mb__cmd_shrinkSlice(msg) {
12458     var proxy = this._slices[msg.handle];
12459     if (!proxy) {
12460       this._LOG.badSliceHandle(msg.handle);
12461       return;
12462     }
12463 
12464     if (proxy.__listener)
12465       proxy.__listener.reqNoteRanges(
12466         msg.firstIndex, msg.firstSuid, msg.lastIndex, msg.lastSuid);
12467   },
12468 
12469   _cmd_killSlice: function mb__cmd_killSlice(msg) {
12470     var proxy = this._slices[msg.handle];
12471     if (!proxy) {
12472       this._LOG.badSliceHandle(msg.handle);
12473       return;
12474     }
12475 
12476     delete this._slices[msg.handle];
12477     var proxies = this._slicesByType[proxy._ns],
12478         idx = proxies.indexOf(proxy);
12479     proxies.splice(idx, 1);
12480     proxy.die();
12481 
12482     this.__sendMessage({
12483       type: 'sliceDead',
12484       handle: msg.handle,
12485     });
12486   },
12487 
12488   _cmd_getBody: function mb__cmd_getBody(msg) {
12489     var self = this;
12490     // map the message id to the folder storage
12491     var folderStorage = this.universe.getFolderStorageForMessageSuid(msg.suid);
12492 
12493     // when requesting the body we also create a observer to notify the client
12494     // of events... We never want to send the updates before fetching the body
12495     // so we buffer them here with a temporary handler.
12496     var pendingUpdates = [];
12497 
12498     var catchPending = function catchPending(msg) {
12499       pendingUpdates.push(msg);
12500     };
12501 
12502     if (!this._observedBodies[msg.suid])
12503       this._observedBodies[msg.suid] = {};
12504 
12505     this._observedBodies[msg.suid][msg.handle] = catchPending;
12506 
12507     var handler = function(bodyInfo) {
12508       self.__sendMessage({
12509         type: 'gotBody',
12510         handle: msg.handle,
12511         bodyInfo: bodyInfo
12512       });
12513 
12514       // if all body reps where requested we verify that all are present
12515       // otherwise we begin the request for more body reps.
12516       if (
12517         msg.downloadBodyReps &&
12518         !folderStorage.messageBodyRepsDownloaded(bodyInfo)
12519       ) {
12520 
12521         self.universe.downloadMessageBodyReps(
12522           msg.suid,
12523           msg.date,
12524           function() { /* we don't care it will send update events */ }
12525         );
12526       }
12527 
12528       // dispatch pending updates...
12529       pendingUpdates.forEach(self.__sendMessage, self);
12530       pendingUpdates = null;
12531 
12532       // revert to default handler. Note! this is intentionally
12533       // set to null and not deleted if deleted the observer is removed.
12534       self._observedBodies[msg.suid][msg.handle] = null;
12535     };
12536 
12537     if (msg.withBodyReps)
12538       folderStorage.getMessageBodyWithReps(msg.suid, msg.date, handler);
12539     else
12540       folderStorage.getMessageBody(msg.suid, msg.date, handler);
12541   },
12542 
12543   _cmd_killBody: function(msg) {
12544     var handles = this._observedBodies[msg.id];
12545     if (handles) {
12546       delete handles[msg.handle];
12547 
12548       var purgeHandles = true;
12549       for (var key in handles) {
12550         purgeHandles = false;
12551         break;
12552       }
12553 
12554       if (purgeHandles) {
12555         delete this._observedBodies[msg.id];
12556       }
12557     }
12558 
12559     this.__sendMessage({
12560       type: 'bodyDead',
12561       handle: msg.handle
12562     });
12563   },
12564 
12565   _cmd_downloadAttachments: function mb__cmd__downloadAttachments(msg) {
12566     var self = this;
12567     this.universe.downloadMessageAttachments(
12568       msg.suid, msg.date, msg.relPartIndices, msg.attachmentIndices,
12569       function(err, bodyInfo) {
12570         self.__sendMessage({
12571           type: 'downloadedAttachments',
12572           handle: msg.handle,
12573           bodyInfo: err ? null : bodyInfo
12574         });
12575       });
12576   },
12577 
12579   // Message Mutation
12580   //
12581   // All mutations are told to the universe which breaks the modifications up on
12582   // a per-account basis.
12583 
12584   _cmd_modifyMessageTags: function mb__cmd_modifyMessageTags(msg) {
12585     // XXXYYY
12586 
12587     // - The mutations are written to the database for persistence (in case
12588     //   we fail to make the change in a timely fashion) and so that we can
12589     //   know enough to reverse the operation.
12590     // - Speculative changes are made to the headers in the database locally.
12591 
12592     var longtermIds = this.universe.modifyMessageTags(
12593       msg.opcode, msg.messages, msg.addTags, msg.removeTags);
12594     this.__sendMessage({
12595       type: 'mutationConfirmed',
12596       handle: msg.handle,
12597       longtermIds: longtermIds,
12598     });
12599   },
12600 
12601   _cmd_deleteMessages: function mb__cmd_deleteMessages(msg) {
12602     var longtermIds = this.universe.deleteMessages(
12603       msg.messages);
12604     this.__sendMessage({
12605       type: 'mutationConfirmed',
12606       handle: msg.handle,
12607       longtermIds: longtermIds,
12608     });
12609   },
12610 
12611   _cmd_moveMessages: function mb__cmd_moveMessages(msg) {
12612     var longtermIds = this.universe.moveMessages(
12613       msg.messages, msg.targetFolder);
12614     this.__sendMessage({
12615       type: 'mutationConfirmed',
12616       handle: msg.handle,
12617       longtermIds: longtermIds,
12618     });
12619   },
12620 
12621   _cmd_undo: function mb__cmd_undo(msg) {
12622     this.universe.undoMutation(msg.longtermIds);
12623   },
12624 
12626   // Composition
12627 
12628 
12629   _cmd_beginCompose: function mb__cmd_beginCompose(msg) {
12630     require(['./composer'], function ($composer) {
12631       var req = this._pendingRequests[msg.handle] = {
12632         type: 'compose',
12633         active: 'begin',
12634         persistedNamer: null,
12635         die: false
12636       };
12637 
12638       // - figure out the identity to use
12639       var account, identity, folderId;
12640       if (msg.mode === 'new' && msg.submode === 'folder')
12641         account = this.universe.getAccountForFolderId(msg.refSuid);
12642       else
12643         account = this.universe.getAccountForMessageSuid(msg.refSuid);
12644 
12645       identity = account.identities[0];
12646 
12647       // not doing something that needs a body just return an empty composer.
12648       if (msg.mode !== 'reply' && msg.mode !== 'forward') {
12649         return this.__sendMessage({
12650           type: 'composeBegun',
12651           handle: msg.handle,
12652           error: null,
12653           identity: identity,
12654           subject: '',
12655           body: { text: '', html: null },
12656           to: [],
12657           cc: [],
12658           bcc: [],
12659           references: null,
12660           attachments: [],
12661         });
12662       }
12663 
12664       var folderStorage =
12665         this.universe.getFolderStorageForMessageSuid(msg.refSuid);
12666 
12667       var self = this;
12668       folderStorage.getMessage(
12669         msg.refSuid, msg.refDate, { withBodyReps: true }, function(res) {
12670 
12671         if (!res) {
12672           // cannot compose a reply/fwd message without a header/body
12673           return console.warn(
12674             'Cannot compose message missing header/body: ',
12675             msg.suid
12676           );
12677         }
12678 
12679         var header = res.header;
12680         var bodyInfo = res.body;
12681 
12682         if (msg.mode === 'reply') {
12683           var rTo, rCc, rBcc;
12684           // clobber the sender's e-mail with the reply-to
12685           var effectiveAuthor = {
12686             name: msg.refAuthor.name,
12687             address: (header.replyTo && header.replyTo.address) ||
12688                      msg.refAuthor.address,
12689           };
12690           switch (msg.submode) {
12691             case 'list':
12692               // XXX we can't do this without headers we're not retrieving,
12693               // fall through for now.
12694             case null:
12695             case 'sender':
12696               rTo = [effectiveAuthor];
12697               rCc = rBcc = [];
12698               break;
12699             case 'all':
12700               // No need to change the lists if the author is already on the
12701               // reply lists.
12702               //
12703               // nb: Our logic here is fairly simple; Thunderbird's
12704               // nsMsgCompose.cpp does a lot of checking that we should
12705               // audit, although much of it could just be related to its
12706               // much more extensive identity support.
12707               if (checkIfAddressListContainsAddress(header.to,
12708                                                     effectiveAuthor) ||
12709                   checkIfAddressListContainsAddress(header.cc,
12710                                                     effectiveAuthor)) {
12711                 rTo = header.to;
12712               }
12713               // add the author as the first 'to' person
12714               else {
12715                 if (header.to && header.to.length)
12716                   rTo = [effectiveAuthor].concat(header.to);
12717                 else
12718                   rTo = [effectiveAuthor];
12719               }
12720               rCc = header.cc;
12721               rBcc = header.bcc;
12722               break;
12723           }
12724 
12725           var referencesStr;
12726           if (bodyInfo.references) {
12727             referencesStr = bodyInfo.references.concat([msg.refGuid])
12728                               .map(function(x) { return '<' + x + '>'; })
12729                               .join(' ');
12730           }
12731           else if (msg.refGuid) {
12732             referencesStr = '<' + msg.refGuid + '>';
12733           }
12734           // ActiveSync does not thread so good
12735           else {
12736             referencesStr = '';
12737           }
12738           req.active = null;
12739           self.__sendMessage({
12740             type: 'composeBegun',
12741             handle: msg.handle,
12742             error: null,
12743             identity: identity,
12744             subject: $composer.mailchew
12745                        .generateReplySubject(msg.refSubject),
12746             // blank lines at the top are baked in
12747             body: $composer.mailchew.generateReplyBody(
12748                     bodyInfo.bodyReps, effectiveAuthor, msg.refDate,
12749                     identity, msg.refGuid),
12750             to: rTo,
12751             cc: rCc,
12752             bcc: rBcc,
12753             referencesStr: referencesStr,
12754             attachments: [],
12755           });
12756         }
12757         else {
12758           req.active = null;
12759           self.__sendMessage({
12760             type: 'composeBegun',
12761             handle: msg.handle,
12762             error: null,
12763             identity: identity,
12764             subject: $composer.mailchew
12765                        .generateForwardSubject(msg.refSubject),
12766             // blank lines at the top are baked in by the func
12767             body: $composer.mailchew.generateForwardMessage(
12768                     msg.refAuthor, msg.refDate, msg.refSubject,
12769                     header, bodyInfo, identity),
12770             // forwards have no assumed envelope information
12771             to: [],
12772             cc: [],
12773             bcc: [],
12774             // XXX imitate Thunderbird current or previous behaviour; I
12775             // think we ended up linking forwards into the conversation
12776             // they came from, but with an extra header so that it was
12777             // possible to detect it was a forward.
12778             references: null,
12779             attachments: [],
12780           });
12781         }
12782       });
12783     }.bind(this));
12784   },
12785 
12786   _cmd_resumeCompose: function mb__cmd_resumeCompose(msg) {
12787     var req = this._pendingRequests[msg.handle] = {
12788       type: 'compose',
12789       active: 'resume',
12790       persistedNamer: msg.messageNamer,
12791       die: false
12792     };
12793 
12794     // NB: We are not acquiring the folder mutex here because
12795     var account = this.universe.getAccountForMessageSuid(msg.messageNamer.suid);
12796     var folderStorage = this.universe.getFolderStorageForMessageSuid(
12797                           msg.messageNamer.suid);
12798     var self = this;
12799     folderStorage.runMutexed('resumeCompose', function(callWhenDone) {
12800       function fail() {
12801         self.__sendMessage({
12802           type: 'composeBegun',
12803           handle: msg.handle,
12804           error: 'no-message'
12805         });
12806         callWhenDone();
12807       }
12808       folderStorage.getMessage(msg.messageNamer.suid, msg.messageNamer.date,
12809                                function(res) {
12810         try {
12811           if (!res.header || !res.body) {
12812             fail();
12813             return;
12814           }
12815           var header = res.header, body = res.body;
12816 
12817           // -- convert from header/body rep to compose rep
12818 
12819           var composeBody = {
12820             text: '',
12821             html: null,
12822           };
12823 
12824           // Body structure should be guaranteed, but add some checks.
12825           if (body.bodyReps.length >= 1 &&
12826               body.bodyReps[0].type === 'plain' &&
12827               body.bodyReps[0].content.length === 2 &&
12828               body.bodyReps[0].content[0] === 0x1) {
12829             composeBody.text = body.bodyReps[0].content[1];
12830           }
12831           // HTML is optional, but if present, should satisfy our guard
12832           if (body.bodyReps.length == 2 &&
12833               body.bodyReps[1].type === 'html') {
12834             composeBody.html = body.bodyReps[1].content;
12835           }
12836 
12837           var attachments = [];
12838           body.attachments.forEach(function(att) {
12839             attachments.push({
12840               name: att.name,
12841               blob: att.file
12842             });
12843           });
12844 
12845           req.active = null;
12846           self.__sendMessage({
12847             type: 'composeBegun',
12848             handle: msg.handle,
12849             error: null,
12850             identity: account.identities[0],
12851             subject: header.subject,
12852             body: composeBody,
12853             to: header.to,
12854             cc: header.cc,
12855             bcc: header.bcc,
12856             referencesStr: body.references,
12857             attachments: attachments
12858           });
12859           callWhenDone();
12860         }
12861         catch (ex) {
12862           fail(); // calls callWhenDone
12863         }
12864       });
12865     });
12866   },
12867 
12868   _cmd_doneCompose: function mb__cmd_doneCompose(msg) {
12869     require(['./composer'], function ($composer) {
12870       var req = this._pendingRequests[msg.handle], self = this;
12871       if (!req)
12872         return;
12873       if (msg.command === 'die') {
12874         if (req.active)
12875           req.die = true;
12876         else
12877           delete this._pendingRequests[msg.handle];
12878         return;
12879       }
12880       var account;
12881       if (msg.command === 'delete') {
12882         function sendDeleted() {
12883           self.__sendMessage({
12884             type: 'doneCompose',
12885             handle: msg.handle,
12886             err: null,
12887             badAddresses: null,
12888             messageId: null,
12889             sentDate: null
12890           });
12891         }
12892         if (req.persistedNamer) {
12893           account = this.universe.getAccountForMessageSuid(
12894                       req.persistedNamer.suid);
12895           this.universe.deleteDraft(account, req.persistedNamer, sendDeleted);
