12896         }
12897         else {
12898           sendDeleted();
12899         }
12900         delete this._pendingRequests[msg.handle];
12901         // XXX if we have persistedFolder/persistedUID, enqueue a delete of that
12902         // message and try and execute it.
12903         return;
12904       }
12905 
12906 
12907       var wireRep = msg.state,
12908           identity = this.universe.getIdentityForSenderIdentityId(
12909                        wireRep.senderId);
12910       account = this.universe.getAccountForSenderIdentityId(wireRep.senderId);
12911 
12912       if (msg.command === 'send') {
12913         var composer = new $composer.Composer(msg.command, wireRep,
12914                                               account, identity);
12915 
12916         req.active = null;
12917         if (req.die)
12918           delete this._pendingRequests[msg.handle];
12919         account.sendMessage(composer, function(err, badAddresses) {
12920           // If there was an associated/saved draft, clear it out, but there's
12921           // no need to wait for that to complete.
12922           if (req.persistedNamer)
12923             this.universe.deleteDraft(account, req.persistedNamer);
12924           this.__sendMessage({
12925             type: 'doneCompose',
12926             handle: msg.handle,
12927             err: err,
12928             badAddresses: badAddresses,
12929             messageId: composer.messageId,
12930             sentDate: composer.sentDate.valueOf(),
12931           });
12932         }.bind(this));
12933       }
12934       else if (msg.command === 'save') {
12935         // -- convert from compose rep to header/body rep
12936         var msgTimestamp = Date.now();
12937         var header = {
12938           id: null, // filled in by the job
12939           srvid: null, // stays null
12940           suid: null, // filled in by the job
12941           guid: null, // unused
12942           author: { name: identity.name, address: identity.address},
12943           to: wireRep.to,
12944           cc: wireRep.cc,
12945           bcc: wireRep.bcc,
12946           replyTo: null,
12947           date: msgTimestamp,
12948           flags: [],
12949           hasAttachments: !!wireRep.attachments.length,
12950           subject: wireRep.subject,
12951           snippet: wireRep.body.text.substring(0, 100),
12952         };
12953         var body = {
12954           date: msgTimestamp,
12955           size: 0,
12956           attachments: [],
12957           relatedParts: [],
12958           references: wireRep.referencesStr,
12959           bodyReps: []
12960         };
12961         wireRep.attachments.forEach(function(wireAtt) {
12962           body.attachments.push({
12963             name: wireAtt.name,
12964             contentId: null,
12965             type: wireAtt.blob.type,
12966             part: null,
12967             encoding: null,
12968             sizeEstimate: wireAtt.blob.size,
12969             file: wireAtt.blob
12970           });
12971         });
12972         body.bodyReps.push({
12973           type: 'plain',
12974           part: null,
12975           sizeEstimate: wireRep.body.text.length,
12976           amountDownloaded: wireRep.body.text.length,
12977           isDownloaded: true,
12978           _partInfo: {},
12979           content: [0x1, wireRep.body.text]
12980         });
12981         if (wireRep.body.html) {
12982           body.bodyReps.push({
12983             type: 'html',
12984             part: null,
12985             sizeEstimate: wireRep.body.html.length,
12986             amountDownloaded: wireRep.body.html.length,
12987             isDownloaded: true,
12988             _partInfo: {},
12989             content: wireRep.body.html
12990           });
12991         }
12992 
12993         this.universe.saveDraft(
12994           account, req.persistedNamer, header, body,
12995           function(err, messageNamer) {
12996             req.active = null;
12997             req.persistedNamer = messageNamer;
12998             if (req.die)
12999               delete self._pendingRequests[msg.handle];
13000             self.__sendMessage({
13001               type: 'doneCompose',
13002               handle: msg.handle,
13003               err: null,
13004               badAddresses: null,
13005               messageId: null,
13006               sentDate: null,
13007             });
13008           });
13009       }
13010     }.bind(this));
13011   },
13012 
13013   notifyCronSyncStart: function mb_notifyCronSyncStart(accountIds) {
13014     this.__sendMessage({
13015       type: 'cronSyncStart',
13016       accountIds: accountIds
13017     });
13018   },
13019 
13020   notifyCronSyncStop: function mb_notifyCronSyncStop(accountsResults) {
13021     this.__sendMessage({
13022       type: 'cronSyncStop',
13023       accountsResults: accountsResults
13024     });
13025   }
13026 
13028 };
13029 
13030 var LOGFAB = exports.LOGFAB = $log.register($module, {
13031   MailBridge: {
13032     type: $log.DAEMON,
13033     events: {
13034       // NB: under unit test, this is not used and bridgeSnoop is used instead.
13035       send: { type: true },
13036     },
13037     TEST_ONLY_events: {
13038       send: { msg: false },
13039     },
13040     errors: {
13041       badMessageType: { type: true },
13042       badSliceHandle: { handle: true },
13043     },
13044     calls: {
13045       cmd: { command: true },
13046     },
13047     TEST_ONLY_calls: {
13048     },
13049   },
13050 });
13051 
13052 }); // end define
13053 ;

13103 define('rdcommon/logreaper',
13104   [
13105     './log',
13106     'microtime',
13107     'exports'
13108   ],
13109   function(
13110     $log,
13111     $microtime,
13112     exports
13113   ) {
13114 
13115 var EMPTY = [];
13116 
13117 function LogReaper(rootLogger) {
13118   this._rootLogger = rootLogger;
13119   this._lastTimestamp = null;
13120   this._lastSeq = null;
13121 }
13122 exports.LogReaper = LogReaper;
13123 LogReaper.prototype = {
13140   reapHierLogTimeSlice: function() {
13141     var rootLogger = this._rootLogger,
13142         startSeq, startTimestamp;
13143     if (this._lastTimestamp === null) {
13144       startSeq = 0;
13145       startTimestamp = rootLogger._born;
13146     }
13147     else {
13148       startSeq = this._lastSeq + 1;
13149       startTimestamp = this._lastTimestamp;
13150     }
13151     var endSeq = $log.getCurrentSeq(),
13152         endTimestamp = this._lastTimestamp = $microtime.now();
13153 
13154     function traverseLogger(logger) {
13155       var empty = true;
13156       // speculatively start populating an output representation
13157       var outrep = logger.toJSON();
13158       outrep.events = null;
13159       outrep.kids = null;
13160 
13161       // - check born/death
13162       // actually, being born doesn't generate an event, so ignore.
13163       //if (logger._born >= startTimestamp)
13164       //  empty = false;
13165       if (logger._died !== null)
13166         empty = false;
13167 
13168       // - check events
13169       var outEvents = null;
13170       for (var eventKey in logger._eventMap) {
13171         var eventVal = logger._eventMap[eventKey];
13172         if (eventVal) {
13173           empty = false;
13174           if (outEvents === null)
13175             outrep.events = outEvents = {};
13176           outEvents[eventKey] = eventVal;
13177           logger._eventMap[eventKey] = 0;
13178         }
13179       }
13180 
13181       // - check and reap entries
13182       if (outrep.entries.length) {
13183         empty = false;
13184         // (we keep/use outrep.entries, and zero the logger's entries)
13185         logger._entries = [];
13186       }
13187       else {
13188         // Avoid subsequent mutation of the list mutating our representation
13189         //  and without creating gratuitous garbage by using a shared empty
13190         //  list for such cases.
13191         outrep.entries = EMPTY;
13192       }
13193 
13194       // - check and reap children
13195       if (logger._kids && logger._kids.length) {
13196         for (var iKid = 0; iKid < logger._kids.length; iKid++) {
13197           var kidLogger = logger._kids[iKid];
13198           var kidrep = traverseLogger(kidLogger);
13199           if (kidrep) {
13200             if (!outrep.kids)
13201               outrep.kids = [];
13202             outrep.kids.push(kidrep);
13203             empty = false;
13204           }
13205           // reap (and adjust iteration)
13206           if (kidLogger._died !== null)
13207             logger._kids.splice(iKid--, 1);
13208         }
13209       }
13210 
13211       return (empty ? null : outrep);
13212     }
13213 
13214     return {
13215       begin: startTimestamp,
13216       end: endTimestamp,
13217       logFrag: traverseLogger(rootLogger),
13218     };
13219   },
13220 };
13221 
13222 }); // end define
13223 ;
13228 define('mailapi/maildb',
13229   [
13230     './worker-router',
13231     'exports'
13232   ],
13233   function(
13234     $router,
13235     exports
13236   ) {
13237 'use strict';
13238 
13239 var sendMessage = $router.registerCallbackType('maildb');
13240 
13241 function MailDB(testOptions) {
13242   this._callbacksQueue = [];
13243   function processQueue() {
13244     console.log('main thread reports DB ready');
13245     this._ready = true;
13246 
13247     this._callbacksQueue.forEach(function executeCallback(cb) {
13248       cb();
13249     });
13250     this._callbacksQueue = null;
13251   }
13252 
13253   sendMessage('open', [testOptions], processQueue.bind(this));
13254 }
13255 exports.MailDB = MailDB;
13256 MailDB.prototype = {
13257   close: function() {
13258     sendMessage('close');
13259   },
13260 
13261   getConfig: function(callback) {
13262     if (!this._ready) {
13263       console.log('deferring getConfig call until ready');
13264       this._callbacksQueue.push(this.getConfig.bind(this, callback));
13265       return;
13266     }
13267 
13268     console.log('issuing getConfig call to main thread');
13269     sendMessage('getConfig', null, callback);
13270   },
13271 
13272   saveConfig: function(config) {
13273     sendMessage('saveConfig', [config]);
13274   },
13275 
13276   saveAccountDef: function(config, accountDef, folderInfo) {
13277     sendMessage('saveAccountDef', [ config, accountDef, folderInfo ]);
13278   },
13279 
13280   loadHeaderBlock: function(folderId, blockId, callback) {
13281     sendMessage('loadHeaderBlock', [ folderId, blockId], callback);
13282   },
13283 
13284   loadBodyBlock: function(folderId, blockId, callback) {
13285     sendMessage('loadBodyBlock', [ folderId, blockId], callback);
13286   },
13287 
13288   saveAccountFolderStates: function(accountId, folderInfo, perFolderStuff,
13289                                     deletedFolderIds, callback, reuseTrans) {
13290     var args = [ accountId, folderInfo, perFolderStuff, deletedFolderIds ];
13291     sendMessage('saveAccountFolderStates', args, callback);
13292     // XXX vn Does this deserve any purpose?
13293     return null;
13294   },
13295 
13296   deleteAccount: function(accountId) {
13297     sendMessage('deleteAccount', [accountId]);
13298   },
13299 };
13300 
13301 }); // end define
13302 ;
13303 /*global define, console, setTimeout */
13326 define('mailapi/cronsync',
13327   [
13328     'rdcommon/log',
13329     './worker-router',
13330     './slice_bridge_proxy',
13331     './mailslice',
13332     'prim',
13333     'module',
13334     'exports'
13335   ],
13336   function(
13337     $log,
13338     $router,
13339     $sliceBridgeProxy,
13340     $mailslice,
13341     $prim,
13342     $module,
13343     exports
13344   ) {
13345 
13346 
13350 var MINIMUM_SYNC_INTERVAL_MS = 60 * 1000;
13351 
13356 var MAX_SYNC_DURATION_MS = 3 * 60 * 1000;
13357 
13362 var MAX_MESSAGES_TO_REPORT_PER_ACCOUNT = 5;
13363 
13367 var MAX_SNIPPET_BYTES = 4 * 1024;
13368 
13369 function debug(str) {
13370   console.log("cronsync: " + str + "\n");
13371 }
13372 
13373 var SliceBridgeProxy = $sliceBridgeProxy.SliceBridgeProxy;
13374 
13375 function makeSlice(storage, callback, parentLog) {
13376   var proxy = new SliceBridgeProxy({
13377         __sendMessage: function() {}
13378       }, 'cron'),
13379       slice = new $mailslice.MailSlice(proxy, storage, parentLog),
13380       oldStatus = proxy.sendStatus,
13381       newHeaders = [];
13382 
13383   slice.onNewHeader = function(header) {
13384     console.log('onNewHeader: ' + header);
13385     newHeaders.push(header);
13386   };
13387 
13388   proxy.sendStatus = function(status, requested, moreExpected,
13389                               progress, newEmailCount) {
13390     oldStatus.apply(this, arguments);
13391     if (requested && !moreExpected && callback) {
13392       callback(newHeaders);
13393       slice.die();
13394     }
13395   };
13396 
13397   return slice;
13398 }
13399 
13404 function CronSync(universe, _logParent) {
13405   this._universe = universe;
13406   this._universeDeferred = $prim();
13407   this._isUniverseReady = false;
13408 
13409   this._LOG = LOGFAB.CronSync(this, null, _logParent);
13410 
13411   this._activeSlices = [];
13412 
13413   this._completedEnsureSync = true;
13414   this._syncAccountsDone = true;
13415 
13416   this._synced = [];
13417 
13418   this.sendCronSync = $router.registerSimple('cronsync', function(data) {
13419     var args = data.args;
13420     switch (data.cmd) {
13421       case 'alarm':
13422         debug('received an alarm via a message handler');
13423         this.onAlarm.apply(this, args);
13424         break;
13425       case 'syncEnsured':
13426         debug('received an syncEnsured via a message handler');
13427         this.onSyncEnsured.apply(this, args);
13428         break;
13429     }
13430   }.bind(this));
13431   this.sendCronSync('hello');
13432 }
13433 
13434 exports.CronSync = CronSync;
13435 CronSync.prototype = {
13436   _killSlices: function() {
13437     this._activeSlices.forEach(function(slice) {
13438       slice.die();
13439     });
13440   },
13441 
13442   onUniverseReady: function() {
13443     this._universeDeferred.resolve();
13444 
13445     this.ensureSync();
13446   },
13447 
13448   whenUniverse: function(fn) {
13449     this._universeDeferred.promise.then(fn);
13450   },
13451 
13455   ensureSync: function() {
13456     // Only execute ensureSync if it is not already in progress.
13457     // Otherwise, due to async timing of mozAlarm setting, could
13458     // end up with two alarms for the same ID.
13459     if (!this._completedEnsureSync)
13460       return;
13461 
13462     this._completedEnsureSync = false;
13463 
13464     debug('ensureSync called');
13465 
13466     this.whenUniverse(function() {
13467       var accounts = this._universe.accounts,
13468           syncData = {};
13469 
13470       accounts.forEach(function(account) {
13471         // Store data by interval, use a more obvious string
13472         // key instead of just stringifying a number, which
13473         // could be confused with an array construct.
13474         var interval = account.accountDef.syncInterval,
13475             intervalKey = 'interval' + interval;
13476 
13477         if (!syncData.hasOwnProperty(intervalKey)) {
13478           syncData[intervalKey] = [];
13479         }
13480         syncData[intervalKey].push(account.id);
13481       });
13482 
13483       this.sendCronSync('ensureSync', [syncData]);
13484     }.bind(this));
13485   },
13486 
13501   syncAccount: function(account, doneCallback) {
13502     // - Skip syncing if we are offline or the account is disabled
13503     if (!this._universe.online || !account.enabled) {
13504       debug('syncAcount early exit: online: ' +
13505             this._universe.online + ', enabled: ' + account.enabled);
13506       doneCallback();
13507       return;
13508     }
13509 
13510     var done = function(result) {
13511       // Wait for any in-process job operations to complete, so
13512       // that the app is not killed in the middle of a sync.
13513       this._universe.waitForAccountOps(account, function() {
13514         // Also wait for any account save to finish. Most
13515         // likely failure will be new message headers not
13516         // getting saved if the callback is not fired
13517         // until after account saves.
13518         account.runAfterSaves(function() {
13519           doneCallback(result);
13520         });
13521       });
13522     }.bind(this);
13523 
13524     var inboxFolder = account.getFirstFolderWithType('inbox');
13525     var storage = account.getFolderStorageForFolderId(inboxFolder.id);
13526 
13527     // XXX check when the folder was most recently synchronized and skip this
13528     // sync if it is sufficiently recent.
13529 
13530     // - Initiate a sync of the folder covering the desired time range.
13531     this._LOG.syncAccount_begin(account.id);
13532 
13533     var slice = makeSlice(storage, function(newHeaders) {
13534       this._LOG.syncAccount_end(account.id);
13535       this._activeSlices.splice(this._activeSlices.indexOf(slice), 1);
13536 
13537       // Reduce headers to the minimum number and data set needed for
13538       // notifications.
13539       var notifyHeaders = [];
13540       newHeaders.some(function(header, i) {
13541         notifyHeaders.push({
13542           date: header.date,
13543           from: header.author.name || header.author.address,
13544           subject: header.subject,
13545           accountId: account.id,
13546           messageSuid: header.suid
13547         });
13548 
13549         if (i === MAX_MESSAGES_TO_REPORT_PER_ACCOUNT - 1)
13550           return true;
13551       });
13552 
13553       if (newHeaders.length) {
13554         debug('Asking for snippets for ' + notifyHeaders.length + ' headers');
13555         if (this._universe.online){
13556           this._universe.downloadBodies(
13557             newHeaders.slice(0, MAX_MESSAGES_TO_REPORT_PER_ACCOUNT), {
13558               maximumBytesToFetch: MAX_SNIPPET_BYTES
13559             }, function() {
13560               debug('Notifying for ' + newHeaders.length + ' headers');
13561               done([newHeaders.length, notifyHeaders]);
13562           }.bind(this));
13563         } else {
13564           debug('UNIVERSE OFFLINE. Notifying for ' + newHeaders.length +
13565                 ' headers');
13566           done([newHeaders.length, notifyHeaders]);
13567         }
13568       } else {
13569         done();
13570       }
13571     }.bind(this), this._LOG);
13572 
13573     this._activeSlices.push(slice);
13574     // Pass true to force contacting the server.
13575     storage.sliceOpenMostRecent(slice, true);
13576   },
13577 
13578   onAlarm: function(accountIds) {
13579     this.whenUniverse(function() {
13580       this._LOG.alarmFired();
13581 
13582       if (!accountIds)
13583         return;
13584 
13585       var accounts = this._universe.accounts,
13586           targetAccounts = [],
13587           ids = [];
13588 
13589       this._universe.__notifyStartedCronSync(accountIds);
13590 
13591       // Make sure the acount IDs are still valid. This is to protect agains
13592       // an account deletion that did not clean up any alarms correctly.
13593       accountIds.forEach(function(id) {
13594         accounts.some(function(account) {
13595           if (account.id === id) {
13596             targetAccounts.push(account);
13597             ids.push(id);
13598             return true;
13599           }
13600         });
13601       });
13602 
13603       // Flip switch to say account syncing is in progress.
13604       this._syncAccountsDone = false;
13605 
13606       // Make sure next alarm is set up. In the case of a cold start
13607       // background sync, this is a bit redundant in that the startup
13608       // of the mailuniverse would trigger this work. However, if the
13609       // app is already running, need to be sure next alarm is set up,
13610       // so ensure the next sync is set up here. Do it here instead of
13611       // after a sync in case an error in sync would prevent the next
13612       // sync from getting scheduled.
13613       this.ensureSync();
13614 
13615       var syncMax = targetAccounts.length,
13616           syncCount = 0,
13617           accountsResults = {
13618             accountIds: accountIds
13619           };
13620 
13621       var done = function() {
13622         syncCount += 1;
13623         if (syncCount < syncMax)
13624           return;
13625 
13626         // Kill off any slices that still exist from the last sync.
13627         this._killSlices();
13628 
13629         // Wrap up the sync
13630         this._syncAccountsDone = true;
13631         this._onSyncDone = function() {
13632           if (this._synced.length) {
13633             accountsResults.updates = this._synced;
13634             this._synced = [];
13635           }
13636 
13637           this._universe.__notifyStoppedCronSync(accountsResults);
13638         }.bind(this);
13639 
13640         this._checkSyncDone();
13641       }.bind(this);
13642 
13643       // Nothing new to sync, probably old accounts. Just return and indicate
13644       // that syncing is done.
13645       if (!ids.length) {
13646         return done();
13647       }
13648 
13649       targetAccounts.forEach(function(account) {
13650         this.syncAccount(account, function (result) {
13651           if (result) {
13652             this._synced.push({
13653               id: account.id,
13654               address: account.identities[0].address,
13655               count: result[0],
13656               latestMessageInfos: result[1]
13657             });
13658           }
13659           done();
13660         }.bind(this));
13661       }.bind(this));
13662     }.bind(this));
13663   },
13664 
13670   _checkSyncDone: function() {
13671     if (!this._completedEnsureSync || !this._syncAccountsDone)
13672       return;
13673 
13674     if (this._onSyncDone) {
13675       this._onSyncDone();
13676       this._onSyncDone = null;
13677     }
13678   },
13679 
13687   onSyncEnsured: function() {
13688     this._completedEnsureSync = true;
13689     this._checkSyncDone();
13690   },
13691 
13692   shutdown: function() {
13693     $router.unregister('cronsync');
13694     this._killSlices();
13695   }
13696 };
13697 
13698 var LOGFAB = exports.LOGFAB = $log.register($module, {
13699   CronSync: {
13700     type: $log.DAEMON,
13701     events: {
13702       alarmFired: {},
13703     },
13704     TEST_ONLY_events: {
13705     },
13706     asyncJobs: {
13707       syncAccount: { id: false },
13708     },
13709     errors: {
13710     },
13711     calls: {
13712     },
13713     TEST_ONLY_calls: {
13714     },
13715   },
13716 });
13717 
13718 }); // end define
13719 ;
13724 define('mailapi/accountcommon',
13725   [
13726     'rdcommon/log',
13727     './a64',
13728     'require',
13729     'module',
13730     'exports'
13731   ],
13732   function(
13733     $log,
13734     $a64,
13735     require,
13736     $module,
13737     exports
13738   ) {
13739 
13740 // The number of milliseconds to wait for various (non-ActiveSync) XHRs to
13741 // complete during the autoconfiguration process. This value is intentionally
13742 // fairly large so that we don't abort an XHR just because the network is
13743 // spotty.
13744 var AUTOCONFIG_TIMEOUT_MS = 30 * 1000;
13745 
13746 var Configurators = {
13747   'imap+smtp': './composite/configurator',
13748   'activesync': './activesync/configurator'
13749 };
13750 
13751 function accountTypeToClass(type, callback) {
13752   var configuratorId = Configurators[type] || null;
13753 
13754   if (typeof configuratorId === 'string') {
13755     //A dynamically loaded account.
13756     require([configuratorId], function(mod) {
13757       callback(mod.account.Account);
13758     });
13759   } else {
13760     // Preserve next turn semantics that happen with
13761     // the require call.
13762     setTimeout(function () {
13763       callback(null);
13764     }, 4);
13765   }
13766 }
13767 exports.accountTypeToClass = accountTypeToClass;
13768 
13769 // Simple hard-coded autoconfiguration by domain...
13770 var autoconfigByDomain = exports._autoconfigByDomain = {
13771   'localhost': {
13772     type: 'imap+smtp',
13773     incoming: {
13774       hostname: 'localhost',
13775       port: 143,
13776       socketType: 'plain',
13777       username: '%EMAILLOCALPART%',
13778     },
13779     outgoing: {
13780       hostname: 'localhost',
13781       port: 25,
13782       socketType: 'plain',
13783       username: '%EMAILLOCALPART%',
13784     },
13785   },
13786   'fakeimaphost': {
13787     type: 'imap+smtp',
13788     incoming: {
13789       hostname: 'localhost',
13790       port: 0,
13791       socketType: 'plain',
13792       username: '%EMAILLOCALPART%',
13793     },
13794     outgoing: {
13795       hostname: 'localhost',
13796       port: 0,
13797       socketType: 'plain',
13798       username: '%EMAILLOCALPART%',
13799     },
13800   },
13801   'slocalhost': {
13802     type: 'imap+smtp',
13803     incoming: {
13804       hostname: 'localhost',
13805       port: 993,
13806       socketType: 'SSL',
13807       username: '%EMAILLOCALPART%',
13808     },
13809     outgoing: {
13810       hostname: 'localhost',
13811       port: 465,
13812       socketType: 'SSL',
13813       username: '%EMAILLOCALPART%',
13814     },
13815   },
13816   'fakeashost': {
13817     type: 'activesync',
13818     displayName: 'Test',
13819     incoming: {
13820       // This string will be clobbered with the correct port number when running
13821       // as a unit test.
13822       server: 'http://localhost:8880',
13823       username: '%EMAILADDRESS%',
13824     },
13825   },
13826   // like slocalhost, really just exists to generate a test failure
13827   'saslocalhost': {
13828     type: 'activesync',
13829     displayName: 'Test',
13830     incoming: {
13831       server: 'https://localhost:443',
13832       username: '%EMAILADDRESS%',
13833     },
13834   },
13835   // Mapping for a nonexistent domain for testing a bad domain without it being
13836   // detected ahead of time by the autoconfiguration logic or otherwise.
13837   'nonesuch.nonesuch': {
13838     type: 'imap+smtp',
13839     imapHost: 'nonesuch.nonesuch',
13840     imapPort: 993,
13841     imapCrypto: true,
13842     smtpHost: 'nonesuch.nonesuch',
13843     smtpPort: 465,
13844     smtpCrypto: true,
13845     usernameIsFullEmail: false,
13846   },
13847 };
13848 
13857 function recreateIdentities(universe, accountId, oldIdentities) {
13858   var identities = [];
13859   for (var iter in Iterator(oldIdentities)) {
13860     var oldIdentity = iter[1];
13861     identities.push({
13862       id: accountId + '/' + $a64.encodeInt(universe.config.nextIdentityNum++),
13863       name: oldIdentity.name,
13864       address: oldIdentity.address,
13865       replyTo: oldIdentity.replyTo,
13866       signature: oldIdentity.signature,
13867     });
13868   }
13869   return identities;
13870 }
13871 exports.recreateIdentities = recreateIdentities;
13872 
13932 function Autoconfigurator(_LOG) {
13933   this._LOG = _LOG;
13934   this.timeout = AUTOCONFIG_TIMEOUT_MS;
13935 }
13936 exports.Autoconfigurator = Autoconfigurator;
13937 Autoconfigurator.prototype = {
13952   _fatalErrors: ['bad-user-or-pass', 'not-authorized'],
13953 
13961   _isSuccessOrFatal: function(error) {
13962     return !error || this._fatalErrors.indexOf(error) !== -1;
13963   },
13964 
13965   // XXX: Go through these functions and make sure the callbacks provide
13966   // sufficiently useful error strings.
13967 
13976   _getXmlConfig: function getXmlConfig(url, callback) {
13977     var xhr = new XMLHttpRequest({mozSystem: true});
13978     xhr.open('GET', url, true);
13979     xhr.timeout = this.timeout;
13980 
13981     xhr.onload = function() {
13982       if (xhr.status < 200 || xhr.status >= 300) {
13983         // Non-fatal failure to get the config info.  While a 404 is the
13984         // expected case, this is the appropriate error for weirder cases too.
13985         callback('no-config-info', null, { status: xhr.status });
13986         return;
13987       }
13988       // XXX: For reasons which are currently unclear (possibly a platform
13989       // issue), trying to use responseXML results in a SecurityError when
13990       // running XPath queries. So let's just do an end-run around the
13991       // "security".
13992       self.postMessage({
13993         uid: 0,
13994         type: 'configparser',
13995         cmd: 'accountcommon',
13996         args: [xhr.responseText]
13997       });
13998 
13999       self.addEventListener('message', function onworkerresponse(evt) {
14000         var data = evt.data;
14001         if (data.type != 'configparser' || data.cmd != 'accountcommon') {
14002           return;
14003         }
14004         self.removeEventListener(evt.type, onworkerresponse);
14005         var args = data.args;
14006         var config = args[0], status = args[1];
14007         callback(config ? null : 'no-config-info', config,
14008                  config ? null : { status: status });
14009       });
14010     };
14011 
14012     xhr.ontimeout = xhr.onerror = function() {
14013       // The effective result is a failure to get configuration info, but make
14014       // sure the status conveys that a timeout occurred.
14015       callback('no-config-info', null, { status: 'timeout' });
14016     };
14017     xhr.onerror = function() {
14018       // The effective result is a failure to get configuration info, but make
14019       // sure the status conveys that a timeout occurred.
14020       callback('no-config-info', null, { status: 'error' });
14021     };
14022 
14023     // Gecko currently throws in send() if the file we're opening doesn't exist.
14024     // This is almost certainly wrong, but let's just work around it for now.
14025     try {
14026       xhr.send();
14027     }
14028     catch(e) {
14029       callback('no-config-info', null, { status: 404 });
14030     }
14031   },
14032 
14040   _getConfigFromLocalFile: function getConfigFromLocalFile(domain, callback) {
14041     this._getXmlConfig('/autoconfig/' + encodeURIComponent(domain), callback);
14042   },
14043 
14052   _getConfigFromAutodiscover: function getConfigFromAutodiscover(userDetails,
14053                                                                  callback) {
14054 
14055     var self = this;
14056     require(['activesync/protocol'], function (protocol) {
14057       protocol.autodiscover(userDetails.emailAddress, userDetails.password,
14058                             self.timeout, function(error, config) {
14059         if (error) {
14060           var failureType = 'no-config-info',
14061               failureDetails = {};
14062 
14063           if (error instanceof protocol.HttpError) {
14064             if (error.status === 401)
14065               failureType = 'bad-user-or-pass';
14066             else if (error.status === 403)
14067               failureType = 'not-authorized';
14068             else
14069               failureDetails.status = error.status;
14070           }
14071           callback(failureType, null, failureDetails);
14072           return;
14073         }
14074 
14075         var autoconfig = {
14076           type: 'activesync',
14077           displayName: config.user.name,
14078           incoming: {
14079             server: config.mobileSyncServer.url,
14080             username: config.user.email
14081           },
14082         };
14083         callback(null, autoconfig, null);
14084       });
14085     });
14086   },
14087 
14098   _getConfigFromDomain: function getConfigFromDomain(userDetails, domain,
14099                                                      callback) {
14100     var suffix = '/mail/config-v1.1.xml?emailaddress=' +
14101                  encodeURIComponent(userDetails.emailAddress);
14102     var url = 'http://autoconfig.' + domain + suffix;
14103     var self = this;
14104 
14105     this._getXmlConfig(url, function(error, config, errorDetails) {
14106       if (self._isSuccessOrFatal(error)) {
14107         callback(error, config, errorDetails);
14108         return;
14109       }
14110 
14111       // See <http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-nottingham-site-meta-04>.
14112       var url = 'http://' + domain + '/.well-known/autoconfig' + suffix;
14113       self._getXmlConfig(url, callback);
14114     });
14115   },
14116 
14124   _getConfigFromDB: function getConfigFromDB(domain, callback) {
14125     this._getXmlConfig('https://live.mozillamessaging.com/autoconfig/v1.1/' +
14126                        encodeURIComponent(domain), callback);
14127   },
14128 
14137   _getMX: function getMX(domain, callback) {
14138     var xhr = new XMLHttpRequest({mozSystem: true});
14139     xhr.open('GET', 'https://live.mozillamessaging.com/dns/mx/' +
14140              encodeURIComponent(domain), true);
14141     xhr.timeout = this.timeout;
14142 
14143     xhr.onload = function() {
14144       if (xhr.status === 200)
14145         callback(null, xhr.responseText.split('\n')[0], null);
14146       else
14147         callback('no-config-info', null, { status: 'mx' + xhr.status });
14148     };
14149 
14150     xhr.ontimeout = function() {
14151       callback('no-config-info', null, { status: 'mxtimeout' });
14152     };
14153     xhr.onerror = function() {
14154       callback('no-config-info', null, { status: 'mxerror' });
14155     };
14156 
14157     xhr.send();
14158   },
14159 
14168   _getConfigFromMX: function getConfigFromMX(domain, callback) {
14169     var self = this;
14170     this._getMX(domain, function(error, mxDomain, errorDetails) {
14171       if (error)
14172         return callback(error, null, errorDetails);
14173 
14174       // XXX: We need to normalize the domain here to get the base domain, but
14175       // that's complicated because people like putting dots in TLDs. For now,
14176       // let's just pretend no one would do such a horrible thing.
14177       mxDomain = mxDomain.split('.').slice(-2).join('.').toLowerCase();
14178       console.log('  Found MX for', mxDomain);
14179 
14180       if (domain === mxDomain)
14181         return callback('no-config-info', null, { status: 'mxsame' });
14182 
14183       // If we found a different domain after MX lookup, we should look in our
14184       // local file store (mostly to support Google Apps domains) and, if that
14185       // doesn't work, the Mozilla ISPDB.
14186       console.log('  Looking in local file store');
14187       self._getConfigFromLocalFile(mxDomain, function(error, config,
14188                                                       errorDetails) {
14189         // (Local XML lookup should not have any fatal errors)
14190         if (!error) {
14191           callback(error, config, errorDetails);
14192           return;
14193         }
14194 
14195         console.log('  Looking in the Mozilla ISPDB');
14196         self._getConfigFromDB(mxDomain, callback);
14197       });
14198     });
14199   },
14200 
14210   getConfig: function getConfig(userDetails, callback) {
14211     var details = userDetails.emailAddress.split('@');
14212     var emailLocalPart = details[0], emailDomainPart = details[1];
14213     var domain = emailDomainPart.toLowerCase();
14214     console.log('Attempting to get autoconfiguration for', domain);
14215 
14216     var placeholderFields = {
14217       incoming: ['username', 'hostname', 'server'],
14218       outgoing: ['username', 'hostname'],
14219     };
14220 
14221     function fillPlaceholder(value) {
14222       return value.replace('%EMAILADDRESS%', userDetails.emailAddress)
14223                   .replace('%EMAILLOCALPART%', emailLocalPart)
14224                   .replace('%EMAILDOMAIN%', emailDomainPart)
14225                   .replace('%REALNAME%', userDetails.displayName);
14226     }
14227 
14228     // Saved autodiscover errors that we report in the event we come to the
14229     // end of the process and we failed to create an account.
14230     var autodiscoverError = null, autodiscoverErrorDetails = null;
14231 
14232     function onComplete(error, config, errorDetails) {
14233       console.log(error ? 'FAILURE' : 'SUCCESS');
14234 
14235       // Fill any placeholder strings in the configuration object we retrieved.
14236       if (config) {
14237         for (var iter in Iterator(placeholderFields)) {
14238           var serverType = iter[0], fields = iter[1];
14239           if (!config.hasOwnProperty(serverType))
14240             continue;
14241 
14242           var server = config[serverType];
14243           for (var iter2 in Iterator(fields)) {
14244             var field = iter2[1];
14245             if (server.hasOwnProperty(field))
14246               server[field] = fillPlaceholder(server[field]);
14247           }
14248         }
14249       }
14250 
14251       // If we had a saved autodiscover error, report that instead of whatever
14252       // happened in the subsequent ISPDB stages.
14253       if (error && autodiscoverError) {
14254         error = autodiscoverError;
14255         errorDetails = autodiscoverErrorDetails;
14256       }
14257 
14258       callback(error, config, errorDetails);
14259     }
14260 
14261     console.log('  Looking in GELAM');
14262     if (autoconfigByDomain.hasOwnProperty(domain)) {
14263       onComplete(null, autoconfigByDomain[domain]);
14264       return;
14265     }
14266 
14267     var self = this;
14268     console.log('  Looking in local file store');
14269     this._getConfigFromLocalFile(domain, function(error, config, errorDetails) {
14270       if (self._isSuccessOrFatal(error)) {
14271         onComplete(error, config, errorDetails);
14272         return;
14273       }
14274 
14275       console.log('  Looking at domain (Thunderbird autoconfig standard)');
14276       self._getConfigFromDomain(userDetails, domain, function(error, config,
14277                                                               errorDetails) {
14278         if (self._isSuccessOrFatal(error)) {
14279           onComplete(error, config, errorDetails);
14280           return;
14281         }
14282 
14283         console.log('  Trying ActiveSync domain autodiscover');
14284         self._getConfigFromAutodiscover(userDetails, function(error, config,
14285                                                               errorDetails) {
14286           // We treat ActiveSync autodiscover failures specially because of the
14287           // odd situation documented on
14288           // https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=921529 where
14289           // t-mobile.de has ActiveSync and IMAP servers, but the ActiveSync
14290           // server use costs extra and the autodiscover process was stopping us
14291           // before we'd try IMAP.
14292 
14293           // So, if there was no error, go directly to success.
14294           if (!error) {
14295             onComplete(error, config, errorDetails);
14296             return;
14297           }
14298           // Otherwise, save off the error if it was 'not-authorized' and
14299           // continue the autoconfig process.  We will clobber *whatever* error
14300           // is reported with these errors if we fail to create the account.
14301           // The rationale/discussion is at:
14302           // https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=921529#c3
14303           if (error === 'not-authorized') {
14304             autodiscoverError = error;
14305             autodiscoverErrorDetails = errorDetails;
14306           }
14307           else if (self._isSuccessOrFatal(error)) {
14308             onComplete(error, config, errorDetails);
14309             return;
14310           }
14311 
14312           console.log('  Looking in the Mozilla ISPDB');
14313           self._getConfigFromDB(domain, function(error, config, errorDetails) {
14314             if (self._isSuccessOrFatal(error)) {
14315               onComplete(error, config, errorDetails);
14316               return;
14317             }
14318 
14319             console.log('  Looking up MX');
14320             self._getConfigFromMX(domain, onComplete);
14321           });
14322         });
14323       });
14324     });
14325   },
14326 
14338   tryToCreateAccount: function(universe, userDetails, callback) {
14339     var self = this;
14340     this.getConfig(userDetails, function(error, config, errorDetails) {
14341       if (error)
14342         return callback(error, null, errorDetails);
14343 
14344       require([Configurators[config.type]], function (mod) {
14345         mod.configurator.tryToCreateAccount(universe, userDetails, config,
14346                                       callback, self._LOG);
14347       });
14348     });
14349   },
14350 };
14351 
14361 function recreateAccount(universe, oldVersion, accountInfo, callback) {
14362   require([Configurators[accountInfo.def.type]], function (mod) {
14363     mod.configurator.recreateAccount(universe, oldVersion,
14364                                      accountInfo, callback);
14365   });
14366 }
14367 exports.recreateAccount = recreateAccount;
14368 
14369 function tryToManuallyCreateAccount(universe, userDetails, domainInfo, callback,
14370                                     _LOG) {
14371   require([Configurators[domainInfo.type]], function (mod) {
14372     mod.configurator.tryToCreateAccount(universe, userDetails, domainInfo,
14373                                         callback, _LOG);
14374   });
14375 }
14376 exports.tryToManuallyCreateAccount = tryToManuallyCreateAccount;
14377 
14378 }); // end define
14379 ;
14383 /*global define, console, window, Blob */
14384 
14385 define('mailapi/mailuniverse',
14386   [
14387     'rdcommon/log',
14388     'rdcommon/logreaper',
14389     './a64',
14390     './syncbase',
14391     './worker-router',
14392     './maildb',
14393     './cronsync',
14394     './accountcommon',
14395     'module',
14396     'exports'
14397   ],
14398   function(
14399     $log,
14400     $logreaper,
14401     $a64,
14402     $syncbase,
14403     $router,
14404     $maildb,
14405     $cronsync,
14406     $acctcommon,
14407     $module,
14408     exports
14409   ) {
14410 
14420 var MAX_MUTATIONS_FOR_UNDO = 10;
14421 
14426 var MAX_LOG_BACKLOG = 30;
14427 
14436 function makeBridgeFn(bridgeMethod) {
14437   return function(a1, a2, a3) {
14438     for (var iBridge = 0; iBridge < this._bridges.length; iBridge++) {
14439       var bridge = this._bridges[iBridge];
14440       bridge[bridgeMethod](a1, a2, a3);
14441     }
14442   };
14443 }
14444 
14674 function MailUniverse(callAfterBigBang, online, testOptions) {
14676   this.accounts = [];
14677   this._accountsById = {};
14678 
14680   this.identities = [];
14681   this._identitiesById = {};
14682 
14711   this._opsByAccount = {};
14712   // populated by waitForAccountOps, invoked when all ops complete
14713   this._opCompletionListenersByAccount = {};
14714   // maps longtermId to a callback that cares. non-persisted.
14715   this._opCallbacks = {};
14716 
14717   this._bridges = [];
14718 
14719   this._testModeDisablingLocalOps = false;
14721   this._testModeFakeNavigator = (testOptions && testOptions.fakeNavigator) ||
14722                                 null;
14723 
14724   // We used to try and use navigator.connection, but it's not supported on B2G,
14725   // so we have to use navigator.onLine like suckers.
14726   this.online = true; // just so we don't cause an offline->online transition
14727   // Events for online/offline are now pushed into us externally.  They need
14728   // to be bridged from the main thread anyways, so no point faking the event
14729   // listener.
14730   this._onConnectionChange(online);
14731 
14732   // Track the mode of the universe. Values are:
14733   // 'cron': started up in background to do tasks like sync.
14734   // 'interactive': at some point during its life, it was used to
14735   // provide functionality to a user interface. Once it goes
14736   // 'interactive', it cannot switch back to 'cron'.
14737   this._mode = 'cron';
14738 
14743   this._deferredOpTimeout = null;
14744   this._boundQueueDeferredOps = this._queueDeferredOps.bind(this);
14745 
14746   this.config = null;
14747   this._logReaper = null;
14748   this._logBacklog = null;
14749 
14750   this._LOG = null;
14751   this._db = new $maildb.MailDB(testOptions);
14752   this._cronSync = new $cronsync.CronSync(this);
14753   var self = this;
14754   this._db.getConfig(function(configObj, accountInfos, lazyCarryover) {
14755     function setupLogging(config) {
14756       if (self.config.debugLogging) {
14757         if (self.config.debugLogging !== 'dangerous') {
14758           console.warn('GENERAL LOGGING ENABLED!');
14759           console.warn('(CIRCULAR EVENT LOGGING WITH NON-SENSITIVE DATA)');
14760           $log.enableGeneralLogging();
14761         }
14762         else {
14763           console.warn('!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!');
14764           console.warn('DANGEROUS USER-DATA ENTRAINING LOGGING ENABLED !!!');
14765           console.warn('!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!');
14766           console.warn('This means contents of e-mails and passwords if you');
14767           console.warn('set up a new account.  (The IMAP protocol sanitizes');
14768           console.warn('passwords, but the bridge logger may not.)');
14769           console.warn('...................................................');
14770           $log.DEBUG_markAllFabsUnderTest();
14771         }
14772       }
14773     }
14774 
14775     var accountInfo, i;
14776     var doneCount = 0;
14777     var accountCount = accountInfos.length;
14778     if (configObj) {
14779       self.config = configObj;
14780       setupLogging();
14781       self._LOG = LOGFAB.MailUniverse(self, null, null);
14782       if (self.config.debugLogging)
14783         self._enableCircularLogging();
14784 
14785       self._LOG.configLoaded(self.config, accountInfos);
14786 
14787       function done() {
14788         doneCount += 1;
14789         if (doneCount === accountCount) {
14790           self._initFromConfig();
14791           callAfterBigBang();
14792         }
14793       }
14794 
14795       if (accountCount) {
14796         for (i = 0; i < accountCount; i++) {
14797           accountInfo = accountInfos[i];
14798           self._loadAccount(accountInfo.def, accountInfo.folderInfo,
14799                             null, done);
14800         }
14801 
14802         // return since _loadAccount needs to finish before completing
14803         // the flow in done().
14804         return;
14805       }
14806     }
14807     else {
14808       self.config = {
14809         // We need to put the id in here because our startup query can't
14810         // efficiently get both the key name and the value, just the values.
14811         id: 'config',
14812         nextAccountNum: 0,
14813         nextIdentityNum: 0,
14814         debugLogging: lazyCarryover ? lazyCarryover.config.debugLogging : false
14815       };
14816       setupLogging();
14817       self._LOG = LOGFAB.MailUniverse(self, null, null);
14818       if (self.config.debugLogging)
14819         self._enableCircularLogging();
14820       self._db.saveConfig(self.config);
14821 
14822       // - Try to re-create any accounts using old account infos.
14823       if (lazyCarryover) {
14824         self._LOG.configMigrating(lazyCarryover);
14825         var waitingCount = lazyCarryover.accountInfos.length;
14826         var oldVersion = lazyCarryover.oldVersion;
14827         for (i = 0; i < lazyCarryover.accountInfos.length; i++) {
14828           var accountInfo = lazyCarryover.accountInfos[i];
14829           $acctcommon.recreateAccount(self, oldVersion, accountInfo,
14830                                       function() {
14831             // We don't care how they turn out, just that they get a chance
14832             // to run to completion before we call our bootstrap complete.
14833             if (--waitingCount === 0) {
14834               self._initFromConfig();
14835               callAfterBigBang();
14836             }
14837           });
14838         }
14839         // Do not let callAfterBigBang get called.
14840         return;
14841       }
14842       else {
14843         self._LOG.configCreated(self.config);
14844       }
14845     }
14846     self._initFromConfig();
14847     callAfterBigBang();
14848   });
14849 }
14850 exports.MailUniverse = MailUniverse;
14851 MailUniverse.prototype = {
14853   // Logging
14854   _enableCircularLogging: function() {
14855     this._logReaper = new $logreaper.LogReaper(this._LOG);
14856     this._logBacklog = [];
14857     window.setInterval(
14858       function() {
14859         var logTimeSlice = this._logReaper.reapHierLogTimeSlice();
14860         // if nothing interesting happened, this could be empty, yos.
14861         if (logTimeSlice.logFrag) {
14862           this._logBacklog.push(logTimeSlice);
14863           // throw something away if we've got too much stuff already
14864           if (this._logBacklog.length > MAX_LOG_BACKLOG)
14865             this._logBacklog.shift();
14866         }
14867       }.bind(this),
14868       1000);
14869   },
14870 
14871   createLogBacklogRep: function(id) {
14872     return {
14873       type: 'backlog',
14874       id: id,
14875       schema: $log.provideSchemaForAllKnownFabs(),
14876       backlog: this._logBacklog,
14877     };
14878   },
14879 
14880   dumpLogToDeviceStorage: function() {
14881     // This reuses the existing registration if one exists.
14882     var sendMessage = $router.registerCallbackType('devicestorage');
14883     try {
14884       var blob = new Blob([JSON.stringify(this.createLogBacklogRep())],
14885                           {
14886                             type: 'application/json',
14887                             endings: 'transparent'
14888                           });
14889       var filename = 'gem-log-' + Date.now() + '.json';
14890       sendMessage('save', ['sdcard', blob, filename], function(success, err, savedFile) {
14891         if (success)
14892           console.log('saved log to "sdcard" devicestorage:', savedFile);
14893         else
14894           console.error('failed to save log to', filename);
14895 
14896       });
14897     }
14898     catch(ex) {
14899       console.error('Problem dumping log to device storage:', ex,
14900                     '\n', ex.stack);
14901     }
14902   },
14903 
14905   // Config / Settings
14906 
14910   _initFromConfig: function() {
14911     this._cronSync.onUniverseReady();
14912   },
14913 
14917   exposeConfigForClient: function() {
14918     // eventually, iterate over a whitelist, but for now, it's easy...
14919     return {
14920       debugLogging: this.config.debugLogging
14921     };
14922   },
14923 
14924   modifyConfig: function(changes) {
14925     for (var key in changes) {
14926       var val = changes[key];
14927       switch (key) {
14928         case 'debugLogging':
14929           break;
14930         default:
14931           continue;
14932       }
14933       this.config[key] = val;
14934     }
14935     this._db.saveConfig(this.config);
14936     this.__notifyConfig();
14937   },
14938 
14939   __notifyConfig: function() {
14940     var config = this.exposeConfigForClient();
14941     for (var iBridge = 0; iBridge < this._bridges.length; iBridge++) {
14942       var bridge = this._bridges[iBridge];
14943       bridge.notifyConfig(config);
14944     }
14945   },
14946 
14947   setInteractive: function() {
14948     this._mode = 'interactive';
14949   },
14950 
14952   _onConnectionChange: function(isOnline) {
14953     var wasOnline = this.online;
14959     this.online = this._testModeFakeNavigator ?
14960                     this._testModeFakeNavigator.onLine : isOnline;
14961     // Knowing when the app thinks it is online/offline is going to be very
14962     // useful for our console.log debug spew.
14963     console.log('Email knows that it is:', this.online ? 'online' : 'offline',
14964                 'and previously was:', wasOnline ? 'online' : 'offline');
14974     this.minimizeNetworkUsage = true;
14984     this.networkCostsMoney = true;
14985 
14986     if (!wasOnline && this.online) {
14987       // - check if we have any pending actions to run and run them if so.
14988       for (var iAcct = 0; iAcct < this.accounts.length; iAcct++) {
14989         this._resumeOpProcessingForAccount(this.accounts[iAcct]);
14990       }
14991     }
14992   },
14993 
14998   _dispatchLocalOpForAccount: function(account, op) {
14999     var queues = this._opsByAccount[account.id];
15000     queues.active = true;
15001 
15002     var mode;
15003     switch (op.lifecycle) {
15004       case 'do':
15005         mode = 'local_do';
15006         op.localStatus = 'doing';
15007         break;
15008       case 'undo':
15009         mode = 'local_undo';
15010         op.localStatus = 'undoing';
15011         break;
15012       default:
15013         throw new Error('Illegal lifecycle state for local op');
15014     }
15015 
15016     account.runOp(
15017       op, mode,
15018       this._localOpCompleted.bind(this, account, op));
15019   },
15020 
15025   _dispatchServerOpForAccount: function(account, op) {
15026     var queues = this._opsByAccount[account.id];
15027     queues.active = true;
15028 
15029     var mode = op.lifecycle;
15030     if (op.serverStatus === 'check')
15031       mode = 'check';
15032     op.serverStatus = mode + 'ing';
15033 
15034     account.runOp(
15035       op, mode,
15036       this._serverOpCompleted.bind(this, account, op));
15037   },
15038 
15042   _resumeOpProcessingForAccount: function(account) {
15043     var queues = this._opsByAccount[account.id];
15044     if (!account.enabled)
15045       return;
15046     // Nothing to do if there's a local op running
15047     if (!queues.local.length &&
15048         queues.server.length &&
15049         // (it's possible there is still an active job right now)
15050         (queues.server[0].serverStatus !== 'doing' &&
15051          queues.server[0].serverStatus !== 'undoing')) {
15052       var op = queues.server[0];
15053       this._dispatchServerOpForAccount(account, op);
15054     }
15055   },
15056 
15057   registerBridge: function(mailBridge) {
15058     this._bridges.push(mailBridge);
15059   },
15060 
15061   unregisterBridge: function(mailBridge) {
15062     var idx = this._bridges.indexOf(mailBridge);
15063     if (idx !== -1)
15064       this._bridges.splice(idx, 1);
15065   },
15066 
15067   tryToCreateAccount: function mu_tryToCreateAccount(userDetails, domainInfo,
15068                                                      callback) {
15069     if (!this.online) {
15070       callback('offline');
15071       return;
15072     }
15073     if (!userDetails.forceCreate) {
15074       for (var i = 0; i < this.accounts.length; i++) {
15075         if (userDetails.emailAddress ===
15076             this.accounts[i].identities[0].address) {
15077           callback('user-account-exists');
15078           return;
15079         }
15080       }
15081     }
15082 
15083     if (domainInfo) {
15084       $acctcommon.tryToManuallyCreateAccount(this, userDetails, domainInfo,
15085                                              callback, this._LOG);
15086     }
15087     else {
15088       // XXX: store configurator on this object so we can abort the connections
15089       // if necessary.
15090       var configurator = new $acctcommon.Autoconfigurator(this._LOG);
15091       configurator.tryToCreateAccount(this, userDetails, callback);
15092     }
15093   },
15094 
15098   deleteAccount: function(accountId) {
15099     var savedEx = null;
15100     var account = this._accountsById[accountId];
15101     try {
15102       account.accountDeleted();
15103     }
15104     catch (ex) {
15105       // save the failure until after we have done other cleanup.
15106       savedEx = ex;
15107     }
15108     this._db.deleteAccount(accountId);
15109 
15110     delete this._accountsById[accountId];
15111     var idx = this.accounts.indexOf(account);
15112     this.accounts.splice(idx, 1);
15113 
15114     for (var i = 0; i < account.identities.length; i++) {
15115       var identity = account.identities[i];
15116       idx = this.identities.indexOf(identity);
15117       this.identities.splice(idx, 1);
15118       delete this._identitiesById[identity.id];
15119     }
15120 
15121     delete this._opsByAccount[accountId];
15122     delete this._opCompletionListenersByAccount[accountId];
15123 
15124     this.__notifyRemovedAccount(accountId);
15125 
15126     if (savedEx)
15127       throw savedEx;
15128   },
15129 
15130   saveAccountDef: function(accountDef, folderInfo) {
15131     this._db.saveAccountDef(this.config, accountDef, folderInfo);
15132     var account = this.getAccountForAccountId(accountDef.id);
15133 
15134     // Make sure syncs are still accurate, since syncInterval
15135     // could have changed.
15136     this._cronSync.ensureSync();
15137 
15138     // If account exists, notify of modification. However on first
15139     // save, the account does not exist yet.
15140     if (account)
15141       this.__notifyModifiedAccount(account);
15142   },
15143 
15148   _loadAccount: function mu__loadAccount(accountDef, folderInfo,
15149                                          receiveProtoConn, callback) {
15150     $acctcommon.accountTypeToClass(accountDef.type, function (constructor) {
15151       if (!constructor) {
15152         this._LOG.badAccountType(accountDef.type);
15153         return;
15154       }
15155       var account = new constructor(this, accountDef, folderInfo, this._db,
15156                                     receiveProtoConn, this._LOG);
15157 
15158       this.accounts.push(account);
15159       this._accountsById[account.id] = account;
15160       this._opsByAccount[account.id] = {
15161         active: false,
15162         local: [],
15163         server: [],
15164         deferred: []
15165       };
15166       this._opCompletionListenersByAccount[account.id] = null;
15167 
15168       for (var iIdent = 0; iIdent < accountDef.identities.length; iIdent++) {
15169         var identity = accountDef.identities[iIdent];
15170         this.identities.push(identity);
15171         this._identitiesById[identity.id] = identity;
15172       }
15173 
15174       this.__notifyAddedAccount(account);
15175 
15176       // - issue a (non-persisted) syncFolderList if needed
15177       var timeSinceLastFolderSync = Date.now() - account.meta.lastFolderSyncAt;
15178       if (timeSinceLastFolderSync >= $syncbase.SYNC_FOLDER_LIST_EVERY_MS)
15179         this.syncFolderList(account);
15180 
15181       // - check for mutations that still need to be processed
15182       // This will take care of deferred mutations too because they are still
15183       // maintained in this list.
15184       for (var i = 0; i < account.mutations.length; i++) {
15185         var op = account.mutations[i];
15186         if (op.lifecycle !== 'done' && op.lifecycle !== 'undone' &&
15187             op.lifecycle !== 'moot') {
15188           // For localStatus, we currently expect it to be consistent with the
15189           // state of the folder's database.  We expect this to be true going
15190           // forward and as we make changes because when we save the account's
15191           // operation status, we should also be saving the folder changes at the
15192           // same time.
15193           //
15194           // The same cannot be said for serverStatus, so we need to check.  See
15195           // comments about operations elsewhere (currently in imap/jobs.js).
15196           op.serverStatus = 'check';
15197           this._queueAccountOp(account, op);
15198         }
15199       }
15200       callback(account);
15201     }.bind(this));
15202   },
15203 
15211   __reportAccountProblem: function(account, problem) {
15212     // nothing to do if the problem is already known
15213     if (account.problems.indexOf(problem) !== -1)
15214       return;
15215     account.problems.push(problem);
15216     account.enabled = false;
15217 
15218     this.__notifyModifiedAccount(account);
15219 
15220     switch (problem) {
15221       case 'bad-user-or-pass':
15222       case 'imap-disabled':
15223       case 'needs-app-pass':
15224         this.__notifyBadLogin(account, problem);
15225         break;
15226     }
15227   },
15228 
15229   __removeAccountProblem: function(account, problem) {
15230     var idx = account.problems.indexOf(problem);
15231     if (idx === -1)
15232       return;
15233     account.problems.splice(idx, 1);
15234     account.enabled = (account.problems.length === 0);
15235 
15236     this.__notifyModifiedAccount(account);
15237 
15238     if (account.enabled)
15239       this._resumeOpProcessingForAccount(account);
15240   },
15241 
15242   clearAccountProblems: function(account) {
15243     // TODO: this would be a great time to have any slices that had stalled
15244     // syncs do whatever it takes to make them happen again.
15245     account.enabled = true;
15246     account.problems = [];
15247     this._resumeOpProcessingForAccount(account);
15248   },
15249 
15250   // expects (account, problem)
15251   __notifyBadLogin: makeBridgeFn('notifyBadLogin'),
15252 
15253   // expects (account)
15254   __notifyAddedAccount: makeBridgeFn('notifyAccountAdded'),
15255 
15256   // expects (account)
15257   __notifyModifiedAccount: makeBridgeFn('notifyAccountModified'),
15258 
15259   // expects (accountId)
15260   __notifyRemovedAccount: makeBridgeFn('notifyAccountRemoved'),
15261 
15262   // expects (account, folderMeta)
15263   __notifyAddedFolder: makeBridgeFn('notifyFolderAdded'),
15264 
15265   // expects (account, folderMeta)
15266   __notifyModifiedFolder: makeBridgeFn('notifyFolderModified'),
15267 
15268   // expects (account, folderMeta)
15269   __notifyRemovedFolder: makeBridgeFn('notifyFolderRemoved'),
15270 
15271   // expects (suid, detail, body)
15272   __notifyModifiedBody: makeBridgeFn('notifyBodyModified'),
15273 
15274 
15276   // cronsync Stuff
15277 
15278   // expects (accountIds)
15279   __notifyStartedCronSync: makeBridgeFn('notifyCronSyncStart'),
15280 
15281   // expects (accountsResults)
15282   __notifyStoppedCronSync: makeBridgeFn('notifyCronSyncStop'),
15283 
15285   // Lifetime Stuff
15286 
15290   saveUniverseState: function() {
15291     var curTrans = null;
15292 
15293     for (var iAcct = 0; iAcct < this.accounts.length; iAcct++) {
15294       var account = this.accounts[iAcct];
15295       curTrans = account.saveAccountState(curTrans, null, 'saveUniverse');
15296     }
15297   },
15298 
15310   shutdown: function(callback) {
15311     var waitCount = this.accounts.length;
15312     // (only used if a 'callback' is passed)
15313     function accountShutdownCompleted() {
15314       if (--waitCount === 0)
15315         callback();
15316     }
15317     for (var iAcct = 0; iAcct < this.accounts.length; iAcct++) {
15318       var account = this.accounts[iAcct];
15319       // only need to pass our handler if clean shutdown is desired
15320       account.shutdown(callback ? accountShutdownCompleted : null);
15321     }
15322 
15323     this._cronSync.shutdown();
15324     this._db.close();
15325     if (this._LOG)
15326       this._LOG.__die();
15327 
15328     if (!this.accounts.length)
15329       callback();
15330   },
15331 
15333   // Lookups: Account, Folder, Identity
15334 
15335   getAccountForAccountId: function mu_getAccountForAccountId(accountId) {
15336     return this._accountsById[accountId];
15337   },
15338 
15342   getAccountForFolderId: function mu_getAccountForFolderId(folderId) {
15343     var accountId = folderId.substring(0, folderId.indexOf('/')),
15344         account = this._accountsById[accountId];
15345     return account;
15346   },
15347 
15351   getAccountForMessageSuid: function mu_getAccountForMessageSuid(messageSuid) {
15352     var accountId = messageSuid.substring(0, messageSuid.indexOf('/')),
15353         account = this._accountsById[accountId];
15354     return account;
15355   },
15356 
15357   getFolderStorageForFolderId: function mu_getFolderStorageForFolderId(
15358                                  folderId) {
15359     var account = this.getAccountForFolderId(folderId);
15360     return account.getFolderStorageForFolderId(folderId);
15361   },
15362 
15363   getFolderStorageForMessageSuid: function mu_getFolderStorageForFolderId(
15364                                     messageSuid) {
15365     var folderId = messageSuid.substring(0, messageSuid.lastIndexOf('/')),
15366         account = this.getAccountForFolderId(folderId);
15367     return account.getFolderStorageForFolderId(folderId);
15368   },
15369 
15370   getAccountForSenderIdentityId: function mu_getAccountForSenderIdentityId(
15371                                    identityId) {
15372     var accountId = identityId.substring(0, identityId.indexOf('/')),
15373         account = this._accountsById[accountId];
15374     return account;
15375   },
15376 
15377   getIdentityForSenderIdentityId: function mu_getIdentityForSenderIdentityId(
15378                                     identityId) {
15379     return this._identitiesById[identityId];
15380   },
15381 
15383   // Message Mutation and Undoing
15384 
15391   _partitionMessagesByAccount: function(messageNamers, targetAccountId) {
15392     var results = [], acctToMsgs = {};
15393 
15394     for (var i = 0; i < messageNamers.length; i++) {
15395       var messageNamer = messageNamers[i],
15396           messageSuid = messageNamer.suid,
15397           accountId = messageSuid.substring(0, messageSuid.indexOf('/'));
15398       if (!acctToMsgs.hasOwnProperty(accountId)) {
15399         var messages = [messageNamer];
15400         results.push({
15401           account: this._accountsById[accountId],
15402           messages: messages,
15403           crossAccount: (targetAccountId && targetAccountId !== accountId),
15404         });
15405         acctToMsgs[accountId] = messages;
15406       }
15407       else {
15408         acctToMsgs[accountId].push(messageNamer);
15409       }
15410     }
15411 
15412     return results;
15413   },
15414 
15420   _deferOp: function(account, op) {
15421     this._opsByAccount[account.id].deferred.push(op.longtermId);
15422     if (this._deferredOpTimeout !== null)
15423       this._deferredOpTimeout = window.setTimeout(
15424         this._boundQueueDeferredOps, $syncbase.DEFERRED_OP_DELAY_MS);
15425   },
15426 
15433   _queueDeferredOps: function() {
15434     this._deferredOpTimeout = null;
15435 
15436     // If not in 'interactive' mode, then this is just a short
15437     // 'cron' existence that needs to shut down soon. Wait one
15438     // more cycle in case the app switches over to 'interactive'
15439     // in the meantime.
15440     if (this._mode !== 'interactive') {
15441       console.log('delaying deferred op since mode is ' + this._mode);
15442       this._deferredOpTimeout = window.setTimeout(
15443         this._boundQueueDeferredOps, $syncbase.DEFERRED_OP_DELAY_MS);
15444       return;
15445     }
15446 
15447     for (var iAccount = 0; iAccount < this.accounts.length; iAccount++) {
15448       var account = this.accounts[iAccount],
15449           queues = this._opsByAccount[account.id];
15450       // we need to mutate in-place, so concat is not an option
15451       while (queues.deferred.length) {
15452         var op = queues.deferred.shift();
15453         // There is no need to enqueue the operation if:
15454         // - It's already enqueued because someone called undo
15455         // - Undo got called and that ran to completion
15456         if (queues.server.indexOf(op) === -1 &&
15457             op.lifecycle !== 'undo')
15458           this._queueAccountOp(account, op);
15459       }
15460     }
15461   },
15462 
15463   _localOpCompleted: function(account, op, err, resultIfAny,
15464                               accountSaveSuggested) {
15465     var queues = this._opsByAccount[account.id],
15466         serverQueue = queues.server,
15467         localQueue = queues.local;
15468     queues.active = false;
15469 
15470     var removeFromServerQueue = false,
15471         completeOp = false;
15472     if (err) {
15473       switch (err) {
15474         // Only defer is currently supported as a recoverable local failure
15475         // type.
15476         case 'defer':
15477           if (++op.tryCount < $syncbase.MAX_OP_TRY_COUNT) {
15478             this._LOG.opDeferred(op.type, op.longtermId);
15479             this._deferOp(account, op);
15480             removeFromServerQueue = true;
15481             break;
15482           }
15483           // fall-through to an error
15484         default:
15485           this._LOG.opGaveUp(op.type, op.longtermId);
15486           op.lifecycle = 'moot';
15487           op.localStatus = 'unknown';
15488           op.serverStatus = 'moot';
15489           removeFromServerQueue = true;
15490           completeOp = true;
15491           break;
15492       }
15493     }
15494     else {
15495       switch (op.localStatus) {
15496         case 'doing':
15497           op.localStatus = 'done';
15498           if (op.serverStatus === 'n/a') {
15499             op.lifecycle = 'done';
15500             completeOp = true;
15501           }
15502           break;
15503         case 'undoing':
15504           op.localStatus = 'undone';
15505           if (op.serverStatus === 'n/a') {
15506             op.lifecycle = 'undone';
15507             completeOp = true;
15508           }
15509           break;
15510       }
15511 
15512       // This is a suggestion; in the event of high-throughput on operations,
15513       // we probably don't want to save the account every tick, etc.
15514       if (accountSaveSuggested)
15515         account.saveAccountState(null, null, 'localOp');
15516     }
15517 
15518     if (removeFromServerQueue) {
15519       var idx = serverQueue.indexOf(op);
15520       if (idx !== -1)
15521         serverQueue.splice(idx, 1);
15522     }
15523     localQueue.shift();
15524 
15525     if (completeOp) {
15526       if (this._opCallbacks.hasOwnProperty(op.longtermId)) {
15527         var callback = this._opCallbacks[op.longtermId];
15528         delete this._opCallbacks[op.longtermId];
15529         try {
15530           callback(err, resultIfAny, account, op);
15531         }
15532         catch(ex) {
15533           console.log(ex.message, ex.stack);
15534           this._LOG.opCallbackErr(op.type);
15535         }
15536       }
15537     }
15538 
15539     if (localQueue.length) {
15540       op = localQueue[0];
15541       this._dispatchLocalOpForAccount(account, op);
15542     }
15543     else if (serverQueue.length && this.online && account.enabled) {
15544       op = serverQueue[0];
15545       this._dispatchServerOpForAccount(account, op);
15546     }
15547   },
15548 
15605   _serverOpCompleted: function(account, op, err, resultIfAny,
15606                                accountSaveSuggested) {
15607     var queues = this._opsByAccount[account.id],
15608         serverQueue = queues.server,
15609         localQueue = queues.local;
15610     queues.active = false;
15611 
15612     if (serverQueue[0] !== op)
15613       this._LOG.opInvariantFailure();
15614 
15615     // Should we attempt to retry (but fail if tryCount is reached)?
15616     var maybeRetry = false;
15617     // Pop the event off the queue? (avoid bugs versus multiple calls)
15618     var consumeOp = true;
15619     // Generate completion notifications for the op?
15620     var completeOp = true;
15621     if (err) {
15622       switch (err) {
15623         case 'defer':
15624           if (++op.tryCount < $syncbase.MAX_OP_TRY_COUNT) {
15625             // Defer the operation if we still want to do the thing, but skip
15626             // deferring if we are now trying to undo the thing.
15627             if (op.serverStatus === 'doing' && op.lifecycle === 'do') {
15628               this._LOG.opDeferred(op.type, op.longtermId);
15629               this._deferOp(account, op);
15630             }
15631             // remove the op from the queue, but don't mark it completed
15632             completeOp = false;
15633           }
15634           else {
15635             op.lifecycle = 'moot';
15636             op.serverStatus = 'moot';
15637           }
15638           break;
15639         case 'aborted-retry':
15640           op.tryCount++;
15641           maybeRetry = true;
15642           break;
15643         default: // (unknown case)
15644           op.tryCount += $syncbase.OP_UNKNOWN_ERROR_TRY_COUNT_INCREMENT;
15645           maybeRetry = true;
15646           break;
15647         case 'failure-give-up':
15648           this._LOG.opGaveUp(op.type, op.longtermId);
15649           // we complete the op, but the error flag is propagated
15650           op.lifecycle = 'moot';
15651           op.serverStatus = 'moot';
15652           break;
15653         case 'moot':
15654           this._LOG.opMooted(op.type, op.longtermId);
15655           // we complete the op, but the error flag is propagated
15656           op.lifecycle = 'moot';
15657           op.serverStatus = 'moot';
15658           break;
15659       }
15660     }
15661     else {
15662       switch (op.serverStatus) {
15663         case 'checking':
15664           // Update the status, and figure out if there is any work to do based
15665           // on our desire.
15666           switch (resultIfAny) {
15667             case 'checked-notyet':
15668             case 'coherent-notyet':
15669               op.serverStatus = null;
15670               break;
15671             case 'idempotent':
15672               if (op.lifecycle === 'do' || op.lifecycle === 'done')
15673                 op.serverStatus = null;
15674               else
15675                 op.serverStatus = 'done';
15676               break;
15677             case 'happened':
15678               op.serverStatus = 'done';
15679               break;
15680             case 'moot':
15681               op.lifecycle = 'moot';
15682               op.serverStatus = 'moot';
15683               break;
15684             // this is the same thing as defer.
15685             case 'bailed':
15686               this._LOG.opDeferred(op.type, op.longtermId);
15687               this._deferOp(account, op);
15688               completeOp = false;
15689               break;
15690           }
15691           break;
15692         case 'doing':
15693           op.serverStatus = 'done';
15694           // lifecycle may have changed to 'undo'; don't mutate if so
15695           if (op.lifecycle === 'do')
15696             op.lifecycle = 'done';
15697           break;
15698         case 'undoing':
15699           op.serverStatus = 'undone';
15700           // this will always be true until we gain 'redo' functionality
15701           if (op.lifecycle === 'undo')
15702             op.lifecycle = 'undone';
15703           break;
15704       }
15705       // If we still want to do something, then don't consume the op.
15706       if (op.lifecycle === 'do' || op.lifecycle === 'undo')
15707         consumeOp = false;
15708     }
15709 
15710     if (maybeRetry) {
15711       if (op.tryCount < $syncbase.MAX_OP_TRY_COUNT) {
15712         // We're still good to try again, but we will need to check the status
15713         // first.
15714         op.serverStatus = 'check';
15715         consumeOp = false;
15716       }
15717       else {
15718         this._LOG.opTryLimitReached(op.type, op.longtermId);
15719         // we complete the op, but the error flag is propagated
15720         op.lifecycle = 'moot';
15721         op.serverStatus = 'moot';
15722       }
15723     }
15724 
15725     if (consumeOp)
15726       serverQueue.shift();
15727 
15728     // Some completeOp callbacks want to wait for account
15729     // save but they are triggered before save is attempted,
15730     // for the account to properly trigger runAfterSaves
15731     // callbacks, so set a flag indicating save state here.
15732     if (accountSaveSuggested)
15733       account._saveAccountIsImminent = true;
15734 
15735     if (completeOp) {
15736       if (this._opCallbacks.hasOwnProperty(op.longtermId)) {
15737         var callback = this._opCallbacks[op.longtermId];
15738         delete this._opCallbacks[op.longtermId];
15739         try {
15740           callback(err, resultIfAny, account, op);
15741         }
15742         catch(ex) {
15743           console.log(ex.message, ex.stack);
15744           this._LOG.opCallbackErr(op.type);
15745         }
15746       }
15747 
15748       // This is a suggestion; in the event of high-throughput on operations,
15749       // we probably don't want to save the account every tick, etc.
15750       if (accountSaveSuggested) {
15751         account._saveAccountIsImminent = false;
15752         account.saveAccountState(null, null, 'serverOp');
15753       }
15754     }
15755 
15756     if (localQueue.length) {
15757       op = localQueue[0];
15758       this._dispatchLocalOpForAccount(account, op);
15759     }
15760     else if (serverQueue.length && this.online && account.enabled) {
15761       op = serverQueue[0];
15762       this._dispatchServerOpForAccount(account, op);
15763     }
15764     else if (this._opCompletionListenersByAccount[account.id]) {
15765       this._opCompletionListenersByAccount[account.id](account);
15766       this._opCompletionListenersByAccount[account.id] = null;
15767     }
15768   },
15769 
15787   _queueAccountOp: function(account, op, optionalCallback) {
15788     // - Name the op, register callbacks
15789     if (op.longtermId === null) {
15790       // mutation job must be persisted until completed otherwise bad thing
15791       // will happen.
15792       op.longtermId = account.id + '/' +
15793                         $a64.encodeInt(account.meta.nextMutationNum++);
15794       account.mutations.push(op);
15795       // Clear out any completed/dead operations that put us over the undo
15796       // threshold.
15797       while (account.mutations.length > MAX_MUTATIONS_FOR_UNDO &&
15798              (account.mutations[0].lifecycle === 'done') ||
15799              (account.mutations[0].lifecycle === 'undone') ||
15800              (account.mutations[0].lifecycle === 'moot')) {
15801         account.mutations.shift();
15802       }
15803     }
15804     else if (op.longtermId === 'session') {
15805       op.longtermId = account.id + '/' +
15806                         $a64.encodeInt(account.meta.nextMutationNum++);
15807     }
15808 
15809     if (optionalCallback)
15810       this._opCallbacks[op.longtermId] = optionalCallback;
15811 
15812     // - Enqueue
15813     var queues = this._opsByAccount[account.id];
15814     // Local processing needs to happen if we're not in the right local state.
15815     if (!this._testModeDisablingLocalOps &&
15816         ((op.lifecycle === 'do' && op.localStatus === null) ||
15817          (op.lifecycle === 'undo' && op.localStatus !== 'undone' &&
15818           op.localStatus !== 'unknown')))
15819       queues.local.push(op);
15820     if (op.serverStatus !== 'n/a' && op.serverStatus !== 'moot')
15821       queues.server.push(op);
15822 
15823     // If there is already something active, don't do anything!
15824     if (queues.active) {
